loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu was born in 1964. She has a normal family, and her husband is an electrical repairman. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has two children, and they do carpentry for a living. Thu raises pigs and is a worker for a farm. She earns 2,000,000 VND every month. She has been doing this for 20 years. Her family’s total income is about 6,500,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA's credit programs since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to expand her farm and buy more electrical-repair tools for her husband's job.

loans.use: To expand her farm and buy more electrical-repair tools for her husband’s job

loans.name: Dua

texts.en:
Dua was born in 1964. She has four children. The two younger children are learning at high school and primary school. The older one has married; the oldest is a hairdresser. Dua’s husband has retired. His pension is 2,000,000 VND per month. 

Dua has a grocery store and gains from it 2,800,000 VND per month. The total earnings of her family is about 6,800,000 VND per month. 

She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her grocery store. Then, she hopes her business can get enough money to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her grocery store.

loans.name: Hector Ivan

texts.es:
Hector es un joven muy luchador que ha trabajador fuertemente en la vida para salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus padres ya que proviene de una familia con muy escasos recursos económicos. Desde hace un tiempo consiguió empleo en una cafetería y trabajando fuertemente ha venido sacando sus padres adelante, ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Ahora, Hector se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 1 año de nacido, y gracias a que el dueño del negocio donde trabajaba le ofreció la gran oportunidad de hacerse dueño de la cafetería, Hector ha venido trabajando fuertemente para poder cumplir con el dinero que debe pagar y así poder tener su propio negocio. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que siempre ha tenido, la fortaleza y el esfuerzo diario que hace en su trabajo le han permitido salir adelante y superar las grandes adversidades que se le presentan; y ahora que tiene la oportunidad, Hector busca un préstamo para comprar comidas fritas y algunos otros insumos que requiere en su cafetería para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es llegar a tener un restaurante y aspira a que lo pueda lograr si sigue trabajando fuertemente. Además, aspira a poder mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus padres, su esposa y su hijo de 1 año.
texts.en:
Héctor’s a very tenacious young man who has worked hard in life to get ahead and to be able to help his parents because he comes from a family of very low economic resources.  Some time ago he got a job working in a cafeteria and through hard work has been moving his parents forward offering them a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities.  

Now, Héctor is married and has a one-year-old son.  The owner of the business he’s employed at has given him the opportunity of buying the cafeteria and Héctor has been working very hard to earn the money he needs to pay for it and thus to have his own business.  Despite the economic difficulties he’s always had his strength and daily efforts at work have made it possible for him to move forward and overcome the great difficulties that arise.  Now that he has this opportunity, Héctor is looking for a loan to buy fried food and some other ingredients he needs in the cafeteria to provide better customer service.  

His greatest dream is to have a restaurant and hopes to do so which is why he continues working hard.  He also hopes to improve his parents’, his wife’s and his one-year-old son’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fried food and ingredients for his snack bar.

loans.name: Maria Yaneth

texts.es:
Maria trabaja en la actividad de la confección desde hace muchos años gracias a que su madre se dedicaba a esta actividad y desde muy joven se la enseñó. Gracias a esto, logró conseguir trabajo en una empresa donde ha trabajado durante los últimos años y debido a que ahora requiere estar al cuidado de sus 2 hijos se vio obligada a dejar su trabajo. Sin embargo, ya que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, Maria ha decidido montar su propio taller de confección en su casa donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros y así poder contribuir económicamente en su hogar. Ya lleva unas semanas trabajando en su taller y debido al poco capital con el que cuenta, busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas e hilos y poder confeccionar los pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es tener un gran taller de confección que le permita sacar su familia adelante y poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Maria has worked as a seamstress for many years, because her mother also worked in this sector and taught her from a young age. Thanks to this, she was able to get work in a business where she worked in recent years. Since she now has to care for her two children, she had to leave her job. However, since her husband's income is not enough to maintain household expenses, Maria has decided to start her own seamstress shop in her home, where she offers sewing services to others and this way she can contribute economically to her household. She has been working in her shop for some weeks and because she has little capital, she is looking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric and thread to be able to sew the orders from her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to have a large sewing shop that will allow her to advance her family and be able to give her two children a better education.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric and thread and to be able to sew the orders from her customers

loans.name: Seb's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Battambang province's Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Seb is a 52-year-old widowed mother of four children. Three of her children are dependent on her; some are in school and some have jobs. 

She has struggled to make a living through rice farming on two hectares of farmland for almost thirty years. Lacking a water supply is still the main challenge for her business. 

Seb's group consists of two members who live in the same village, and this is the second loan with VisionFund for her group. She successfully repaid the first loan, which helped her to better support her family. She is leading her group to ask for a loan; she is seeking 200,000 Riel (KHR) while the other group member is applying for 700,000 KHR. Seb is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Aged 31 years, Yorn is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham provice, Cambodia. She has two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice on two hectares of farmland, planting cassava on 1.5 hectares of farmland, and by raising pigs, which she and her husband have been doing almost ten years. The low price of cassava is the still the main challenge for her business. 

This is Yorn's third loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to relieve her family's burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is request a loan with VisionFund of 4,000,000 Riel (KHR). With this loan, Yorn is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her family to generate more income from the current business so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is a 39-year-old mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

The main source of family’s income is from rice farming on one hectare of farmland.  Her husband supplements the family’s income through fishing.  They have been in this business for almost twenty years. The current business earns her approximately KHR 8,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. Lacking working capital is the main challenge for her business. 

Thorn's group consists of two members who live in the same village of the Kror Kor district, Pursat province. She is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. She successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her business. 

Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. Thorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to buy supplies like detergent, fabric softener and other materials that she uses in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use it to buy some supplies needed in her laundry business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evangeline dreams to open new branches and hopes to get more customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy some supplies for her laundry business

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is 42 years old and lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. He has two sons, both of whom are dependent on him and still in school. 

He has earned a living through farming rice and planting cassava for 22 years to support the family. The current business earns him about 20,000 KHR and lets him to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. The low price of cassava is still the main challenge for his business. 

Thorn’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. He is now in the fifth cycle. He completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him relieve his family’s burden and keep his children’s education. 

Now he is leading his group, consisting of three, to request a loan with VisionFund, Thorn will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor in transplanting rice. 

He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from the current business, so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es:
Maria tiene una gran experiencia en la actividad de la venta de comidas rápidas y con este negocio aporta económicamente en su hogar para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su ella, su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Debido a que su familia tenía grandes dificultades económicas, Maria decidió comenzar con un negocio que le permitiera aportar económicamente en su hogar para mejorar esta situación, y fue así como comenzó a vender comidas rápidas y ahora tiene una gran experiencia y tiene muy buenos clientes. A pesar de que tiene mucho tiempo trabajando en la actividad, la situación económica en su hogar ha sido un poco complicada principalmente porque sus 2 hijos están comenzando sus estudios universitarios y puede aportar para que puedan acceder a ellos, pero esto hace que se descuiden otros aspectos económicos de gran importancia para su hogar. Buscando superar su dificultad de capital, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar una sombrilla grande para su negocio y cubrirlo de las lluvias cuando sea necesario.

De esta manera sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente ya que podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así seguirá saliendo adelante con su familia. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer empleo para las demás personas.
texts.en:
María has much experience in the fast-food business and contributes economically to cover her, her husband’s and her two children’s  household expenses with this business.  Because her family had great economic difficulties, María decided to start a business that would make it possible for her to contribute economically to her household and to improve this situation.  This is how she started selling fast-food and now has vast experience and very good customers.

Despite working in this business for quite some time, the economic situation at home has been a bit complicated especially because her two children have started their university studies and she can contribute so that they can have access to them and this causes other important economic aspects at home to be neglected.  Seeking for find a way to overcome her capital difficulty, María is looking for a loan to buy a large umbrella for her business to shelter it from the rain when necessary.  In this way, sales will increase considerably because she will be able to offer better customer service and continue to move forward with her family.  Her greatest dream is to have a restaurant where she can provide jobs for others.

loans.use: to buy a large umbrella for her business.

loans.name: Soch's Group

texts.en:
Soch is a villager from a rural area of the Kampong Cham province in the Dambae district, Cambodia. She is 63 years old and married. She has six children. To support her family, she has been farming rice and supplementing her income by growing cassava on 1.5 hectares of farmland and sugarcane on two hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for thirty years, she can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. The low price of cassava is the main challenge for her business. 

Soch’s group consists of two members, and this is her second loan with VisionFund. She completely repaid back the past loan, which has helped with her family's needs. Now, she and her group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better  living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Lazokat

texts.ru: Лазокат старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Ей 57 лет она вдова и имеет 6 детей. Ее дети работают, но их зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Лазокат решила помочь детям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур, как пшеница, кукуруза и помидор, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих внуков с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Lazokat is trying to improve her living conditions and her family's finances. She is a 57-year-old widow with 6 children. The children work, but their salaries are insufficient to provide the family with all necessities of life. Lazokat has decided to help her children for the family's benefit. With this in mind, she took the course "Succeed" organized by the Association of Businesswomen and obtained her graduation certificate. Now she is quite capable of starting her own business and becoming successful. Lazokat has decided to focus her business on cultivating crops such as wheat, corn and tomatoes, as she has experience in this area. She plans to use her profits to provide quality food and education to her grandchildren.

Lazokat is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for her new business. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for her new business

loans.name: Bogigul

texts.ru:
Богигул 49 - летняя жительница города Сарбанд. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Богигул имеет среднее образование. У нее имеется богатый опыт в области торговли. 
Богигул намерена заняться своим бизнесом. Она у себя дома хочет открыт продуктовый магазин. Богигул просит кредит для приобретения продуктов и хозяйственных товаров, чтобы открыть свой магазин.
texts.en: Bogigul is a 49-year-old resident of the city of Sarband. She is married and has four children. Bogigul has secondary education and a wealth of experience in retail. She is planning to launch her own business by opening a grocery store in her home. Bogigul is requesting this loan to purchase food products and household goods for her new store.

loans.use: to purchase food and household items for her new grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chair-making supplies.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn, who is 50 years old, lives with her four children in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother. 

She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice, raising pigs, planting cassava, and supplementing family’s income by distilling alcohol. She has been in this business for twenty years. She can earn about KHR 40,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. The main challenge for her business is the low price of cassava in the market.

Yorn received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. 

Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Yorn will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland and a portion of it to buy the pig's feed. 

She hopes to sell the cassava and pig for a good price in the market, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland and the pig's feed.

loans.name: Alberto Manuel

texts.es:
Alberto siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido salir adelante junto a su familia a pesar de las grandes dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Alberto se encuentra casado y tiene 5 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar el acceso a una educación de buena calidad, por esto ha trabajado fuertemente en busca de mejores condiciones económicas para su hogar. Hace mucho tiempo trabajaba como empleado y durante un tiempo también trabajó para un familiar; allí aprendió la actividad de la venta de productos de la canasta familiar y con unos ahorros y un gran esfuerzo montó su propia tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar. Desde que tiene su tienda, hace unos pocos años, la calidad de vida en su hogar ha mejorado considerablemente, y a pesar de que no cuenta con un gran capital y aún le faltan muchos productos para ofrecer a los clientes, su gran esfuerzo ha permitido que su negocio salga adelante y cada vez siga creciendo. Ya que no cuenta con un gran capital, y buscando ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes, Alberto busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.

Su sueño es salir con este negocio adelante y así poderles ofrecer a sus 5 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejores posibilidades económicas para progresar. Además, sueña con que este negocio siga creciendo para que en un futuro pueda ser un negocio de trascendencia familiar y sus hijos tengan un trabajo estable.
texts.en:
Alberto has always been noted for being very hardworking; this has allowed him and his family to carry on despite the great difficulties that have presented themselves in his life. Alberto is married and has five children to whom he has always wanted to offer access to high-quality education. That's why he has worked hard to seek better economic conditions for his household. 

A long time ago, he worked as an employee, and for a while he also worked for a relative. There, he learned the business of selling groceries and everyday household goods. Since he got his own store a few years ago, the quality of life in his household has improved considerably. Despite the fact that he doesn't have a great deal of capital and he still lacks many products that he could offer his customers, his hard work has kept his business open and growing. 

Since he doesn't have much capital, and wants to offer a greater variety of products to his customers, Alberto is seeking a loan to buy more inventory and be able to offer his customers more variety. His dream is to carry on with his business and be able to offer his five children a better quality of life and better opportunities to progress economically. In addition, he dreams of his business continuing to grow so that in the future the store can remain in the family and his children will have stable work.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his general store so he can offer his customers a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz estudió durante 3 años el oficio de la peluquería y trabajó en un salón de belleza durante un largo tiempo, pero hace unos meses decidió independizarse y montar su propio salón de belleza para poder tener mejores condiciones económicas en su hogar y así apoyar a sus padres para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Es así como ha salido adelante con su salón de belleza donde ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes y gracias a esto su calidad de vida ha mejorado considerablemente. Gracias a que cada vez viene creciendo más, Beatriz busca ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio; es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar herramientas de trabajo para su peluquería y poder prestar un servicio de mejor calidad.

Su sueño es poder tener un gran salón de belleza donde pueda generar empleo para muchas personas y desde el cual logre sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz studied hairstyling for three years and worked in a beauty salon for a long time but a few months ago decided to become independent and open her own beauty salon in order to have better economic conditions at home and thus help her parents to have a better quality of lie.
She’s been getting ahead with her beauty salon and has won over a large number of customers.  Thanks to this her quality of life has improved considerably.  Thanks to her constant growth, Beatriz wants to offer better customer service and that’s why she’s looking for financing to buy work tools for her beauty salon to provide better quality service.  Her dream is to have a large beauty salon where she can generate employment for many people and to be able to support her family through it.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond is in his fifties and lives in the east central part of Albania. He has been receiving just a small disability income for some time now that hasn’t been enough, according to him. However, the little business Edmond has been having on the side, has provided a very little profit for himself and his paralyzed mother, just enough to have basic food on the table. 

For the past ten something years, Edmond has been working as a street vendor selling small things in the streets. Now he plans to buy more vending supplies, snacks and other items, that will increase his profit. To achieve this, Edmond is requesting a loan from Kiva. At the same time, Edmond is seeking lenders' assistance in this matter.

loans.use: To buy more vending supplies & snacks for sale

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy.   She previously received a PHP 20,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Daisy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future by working hard on her business.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan Guillermo se dedica a la producción de productos agrícolas orgánicos y al levante de animales, como gallinas y pollos; dicha actividad la heredó de su padre quien desde muy joven se la enseñó y esto ha permitido que tenga una gran experiencia en la actividad. Con este negocio genera los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para sostener los gastos que allí se derivan, y también poder ofrecerle a su hijo de 9 años una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Gracias a que su negocio viene creciendo, las dificultades económicas que padecían en su hogar se han venido superando, y ahora también tiene una gran cantidad de gallinas y pollos que, debido a que tiene un galpón muy pequeño debe dejar por fuera sin encerrar. Buscando mejorar esta situación, Juan Guillermo busca un préstamo para adecuar un galpón más grande donde quepan todas las gallinas y los pollos y poder seguir ofreciendo una buena calidad a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es que este negocio salga adelante y su hijo pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan Guillermo produces organic agricultural goods and raises animals, such as hens and chickens. He learned this work from his father, who taught him about it from the time Juan Guillermo was very young, which has given him great experience. The business generates the income Juan Guillermo needs to meet his household expenses, and also to offer a good quality of life and access to education for his nine-year-old son. Thanks to the fact that his business continues to grow, he has been able to overcome the economic difficulties he used to have at home, and now he has a lot of hens and chickens. Because the shed is very small, Juan Guillermo has to leave them outside. In order to improve this situation, Juan Guillermo is asking for a loan to build a larger shed with room for all the hens and chickens, also allowing him to offer better quality to his clients. His greatest dream is that the business will continue to grow, and that his son can achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a larger shed with room for all the hens and chickens, and to be able to offer better quality to his clients.

loans.name: Erika Julieth

texts.es:
Erika es una joven emprendedora que desde hace unos años montó una tienda general en busca de mejorar la condición económica que tenía en su hogar cuando convivía con sus padres. Ahora que se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos, esta es una fuente de ingresos que le permite contribuir económicamente junto con su esposo para que en su hogar puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar. A pesar de que no cuenta con un gran capital, su negocio lo ha sacado adelante con un gran esfuerzo y esto le ha permitido venir aumentando la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Debido a que en el sector le han puesto mucha competencia abriendo tiendas de este mismo tipo, Erika requiere diferenciarse de la competencia para poder conservar sus clientes; es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar con los que pueda diversificar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes y así superar la competencia que le han puesto en el sector.

Su mayor sueño es brindarle a sus 2 hijos una educación de buena calidad y poderles ofrecer un futuro económico estable con el que puedan salir adelante. También sueña con que su negocio crezca y en un futuro pueda ser una fuente de ingresos que les permita progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Erika is a young entrepreneur who opened a general store a few years ago looking to improve the economic condition her household had when she lived with her parents.  Now that she’s married and  has two children, this is a source of income that allows her to help her husband maintain a better quality of life at home and to have better opportunities for economic progress.  

Despite not having much capital, her business has moved forward thanks to her great effort and she’s been increasing the variety of products she has available for her customers.  Because she’s gotten much competition with similar stores opening up locally, Erika wants to stand out from the competition in order to retain her customers which is why she’s seeking a loan to buy basic staple items to diversify her inventory of products on sale to her customers to overcome the competition that’s arisen in her neighborhood.

Her greatest dream is to provide her two children with a quality education and a future that’s economically stable so that they can get ahead.  She also dreams with her business growing and in future becoming a source of income that will allow them to progress economically.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор уже один раз пользовался кредитом от КИВА. За счет этого кредита Виктор смог закупить инструмент для производства мебели – купил компрессор и пневмостеплер. Это оборудование помогло облегчить труд, а качество производимой мебели сразу улучшилось на порядок. Более того, Виктор смог также приобрести оборудование для изготовления тентов – теперь он со своими работниками также изготавливает тенты для грузовых автомобилей. Со времени получения последнего кредита от КИВА Виктор с семьей смог также закончить ремонт и переехал в свой дом, до этого семья жила на квартире. Теперь гораздо больше места для всех, так как семья большая. Виктор также расширил и свой бизнес – он арендовал большой склад с большим цехом для работы и большим двором. Теперь хватает места и для мебели, и для склада, и есть где заниматься тентовкой автомобилей.  
Виктор планирует вложить следующий кредит от КИВА в размере 10 000 гривен в закупку дополнительной партии материала для бизнеса, а именно поролона, тканей, дерева и других расходных материалов. Кредит даст возможность иметь запас материала, а не ждать, когда он поступит. Соответственно, за счет полученных средств от КИВА Виктор ускорит выполнение заказов. Осенью всегда больше заказов и он хочет подготовиться. Основной трудностью для себя в работе считает процесс поиска и обучения новых работников, так как обучение зачастую занимает долгое время, а многие в итоге бросают работу.
texts.en:
Viktor has already received one loan from Kiva. Using these funds, he was able to purchase tools for manufacturing furniture - an air compressor and a pneumatic stapler. This equipment has made work easier, and also improved the quality of the final product by an order of magnitude. Furthermore, Viktor was able to buy tools for manufacturing tents - now he and his staff can make tarpaulins for trucks. Since receiving his last loan from Kiva, Viktor and his family have finished home repairs and moved into their own house, while previously they lived in an apartment. Now everyone in their large family has more space. Finally, Viktor also expanded his business - he rented a large workshop with a big yard, which has given him enough space for making both furniture and tarpaulins.

Viktor is planning to invest his next Kiva loan of 10 000 hryvnia into purchasing additional materials for his business, namely foam, fabric, wood and other consumables. The loan will enable him to keep stocks of such materials on hand, instead of always waiting for them to arrive. Accordingly, with these Kiva funds Viktor will accelerate the turnaround of his orders. Fall is a busy time for orders, and he wants to be ready. Viktor considers that the main obstacle in his work is finding and training new employees, as the training takes a long time, while many people eventually leave the job.

loans.use: to purchase additional foam, fabric, wood and other consumables for his furniture making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a special sewing machine that will help her increase production and respond to larger customer orders.

loans.name: Martha Marleny

texts.es:
Medellín

Martha es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de uso personal y con esto ha contribuido económicamente junto con su esposo para brindar en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Anteriormente tenía una distribuidora donde podía generar empleo y ayudaba a otras personas, pero debido a circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad se vio en la obligación de cerrarla y comenzar desde cero con la venta de los productos. Fue así como comenzó  a ofrecer productos de uso personal a sus clientes y a pesar de que ha tenido algunos problemas de capital ha logrado salir adelante trabajando fuertemente. Buscando responder a unos grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes, Martha busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es sacar su familia adelante brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Además, sueña con abrir nuevamente su distribuidora y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Medellín

Martha is a very hardworking person who has overcome great adversities that have arisen in her life.  She’s spent a great part of her life selling personal use products and this has contributed economically with her husband to provide their home with better quality of life for their children.

She used to have a distributorship where she was able to generate employment and she helped other people but due to circumstances beyond her control she had to close it and start from zero selling products.  This is how she started offering personal use products to her customers and despite having some problems with capital has managed to get ahead by working hard.  She has large pending customer orders she’d like to fill so Martha is looking for financing to buy personal use products to respond to these large, pending customer orders she has.

Her greatest dream is to move her family forward by providing them a good quality of life and better opportunities for economic progress.  She also dreams with opening her distributorship again to generate employment for people most in need.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Edigio

texts.es:
Edigio se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos de su hogar trabaja como vigilante en una estación de energía, pero debido a que los ingresos que allí genera no son suficientes, ha decidido iniciar un negocio alterno con el cual pueda generar ingresos que contribuyan a que en su hogar tengan mejores condiciones económicas. Fue así como hace unos meses inició el negocio de crianza y venta de ganado y gracias al cual las condiciones en su hogar han venido mejorando y ahora su esposa y su hijo tienen la posibilidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida. Buscando satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, Edigio busca un préstamo que le permita comprar un ternero y así responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante este negocio alterno a su trabajo y poder seguir generando ingresos con los cuales pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en:
Edigio is married and has a seven-year-old son. To generate the income for his household, he works as a security guard in a power sub-station.  However the salary that he earns there is not sufficient, so he has decided to start an alternate business with which he will be able to generate income to contribute to his household and to be in better financial condition. 

This is how, some months ago, he started the business of raising and selling livestock.  Thanks to this his household conditions have been improving.  Now his wife and son have the chance to have a better quality of life.

Looking to fill his customers’ orders, Edigio turns to a loan that will allow him to buy a calf.  This way he will respond to the large orders from his customers.

His biggest dream is to get this alternate business ahead and to be able to have a better quality of life.   He also wants to provide better financial opportunities to his family.

loans.use: To buy a calf in order to start his own business producing milk.

loans.name: Libia Marcela

texts.es:
Libia es una joven emprendedora que aprovechó los conocimientos que adquirió cuando trabajaba en almacenes por temporada vendiendo ropa para montar su propio negocio de venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio lo montó con unos ahorros que tenía y poco a poco gracias a su esfuerzo fue creciendo y ahora tiene muy buenos clientes. Actualmente con este negocio aporta económicamente junto con su esposo para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde conviven con su hija de 3 años de edad. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que ha tenido, el esfuerzo que hace diariamente en su negocio le ha permitido seguir creciendo y ahora tiene la posibilidad de buscar un préstamo para comprar una vitrina y comprar ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.

Su sueño es seguir con este negocio y que crezca para algún día llegar a abrir un almacén que le permita generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. Además, aspira a que en su hogar puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Libia’s a young entrepreneur who took advantage of skills she acquired working in a store seasonally selling clothes to set up her own business selling articles of clothing.  She started the business with some savings sshe had and gradually, thanks to her efforts, it’s been growing and now she has very good customers.  She’s able to help her husband economically to cover expenses for her household where they live with their three-year-old daughter.  Despite the economic difficulties she’s had, the daily effort she puts into her business has made it possible for her to continue to grow and now she has the opportunity of obtaining financing to buy a display case and clothes to offer more variety to her customers.

Her dream is to stay in business so that it will grow and someday be able to open a store to generate employment for the most needy people.  Also, she hopes to have a better quality of life at home and better opportunities for economic progress.

loans.use: to buy clothes and a display case.

loans.name: Luceriana

texts.en:
This is Luceriana, who previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings have been a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Luceriana is requesting a new loan for 40,000 PHP to pay for spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely continue to help her sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luceriana hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah, who previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Sarah is requesting another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely continue to help her sustain her daily needs and meet the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sarah hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 45 años de edad y es madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 4 hijos, pues el padre de sus hijos los abandonó hace un tiempo sin hacer alguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento y esto ha hecho que las dificultades económicas en su hogar se hayan aumentado. Anteriormente Marilu trabajaba en una tipografía donde duró unos 14 años, pero debido a que allí no podía generar ingresos iguales a los que necesitaba para sostener los gastos del hogar por ella sola, decidió comenzar su propio negocio y con mucho esfuerzo poder generar los ingresos que requería en su hogar. Fue así como comenzó su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas que a pesar de haberlo iniciado con muy bajo capital, el gran esfuerzo que hace diariamente le ha permitido salir adelante y posicionarlo poco a poco. Hace un año aproximadamente que comenzó con su negocio y la calidad de vida en su hogar ha mejorado para el bienestar de sus hijos, pero debido a que aún cuenta con dificultades económicas, Marilu busca un préstamo para comprar utensilios para su trabajo, y un poco de publicidad para su negocio.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Además, sueña con tener un local propio para su negocio donde pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así poder crecer para progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Marilu, 45, is a single mother and the head-of-household for her 4 children. The children's father abandoned them without any financial support some time ago, and the family's financial situation has become more difficult. Previously, Marilu had worked in a print shop for 14 years. Since that job did not generate enough money to meet household expenses, she decided to open her own business with a lot of effort in order to earn the necessary income. Though she started her fast food business with little capital, the effort she puts in each day has slowly positioned the business and made it prosper in the market. In the year since she began her business, the family's situation and her children's quality of life have improved, though they still have financial problems.

Marilu is seeking a loan to buy tools and some advertising for her business. She dreams of growing her business, which will allow her to give her children a better life and a good education. She also dreams of having her own store where she can give her customers better service, grow her business, and make financial progress.

loans.use: to buy tools and some advertising for her business.

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
Les presento a Mery, la Presidenta del Grupo Trabajando en Armonia.

Mery es costurera hace 20 años. Inicialmente quería estudiar idiomas; pero sus amigas que se dedican al oficio de la costurería la incentivaron a que también lo aprenda. Así ha empezado, ayudándolas con servicios pequeños, hasta que logró tener su propio negocio. Actualmente Mery tiene un taller dentro de su casa donde hace arreglos de ropa y ropa a medida. A este trabajo dedica aproximadamente 5 horas diarias en las tardes.
Por las mañanas, Mery tiene un trabajo voluntario en el “Vaso de Leche” de su localidad. “Vaso de Leche” es un programa gubernamental que brinda desayunos a niños y ancianos de escasos recursos. Mery, junto a otras señoras, realiza la preparación de esos desayunos. Este programa recibe del Gobierno solo la leche, pero para ofrecer un desayuno completo a los niños, Mery y sus compañeras se han organizado para comprar panes y otros complementos.
Mery va a utilizar una parte de su préstamo para arreglar una máquina de coser y el resto para comprar telas.
Mery es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Dos de ellos siguen carreras superiores en Universidad y los dos más pequeños están en la escuela.
En futuro, a Mery le gustaría tener un taller con atención al público y contratar otras personas para trabajar con ella, así que espera poder seguir con Edaprospo para lograr su objetivo.
¡Mery les agradece su apoyo!

*Mery es la Sra. que viste chompa crema y chaleco verde.
texts.en:
Meet Mery, the president of the Trabajando en Armonia group.  Mery has worked as a seamstress for 20 years.  Initially she wanted to study languages, but her friends were working in sewing and they encouraged her to learn it too.  She started by helping them with small services and grew to have her own business.  Currently, Mery has a workshop in her home where she does clothing repairs and makes clothing to order.  She spends about five hours each afternoon doing this work.  

In the mornings, Mery has a volunteer job at the Vaso de Leche in her town.  Vaso de Leche (Glass of Milk) is a government program that provides breakfast to children and seniors with few resources.  Mery helps to prepare the breakfasts along with other women.  The program receives only milk from the government, so to be able to offer the children a full breakfast, Mery and her friends have organized to purchase bread and other items.  

Mery will use a part of this loan to fix a sewing machine and the rest to purchase fabric.  

Mery is married and has four children.  Two of them are studying at the university and the other two are in school.  In the future, Mery would like to have a store that is open to the public and hire people to work with her.  She hopes to continue working with Edaprospo to achieve her goal.  Mery is thankful for your support!

*Mery is the woman wearing the cream sweater and green vest.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine and purchase fabric.

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
Jose es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido salir adelante a pesar de las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde muy joven aprendió junto a su padre la actividad de la agricultura gracias a que este se dedicaba a esta actividad, y ahora gracias a la experiencia puede sacar cultivos de muy buena calidad. Jose tiene un cultivo de verduras con el cual genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su esposa y sus 4 hijos, y a pesar de que han padecido grandes dificultades económicas, con su esfuerzo ha venido sacando su familia adelante brindándoles una buena calidad de vida. Buscando sacar adelante su cultivo y preservarlo del clima, Jose busca un préstamo para comprar semillas, riegos y abonos y poder sacar productos de buena calidad para venderlos a un buen precio.

Su sueño es tener un gran cultivo que le permita tener una estabilidad económica para su familia y también poderles brindar a sus 4 hijos una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
José is a person who has always stood out for being very hardworking.  This has allowed him to get ahead despite the great adversities that have arisen in his life.  Since he was very young he worked in agriculture alongside his father since he was in this occupation.  Thanks to his experience he’s able to produce very good quality crops.  José grows vegetables with which he generates income to support his wife and four children and despite having gone through great economic difficulties, he’s been able to gradually move his family forward thanks to his work and has provided them with a good quality of life.  

Seeking to move his crops forward and protect them from the weather, José needs a loan to buy seeds, irrigation supplies and manure to produce good quality products and sell them at a good price.  

His dream is to have great crops that will allow for economic stability for his family and also to be able to provide his four children with a better quality education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
Jose se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida para su hogar, y para generar los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de su familia, tiene una carpintería desde hace un tiempo que decidió montar su propio negocio. Anteriormente trabajaba en una carpintería, pero debido a que sentía que no le pagaban lo necesario para poder sostener los gastos de su familia, decidió montar su propio negocio y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante su propio negocio y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha venido teniendo muy buenos pedidos, y esto ha hecho que las dificultades económicas de su hogar se hayan ido superando poco a poco. Ahora que tiene muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder responder, Jose busca un préstamo para comprar materias primas para fabricar los pedidos de sus clientes y poder seguir generando sus ingresos.

Su sueño es sacar este taller adelante y que este le permita tener una buena calidad de vida para su familia y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Además, aspira a que sus 3 hijos tengan la oportunidad de ingresar a una educación de mejor calidad y en un futuro acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
José’s married and has three children who he’s always wanted to provide a good quality of life for.  To generate household income to support his family, he has had a carpentry shop for some time since he decided to open his own business.  He used to be employed in a carpentry shop and decided to open his own business that he’s managed to move forward with much effort and provide his family with a better quality of life.  

Thanks to the good quality of the goods he produces he’s gotten very good orders and this has led to his household’s economic difficulties gradually diminish.  Now that he has very good pending customer orders he does not have sufficient capital to respond to them so José is looking for a loan to buy raw materials to fill customer orders and continue generating income.

His dream is to move his shop forward and that it allows him to have a good quality of life for his family and better opportunities for economic progress.  He also hopes that his three children will have the opportunity of enrolling in a better quality education and in future have access to the university.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi vit avec son mari mécanicien et leurs 05 enfants à Lomé. Trois sont sur les bancs de l’école. Elle est restauratrice et revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle est aidée par 03 personnes et exerce l’activité à la devanture de sa maison. Afin d’acheter du porc pour sa restauration, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt. Elle veut avoir d’autres lieux d’activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a démarré l’activité en 2004.
texts.en: Afi lives with her husband, a mechanic, and her five children in Lomé.  Three of her children attend school. She runs a restaurant and sells general grocery products.  She has three people who help her and conducts her business in front of her home.  In order to buy pork for her restaurant, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES.  She wants to open other locations for her business and to be able to meet the needs of her family.  She started her business in 2004.

loans.use: to buy pork for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dagoberto Margarito

texts.es:
Don Dagoberto sigue dando su servicio de taxi, obteniendo mejores utilidades ya que es de su propiedad, aunque ahora tiene menos ganancias, ya que la gasolina está muy cara, y se cobra un poco más la carrera, estando la demanda baja,  ganando para el sustento del día. Su esposa es ama de casa sus hijos, dos casados y una estudia, para él la mejora a su vivienda es de prioridad, ya que a través de financiamiento otorgados le ha sido posible la mejora a su taxi,  y con este nuevo préstamo terminara de cerrar un cuarto, comprara puerta y embaldosado.
Comprara: diez laminas de playcem, clavos, puerta, arena y cemento para comenzar la obra y el objetivo al mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dagoberto continues providing his taxi service. He's making a better profit since it's his own taxi, although he is earning less now since gasoline is very expensive. He is charging a little more per ride, since demand is low, to earn a daily living. His wife is a housewife. Two of his children are married, and one is in school. 

For Dagoberto, improving his home is his priority, since through the [prior] loan that was granted, he was able to make improvements to his taxi; with this new loan, he will finish closing in a room, buy a door, and lay tile. He will buy ten sheets of Plycem [a cement fiber plywood substitute], nails, a door, sand, and cement to start the work, with the objective of improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish closing in a room and improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es:
Gerardo es una persona muy trabajadora que ha luchador fuertemente para poder sacar su familia adelante y ofrecerles una buena calidad de vida. Desde hace mucho tiempo tiene una tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar, y de esta manera genera los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos en su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Debido a que hace unos meses tuvo un gran problema de salud, su negocio se quedó sin abrir durante un gran tiempo, pero ahora que se ha recuperado y tiene la oportunidad de generar nuevamente los ingresos para su hogar, Gerardo busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su tienda que tiene muy poco inventario.

De esta manera Gerardo espera poder superar la gran dificultad económica que tiene actualmente su familia, pues no había quién generara ingresos durante un tiempo. Su sueño es poder es tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a very hardworking person who struggles mightily to be able to move his family forward and offer them a better quality of life.  He’s had a general store for some time now where he offers his customers basic staples thus generating income needed to cover expenses at home where he lives with his wife and three children.   

Because a few months ago he had a serious health problem his business remained closed for a long time but now that he’s recovered he can once again start to generate household income.  Gerardo is looking for financing to buy basic staples to stock his store because he has very little available inventory.

In this way, Gerardo will be able to overcome the great economic difficulty his family currently has because he hadn’t been able to generate income for some time.  His dream is to be able to have better quality of life for his family and better opportunities to make economic progress.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise to increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria se dedicó a la actividad de la confección durante 10 años trabajando en una empresa de confección y gracias a la experiencia adquirida ha logrado montar su propio taller de confección el cual tiene desde hace 4 años y donde ofrece a sus clientes el servicio de confección a terceros. Con este taller, las condiciones económicas de su hogar han mejorado considerablemente y han podido venir superando poco a poco las dificultades que tenían anteriormente. A pesar de que en su taller puede generar empleo para 2 personas que tienen grandes necesidades, la capacidad de producción de su taller no alcanza a responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes; es por esto que Gloria busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora que le permita aumentar la capacidad de producción de su taller.

Su sueño es tener un gran taller que sea muy rentable y le permita tener mejores condiciones económicas en su hogar para tener una mejor calidad con su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria has been in the sewing business for ten years, working for a dressmaking company.  Thanks the the experience she acquired, she has managed to establish her own sewing shop, where she offers her sewing services.  She has had the shop for four years.  With this shop her household financial conditions have improved considerably.  They have been able to gradually overcome the difficulties that they had.

Even though her shop is able to generate employment for two people with great need, the production capacity of her shop is not enough to respond to the large customer orders she has.  That is why Gloria is looking for a loan to buy an overlock machine that will allow her to increase her shop’s production capacity.

Her dream is to have a large shop that is very profitable.  She dreams that it will allow her to have better financial conditions in her household in order to have a better quality of life with her husband and her children.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine that will allow her to increase the production capacity of her shop.

loans.name: Dulce Angelica

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú!

Les presento a Dulce, una jovencita de 20 años que vive con su familia. Dulce estudia la carrera de Derecho en una universidad Peruana. Ella ha elegido esta carrera porque quiere ayudar a las personas cuyos derechos han sido vulnerados. Dulce empezó sus estudios hace 2 años y le va muy bien porque es una señorita bastante dedicada. Aunque aún le faltan 3 años para culminar sus estudios ya se plantea hacer su maestría en otro país (este es su mayor objetivo).

El préstamo le servirá para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad.

Dulce está muy emocionada por saber que personas de todo el mundo le van a apoyar en sus estudios, principalmente sin conocerla. ¡Dulce le agradece su apoyo!
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!

I present to you Dulce, a young 20-year-old girl who lives with her family. Dulce studies Law at a Peruvian university. She has chosen this course of study because she wants to help people whose rights have been violated.  Dulce began her studies two years ago and has done very well because she is a very dedicated young lady. Although she still has three years left to finish her studies, she is already considering studying for her Master’s degree in another country (this is her greatest objective).

This loan will help her to pay her university’s monthly costs.

Dulce is very excited to know that people from all over the world will support her in her studies, mainly because they do not know her. Dulce thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to pay her university’s monthly costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables and grocery items.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Ayda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de verduras y frutas desde hace 7 años. Este negocio lo ha ido mejorando gracias a su ardua labor y los créditos.
La meta de Ayda es aumentarlo y progresar.
texts.en:
Ayda is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has earned her living for the past seven years by selling fruits and vegetables. This business has been getting better thanks to her hard work and the loans.

Ayda's goal is to progress and grow in her business.

loans.use: to purchase manioc, cabbage, tomatoes, mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Thav

texts.en:
Thav is 24 years old and married, with two young children.  Together with her spouse and children, she lives in Anlong Thma village, Baray district, Kompong Tom province. 

Thav and her spouse are working at their plantation where they earn a suitable income for daily food and other commodities costs. They plan to enroll their children in a local school in the next few years, when they are ready. Thav has been doing farming since she was a teenager, living with her parents.

To better her farm work and ensure healthy crops, Thav needs a few laborers to help manage the maintenance of the plantation. Because of the shortage of funds, she would like to take out a loan of 500,000 KHR to pay for the labor costs. She hopes to complete her farm work on time and also hopes to have a fruitful harvest in this coming season. 

Thav will save a portion of her profit for the future education of her two children. She wants them to earn a bachelor's degree and have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Restauratrice de profession, madame Amélé est mère de 03 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. L’ainé a 15ans et le dernier 09ans. Son conjoint est comptable. Elle exerce son activité à domicile et rencontre par moment la mévente. Elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter des boissons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, devenir une grande restauratrice et assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. Amélé runs a restaurant and is the mother of three children, all of whom attend school.   The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 9.  Her husband is an accountant.  She runs her business from her home and at times she can have low sales.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy drinks.  She would like to reinvest in her business, become a well-known restaurateur, and to assure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha venido sacando adelante su propio negocio el cual inició hace 3 años para buscar unas mejores condiciones económicas en su hogar. Anteriormente trabajaba como empleada en una venta de licores y con el salario que ganaba aportaba económicamente en su hogar junto con su esposo, pero esto no era suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que acuden a una educación universitaria. Es por esto que Amelia decidió esforzarse y con unos pequeños ahorros que tenía inició su propio negocio de venta de licores el cual gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante e ir superando las dificultades que se le presentan, principalmente la falta de capital para surtir. Gracias a que ha tenido buenas ventas, Amelia busca un préstamo para comprar licores y surtir su negocio con productos que ya se han ido agotando.

De esta manera podrá superar la dificultad de capital que tiene en su negocio y así seguirá teniendo unos ingresos que le permitan ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos el acceso a la educación universitaria. Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio con el que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica que les permita progresar.
texts.en:
Amelia’s a very hardworking person who has been moving her own business forward with much effort. She started it three years ago looking for better economic conditions for her home.  She used to work as an employee selling liquor and contributed her salary to help her husband cover household expenses but this was insufficient to cover all costs at home where she lives with her husband and three children who are currently attending university.  

Because of this, Amelia decided to make the effort and use a little saving she had to start her own business selling liquor and thanks to her efforts she’s managed to move it forward and gradually overcome the economic difficulties that have arisen, especially the lack of capital to restock.  Thanks the good sales she’s had, Amelia is looking for financing to buy liquor to stock her store with products that she’s been running out of.

In this way she will be able to overcome the problem of lack of business capital and will continue to earn income that will make it possible to continue to offer her three children access to a university education.  Her dream is to have a great business through which her family can have a better quality of life and economic stability that will allow for economic progress.

loans.use: to buy liquor to stock her store.

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es:
Les presento a Myrian, un de los 10 miembros del Grupo Unión Progreso. Myrian tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo pequeño.

Myrian se dedica a la venta de productos como panes, alfajores, bizcochuelos, entre otros. Trabaja por pedidos ya que por el momento no cuenta con un establecimiento propio. De esta manera, Myrian puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y al mismo tiempo estar cerca de su niño que es aún pequeño. Gracias a su trabajo, a logrado comprar un mototaxi que alquila para obtener un ingreso extra.

Con el préstamo Myrian va a comprar más productos como bizcochuelos, alfajores, kekes, tartas de manzana y panes molde, para vender a sus clientes.

El sueño de Myrian es alquilar un stand en un lugar comercial donde pueda exhibir sus productos. 

Myrian es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo blanco y casaca morada. ¡Myrian le agradece el apoyo brindado!

Nota: En la fotografía también sale Jenny, una socia pasiva que el siguiente ciclo se está reincorporando al grupo. Ella es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste casaca blanca y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Myrian is one of the ten members of the communal bank "Grupo Unión Progreso."  She is 27, married, and has a small son. She sells baked goods such as breads, biscuits, sponge cakes, and so forth. She makes products to order because she doesn't have her own store. This way she can help her husband pay the household expenses and, at the same time, be near her young son. Thanks to this work, she was able to buy a motor taxi, which she rents out for extra income.

Myrian will use this loan to buy sponge cakes, biscuits, cakes, apple tarts, and sandwich bread to sell to her customers. Her dream is to have a store where she can merchandise her goods. Myrian appears in the photo in the second position on the right and is wearing a white shirt and purple sweater. She is grateful for the support offered. 

Note: Jenny, an inactive member who also appears in the photo, will rejoin the communal bank the next loan cycle. She is second from the left and is wearing a white sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to buy sponge cakes, biscuits, cakes, apple tarts, and sandwich bread.

loans.name: Morry

texts.en:
This is Morry, a 46-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines who is married to the self-employed Ramon. At this time, Ramon is working hard to meet their living expenses.

Morry is a coconut vendor. Most coconuts in the Philippines are sold by street vendors pushing deep wooden carts. The coconut is served either for its juice wherein one end is cut and a straw placed in it, or with the juice and the edible part of the coconut placed into a plastic container with a straw. Regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. Vendors earn a minimum of Php 200 per day.

To help continue operations of her business, Morry is requesting a Php 12,000 loan to buy tires for the cart, wood, coconuts, nails, paint, and a cooling container. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Morry hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of coconut needed in her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina, resident of Manila, Philippines. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cristina retails processed meat products. What she basically does is buy processed meat products from wholesalers and then she sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can range from ham, hotdogs, and processed pork to other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cristina hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of frozen foods needed in her business.

loans.name: Alidou

texts.fr: Mr Alidou est homme âgé de 44ans. Il est marié à une couturière et ils ont 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Ils ont âgés de 12 et 07ans. Après son apprentissage en mécanique auto, il a ouvert son atelier en 2000 et est aidée par 02 personnes. Il est à son troisième crédit à WAGES et ce montant lui servira à acheter des pièces détachées d’occasion. Il veut agrandir son activité et permettre l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Mr. Alidou is 44 years old.  He is married to a clothes maker and they have two children who attend school.  They are 12 and 7 years old.  After his apprenticeship in auto mechanics, he opened a workshop in 2000.  He has two people who help him.  He is on his third loan with WAGES and this loan will allow him to buy used spare parts.  He wants to grow his business and to see his family thrive.

loans.use: to buy used spare parts.

loans.name: Las Soñadoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS SOÑADORAS,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Ritha tiene 49 años, y dos hijos que son de las edades de 20 y 11 años,  La Sra. Ritha se dedica  a la   venta utencillos de cocina en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de el torno,  donde ofrece variedad de  productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Ritha va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería en utencillos de cocina por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ritha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  productos, la Sra. Ritha es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank LAS SOÑADORAS [The Dreamers] has eight members, six women and two men. The bank's president Ritha is 49 and has two children, ages 20 and 11. Ritha sells a variety of cooking utensils from her stand located in her neighborhood. This will be her first loan with the institution.  

She will use the loan to buy wholesale cooking utensils, thereby offering her customers a range of products and increasing her profits. She is requesting the loan so that she can keep improving her business and will use the profits to buy more merchandise. Ritha is a hardworking person and is happy to have this opportunity for herself and her group because in some instances the members are the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cooking utensils.

loans.name: Marius

texts.fr: Commerçant de produits d’alimentation générale, Marius est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Il désire acheter plus de marchandises, c’est pour cela, il sollicite de WAGES un second prêt pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Il voudrait à l’avenir agrandir son activité et se marier.
texts.en: Marius sells general grocery products.  He is single and has no children in his care. He wants to buy more merchandise, and he is requesting his second loan through WAGES in order to buy general grocery products.  In the future, he would like to grow his business and to marry.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина уже 18 лет плодотворно занимается торговлей в своем родном городе Новая Каховка. Она торгует женской джинсовой одеждой на одном из местных рынков. Особо хорошо у нее расходятся джинсовые юбки, куртки и сами джинсы. 

Ирине необходимы дополнительные финансовые средства в размере 22 000 гривен для того, чтобы оптом закупить осенне-зимнюю джинсовую одежду, а именно брюки, пиджаки, куртки, рубашки и юбки, а также оборудовать торговое место – построить и отделать небольшой бутик. Ирина готова планомерно вкладывать полученные от бизнеса средства в поступательное развитие своего дела. Она имеет достаточный опыт торговли, товар у нее всегда качественный и ходовой, цены умеренные, и круг постоянных клиентов тоже имеется.
texts.en:
Irina has been fruitfully engaged in retail for the past 18 years in her home town of Novaya Kahovka. She sells women's denim clothing at one of the local markets. Her best-selling items are denim skirts and jackets, as well as jeans. 

Presently, Irina needs additional funds in the amount of 22 000 hryvnia in order to make a bulk purchase of fall and winter denim clothes, namely jeans, blazers, jackets, shirts and skirts. Additionally, she would like to outfit her retail outlet - construct and decorate a small boutique. Irina is prepared to systematically invest her business profits into gradual development of her business. She has sufficient experience in retail, her merchandise is always of high quality and in demand, her prices are reasonable, plus she has a number of regular customers.

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of fall and winter denim clothing, such as jeans, blazers, jackets, shirts and skirts, and also outfit her retail outlet - build and decorate a small boutique

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, 64, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo who works abroad. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josefina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 37,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Josefina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
This is Hazel. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
