Hazel dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: 3.8.182.thieu Long Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to resell. Tình has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Tình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tình is 40 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents; another is grown up.

In 2008, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tình is the group leader of the 3.8.182.Thieu Long solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profit, Tình hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Améyo est mariée à un commerçant. Elle est âgée de 40ans et ont en charge 04 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de sacs et de chaussures à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle réalise des profits avec son activité et veut encore tirer d’avantage des intérêts c’est pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter des sacs et des chaussures. Elle veut accroitre l’activité et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Améyo is married to a vendor.  She is 40 years old and has four children in her care.  She sells purses and shoes from her home and she gets her supplies in Lomé.  She makes a profit with her business but wants to make more, and this is why she is requesting her first loan through WAGES to buy purses and shoes. She wants to grow her business and to raise living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy purses and shoes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gloria hopes that her business will continue to help her with her family's needs and expenses. She wants all her children to finish their studies and fulfill their own dreams and aspirations in life. She hopes that she will be able to open another store. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her learn from the Bible and strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en:
Chreng is a resident of Kompong Cham province, where she permanently lives with her family, which consists of two children. She is 35 years old and married to a noble farmer. Together, they operate a farming business as the main source of income. She grows a few types of seasonal crops including rice, potatoes, and vegetables. At harvest, she usually sells them to local traders for a profit. Chreng has been working in this field for over 10 years.

Chreng wants to gain access to financial support through HKL to make improvements to her farming business. Consequently, she is taking out a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase necessary supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides, which will be used to ensure good growth of her crops. She hopes to earn more profit, so that she can reinvest into the business and help her children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: 3.4.184.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Độ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Độ has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Độ is 53 years old and she is married with three grown up children. Độ supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Độ is the group leader of the 3.4.184.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of five members. This is Độ’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Độ hopes to buy land of her own, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 23 De Julio Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 23 DE JULIO,  Está  compuesto por trece integrantes diez mujeres y tres varones,  el presidente del banco es el Sr.  Jose tiene 24 años y un hijo que tiene la edad de 7 años,  El Sr. Jose  se dedica  a la  reparación de autos, el es chapista hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la localidad de Abapo,  donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Jose  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de herramientas y materiales y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr. Jose va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  herramientas para seguir equipando su taller, Jose  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a el ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank “23 de Julio” is made up of thirteen members, ten women and three men. The president of the bank is Jose, who is twenty-four years old and has a son who is seven. Jose makes a living by repairing cars. He has been an auto body worker for many years. His garage is in the town of Abapo, where he offers his services. 

This loan is his first with this institution. Jose is going to use this loan to buy tools and materials and therefore provide better service to his clientele and increase his profits. His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving in his work. Jose will use the benefits to continue buying tools to continue equipping his garage. Jose is a very hard worker. He feels glad for the opportunity provided to him and to his fellow group members since in some cases they support their families alone.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials.

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.en:
This is Doraliza, 34, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Tirso, a driver, and she is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Doraliza is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more fish to sell every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Doraliza dreams of having more business and hopes to give her family a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fish.

loans.name: 3.2.183.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Chiến is 36 years old, and she is married, with one child.  Chiến supports one dependent. with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Chiến has a service business tailoring clothes.  She has been involved in this business for eight years. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Chiến is the group leader of the 3.2.183.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of four members.  In 2009, Chiến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chiến  has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Chiến  hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Mayra Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Mayra Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 53 años de edad. Ella tiene una pequeña venta la cual inicio con la venta de carne y pollo  luego invirtió en granos básicos actualmente la tiene bien surtida.
El crédito lo invertirá en aumentar el negocio, el local e invertir en mercadería.
texts.en:
Mayra Rosa is an enterprising and hardworking 53 year-old woman.  She has a small store where she started out selling meat and chicken, and later invested in staple grains to sell.  She now has a well-stocked store.

She will use this loan to expand her business by making some improvements to her store and by purchasing merchandise.

loans.use: to make some improvements to her store and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Grace is in her late 40s and is single with two children, of which one goes to school and another is adult.

She has been selling firewood and cosmetics for two years now.  She works from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay back half price of her plot, which she wanted to use to build her own house.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to complete her outstanding plot amount.  

Her dream is one day to be able to build her own house because renting is so expensive.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mikoroshini," which totals 14 members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  complete her outstanding plot amount.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 5

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
MAKARIMAL Akhlakh groupe 5 est composé de 10 membres du GIE qui partagent le meme marché ou ils exercent leurs activités de commerce. Ils sont représentés par madame  Dethié( habillée en mauve sur la photo)  qui pratique depuis 8 ans la vente de tissus, de vaisselles et de sacs pour femme. Il est membre de l’UIMCEC  et consacre journalière ment  9 heures de temps de la journée a son activité. Il sollicite un crédit dans le but de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Son objectif est de  diversifier les  produits  qu’il commercialise. Les bénéfices qui lui sont procurés lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants et aussi d’épargner de l’argent. Son intention est d’acheter un terrain pour ses parents.
texts.en:
The mutual economic interest group (GIE) called GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH was started on the 10th October 2003 in Sénégal. The expression "Makarimal Akhlakh" symbolises someone with a kind heart, and worthy actions. The group has had 300 members since 2009. Its goal is to bring its members together and to allow them to conduct their various activities - namely agricultural and fish production, general import export business, transport, factory work, skilled labour, construction, animal rearing, mining, fishing, oil drilling, art and culture, printing and woodwork, public services, legal services, fish processing, agriculture, sale of spare parts, ice making, baking, and the provision of general services.
The group aims also to strengthen the bonds of friendship and solidarity between its members in order to help them obtain the necessary practical and financial means to develop their revenue generating activities - such that all benefit from the advantages of group membership.
It is in this spirit that a heads of agreement has been signed between the group and UIMCEC, to the benefit of the group members on a national level. The first phase of the project has focused on a sample of 120 active group members, divided into 12 sub-groups of 10 people.
"MAKARIMAL Akhlakh group 5" is a group of 10 members who offer their various services in the same market. They are represented by Dethié (dressed in purple in the photo). She has sold fabrics for the last 8 years, as well as crockery and ladies handbags. 
She is a member of the UIMCEC and spends nine hours daily on her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock. Her plan is to diversify the range of goods she sells.
The profits generated from this will enable her to cover her childrens' schooling costs, and also to be able to put some money into savings. Her plan is to buy a plot of land for her parents.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, crockery and women's handbags for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria Argentina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora una de ellas quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, verduras, gaseosa… etc. este negocio lo inicio hace 28 años con unos cuantos productos y poco a poco fue aumentando e invirtiendo en otros rubros.El crédito lo invertirá en ropa, calzado y perfumes. 
La meta de Gloria es lograr tener una tienda y que su hijo termine sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Gloria Argentina is an enterprising and hardworking woman.  She has a business selling clothing, vegetables, soft drinks, and other items.  She started this business 28 years ago with just a few products, and she gradually expanded it by investing in other areas.  She will invest this loan in clothing, shoes and perfumes.

Gloria's goal is to have her own store and see her son finish his university education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and perfumes

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en:
Grace is in her early 30s, and she is single, with one boy who goes to school. 

She has been selling soft drinks for five years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m., and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more stocks of soft drinks and vochas to resell.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her stocks of soft drinks.

Her dream is one day to be able to buy a hiace (a business bus). 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Azizi," which totals 16 members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her business.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса уже несколько раз пользовалась кредитами КИВА. Каждый раз она видела плодотворное влияние на свой бизнес от дополнительных полученных средств. С момента получения предыдущего кредита Раиса смогла открыть еще одну торговую точку, и ее доход вырос на 2 500 гривен в месяц.  
В этот раз она надеется использовать кредит в размере 16 000 гривен для того, чтобы запустить новую торговую точку и закупить нужное количество товара, чтобы заполнить ее. Раиса рассчитывает на то, что за счет функционирования двух точек ее прибыль теперь постепенно вырастет минимум на 50 %.
texts.en:
Raisa has already used loans through Kiva several times.  Each time, the additional financial means have had a productive impact on her business.  From the moment she received her previous loan, Raisa was able to open another business location and her income increased by 2,500 hryven (UAH) per month.

This time, she is hoping to use a loan of 16,000 hryven to open a new business location and to buy up the inventory necessary to fill it.  Raisa calculates that with the two business locations, her profit will now gradually increase by at least 50%.

loans.use: to open an new business location and to buy up the necessary inventory to fill it

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio en ADIM en grupo solidario en el grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras con la venta de nacatamales.
En la actualidad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñata, cosméticos y  se dedica a la costura.  Ella antes de invertir en la elaboración de piñatas tomo varios cursos donde aprendió hacer desde piñatas de alambre, chimbomba, bolsa, cartulina y papel.
El crédito lo invertirá en materia prima para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de piñatas con vestido y sin vestido las cuales entrega en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is an enterprising and hardworking woman.  She started with ADIM in the communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" with a business selling nacatamales (a traditional Nicaraguan dish).

Now she has a business making and selling piñatas and cosmetics, and she is also a dressmaker.  Before investing in her business making piñatas, she took some classes where she learned how to make piñatas from wire, balloons, bags, construction paper and paper.  She will invest this loan in supplies so that she can fill some orders she has for decorated and undecorated piñatas that she will deliver to the market.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make piñatas

loans.name: Air Force Group

texts.en:
Selemani is born in 1984.  He is married and has two children, of which one still goes to school.  

He has been selling second-hand clothes and shoes for five years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a good monthly profit ($360).

He is requesting the first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He wants to buy more stock of second-hand clothes and shoes to resell to many customers.  

His dream is one day to be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Air force," which totals 16 members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр – владелец небольшого магазинчика, в котором он торгует продовольственными товарами. Магазин расположен в небольшом селе за 24 километра от Нежина. Магазин Александр в свое время купил за 5 000 долларов. Бизнесом занимается уже 3 года. В магазине продавцом работает его жена. Наиболее ходовыми видами товаров являются хлеб, колбасы, молочные изделия, бакалея. Товар долго не залеживается.  

Александр обратился к КИВА за кредитом в 15 000 гривен с целью сделать ремонт в своем магазине, снаружи обшить его вагонкой и покрыть шифером, а внутри заменить прилавки и положить хороший, качественный пол. В ближайшем будущем планирует весь дополнительный доход продолжать вкладывать в ремонт, чтобы успеть закончить все работы до зимы.
texts.en:
Alexander is the owner of a small grocery store. The store is located in a moderately-sized village 24 km from Nezhin.  When the time came, Alexander bought his store for $5,000.  Now he has been a businessman for three years.  His wife works as a saleswoman in the store.  The best-selling items are bread, sausages, dairy products, and household goods.  His inventory doesn't lie around unsold. 

Alexander has turned to Kiva for a loan of 15,000 hryven (UAH) to remodel his store on the outside by installing new siding and roofing; and on the inside by replacing the counters and installing a good-looking, high-quality floor.  For the near term, he is planning on investing all the additional income in continuing the remodeling so as to finish the entire job before winter.

loans.use: to remodel his store by installing new siding, roofing, counters, and a high-quality floor

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
This is Nelson.  He previously received a PHP 45,000 loan that he used to buy additional hogs and feeds needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and for his personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that he will use to buy more hogs and feeds.  His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nelson hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more hogs and feeds needed in his business.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
This is Julita, who previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other items for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julita dreams of being able to give her all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Meldesim

texts.en:
This is Meldesim, 45, a resident of Puerto Prinsesa Palawan, Philippines. Her husband and business partner is Jaime, and she is mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Meldesim operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also does direct selling for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Meldesim hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
This is Rina, 33, a resident of Puerto Princesa Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Jerson, a fisherman, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rina is a fish and sea cucumber dealer. She sells different kinds of fish and sea cucumber to different vendors and retailers. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness.  Her regular customers are fish and sea cucumber retailers and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 3,500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of their fishing boat and supplies needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rina hopes to add another fishing boat and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of their fishing boat and supplies needed in their business.

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en:
Fawzia, a 36-year-old conservative woman, asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Besides the income they get from her husband, she started a small poultry business at home. She buys and sells chickens. She also sells the eggs she gets from them. Now she has applied for this loan to buy a small machine for the poultry business so she can expand and have her own chicken farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy a small machine for the poultry business

loans.name: Husni

texts.en: Husni, a 43-year-old married man, is the father of four daughters and a son. After his retirement, Husni opened a mini market in the neighborhood that sells snacks and some food products. He has applied for this loan to add more food products and goods to the store to increase his profits.

loans.use: to add more food products and goods

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza, a 24-year-old single guy, is the oldest among his three siblings. They live with their mother after their father passed away.

Hamza has registered himself in a college to get a diploma degree so he can find a suitable job to help in supporting the family. He has applied for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Celina Jakuru

texts.en:
Celina is a 31-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 2 children between the ages of 3 and 7. Both of them go to school.

Celina runs a hotel, and has been in business for 4 years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3000 sdg to purchase meat, rice, beans, and many other things. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income. In 5 years Celina  would like to expand her business and open a bar. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Celina says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva

loans.use: to buy more items like meat, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 35, a resident of Puerto Prinsesa Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, her business partner. She is also the mother of one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena operates an auto repair shop. Her husband handles the labor work like welding and maintenance repair of some vehicles. She handles finances, inventories, and promotion of their business. They offer welding jobs, repair and check-up of some types of vehicles. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in service fees every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy spare parts and supplies needed in her auto repair shop business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rowena hopes to expand her business and dreams to give her child a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy auto supplies and spare parts

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 34-year-old single guy who has been selling shoes for the last 10 years. He started selling on the side of the streets, then expanded and got a small kiosk and shoe stall. Now he has his own small shoe store that he wants to expand by adding more shoes and sandals so he applied for this loan. 

In the future he wants to add a new section for men's shoes.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and sandals

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
This is Benilda, 62, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household and at this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Benilda oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Benilda dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en: Moris is a thirty year old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.Six years ago Moris decided to start up a bar to help him earn an extra income to support his family. His business has been very successful despite hardships of customers not paying on time, price fluctuations and inflation. Moris did not have a chance to further his education due to financial constraints at the time but now he is determined to ensure that his children become highly qualified and also have access to the basics that he did not have. He also has dreams of modernising his bar to attract more customers and owning a hotel that caters for all categories of his clients. Moris is requesting for a loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell at his pub.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 44, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Servillano and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rowena hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and paint, among other supplies.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Doña Filomena de 54 años de edad, habita en la comarca Santa Rita, desde joven su padre le enseñaron el trabajo del campo, donde desarrolla su principal actividad ganadera y establecimiento de raices y tuberculos, siendo un rubro de gran importancia economica para la zona lo cual de esta actividad provienen sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia, es una persona bien querida por sus vecinos y amistades, es bien portada, responsable y de Buena Familia; trabaja en coordinación con el núcleo familiar.
Demanda su primer crédito para la compra de Pastos mejorado de modo que ella lo cesechara en su finca y esto le permitira mantener bien alimentado su hato ganadero y que le generen mayor peso para obtener mayor ganancia al momento de comercializarlo, presenta excelente inventario ganadero, posee capacidad y voluntad de pago.

Su sueño es mantener su unidad de produccion en buen estado y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Filomena is 54 years old and lives in the region of Santa Rita. Since she was young her father taught her fieldwork, which is where she develops her primary earning activity and establishment of roots and tubers. This is an area of great economic importance for the region, as this activity provides income to support her family. 

She is a good person, loved by her neighbors and friends; she is polite, responsible, and from a good family. She works in conjunction with her family unit. 

She is asking for her first loan to buy improved pastures so that she can reap them for her farm. This will allow her to keep her cattle herd well nourished and so they will increase in weight to make a better profit when marketed. She shows an excellent cattle inventory, and has the capacity and willingness to make payments. 

Her dream is to keep her unit output in good standing and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to establish pastures.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal, 30 years old, is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Manal and her husband are both employees in private institutions, and they have a son and a daughter. They both share the same interests when it comes to birds, so they started a small home-based business, buying and selling birds. Manal has applied for this loan to get a new type of birds, different from what they have.

loans.use: to get a new type of birds

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is business oriented woman. She currently manages her general store, piggery and 1000 square meter of flower garden in front of her house. She has been a good client for three years up to present. As she manages her businesses, her husband is also busy in running their five hectares of rice field. The couple were blessed with three children and currently goes to school.

Lailanie has been operating her general store for 10 years, same with her piggery. She desires to have a better way of living, educate her three children and have stable source of income in order to generate greater profits that will serve to her family needs.

Lailanie would like to ask for a loan of PHP50,000 allowing her to buy volumes of merchandise to be able to minimize her fare expenses in going to and from the market and encourage more costumer to buy the products she offers within the village she lives. She is hoping for development of her general store and other business being said. She believes that her hopes and dreams will come true through the continuous financial support given by all Kiva lenders to her in order to succeed.

loans.use: to buy volumes of merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 56, resident of Manila, Philippines. He manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Romeo operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which he needs to continue production and expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Romeo hopes his business would grow and dreams to be able to give his children a good future and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients needed in his baking business.

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en: Zipora is a 28 year old married with three children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. She is a primary teacher and has been in business for four years. She has bought land and started business ever since she started working. She is facing hardships like low salary pay and her personal goal is to build a permanent home.The purpose of the loan is to build a residential house.

loans.use: To build a residential house

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun has two children in school. Moeun is 29 years old and married to a humble farmer, living together with them in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Moeun and her husband bring up their children with a profit generated from farming business. They have been farming rice and some kind of seasonal crops on their inherited farmland for almost 12 years. They do some farming activities all best to minimize their labor expense. Moeun always wishes to get a higher income from the business.

Now, she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice. She hopes that the loan will have a positive impact on her farming business. In the future, she anticipates having wide farmland which results a higher production.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
This is Lolina, 57, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Nardito, her business partner and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lolina hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Manus

texts.en: Manus is a 37 year old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. He is an accountant and with his salary he has been able to further his education and also build a permanent residential house. Manus says that he has a lot of dreams which he cannot fullfil with the little salary he earns and so he would like to diversify his income sources by venturing into farming. His personal goal is to educate his children to higher tertiary institutions. Manus intends to use the loan facility to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land to farm on.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
This is Cecilio, 52, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Sonia who works abroad and a father to his children. He together with his wife manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cecilio maintains a tricycle business. He owned and drives one unit of Tricycle (motor cycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.   He earns a minimum of Php300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of her business, He is requesting an amount of Php10, 000 in his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Cecilio hopes to buy another tricycle unit and hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth is 29 years old and has been blessed with four children who are currently in school. Soth and his spouse are raising their children in a peaceful village in Kampong Chhnang province. He has a basic education and is involved in rice farming for the primary source of his income. In addition, Soth also sells Khmer natural medicine around his commune and local markets for extra income.

Soth is now asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase natural medicines for resale. He hopes this loan will be approved. He hopes to improve his current business and his family's lives as well. Someday, he aims to uplift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam, 41 years old and a single lady, has a small home business from which she is supporting herself. Her business is clothing and make-up sales. She applied for this loan to increase the amount of clothes and cosmetics products that she has so as to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the amount of clothes and cosmetics products in her inventory

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 31-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a depot for sodas  and has been in business for six years. Since she has a monopoly on the market, she has no major hindrances and the business is very profitable. She has a grand plan of expanding to nearby towns, trading in fuel and also rearing cattle. Jane has requested the loan to buy sodas to sell as we are nearing the festive season when the demand is high.

loans.use: to buy more sodas to sell.

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en: Sulait is a 28 year old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Ten years ago Suliat decided to start retail shop so as as to suppliment his agricultural activities and also bring goods nearer to his community. Since he mainly deals in women cosmetics he is challenged by the failure to meet the different tastes and preferences of his customers due to inadequate capital. He has dreams of educating his children and diversifying his business to include home use items such as soap among others so as to mitgate risks. The purpose of the loan is to buy more soap and cosmetics for women.

loans.use: to buy more soap, cosmetics for women.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
This is Jennelyn, 28, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rouel, a mason, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jennelyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen is a 37-year-old married woman who has been living Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is in the business of raising pigs in a wooden pigsty at the backyard of her house, where she installed five piglets for fattening already. And when they are grown, she will sells them to local traders or butchers in her village. She has been in this business for 5 years and it earns her a good income after the rice farming business.

She wants to improve her current businesses, which is why she is asking for additional capital to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer for the sustenance of her crops. Also she will purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. This loan will help her grow her businesses and be able to have a better yield in this coming year.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer for the sustenance of her crops and purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Tahani, 21 years old, is a conservative woman, so she asked her mother to take her place in the photo. 

Tahani is a mother of two kids; her husband is serving in the military. She has a small artistic business making floral decoration pieces for sale, and she also sells blankets and bed covers to increase her revenue. 

Now she has applied for this loan to purchase more raw materials to make a new collection of decoration pieces in different styles.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to make decoration pieces

loans.name: Rabaa

texts.en: Rabaa, 52 years old married woman, she has three sons and daughters. After her husband retirement she opened a small market that sells snacks and some toys to the kids in the neighborhood. She now wants to improve the store and add more goods to it so she applied to this loan to bring in more food products.

loans.use: to bring in more food products

loans.name: Banazeer

texts.en: Banazeer , a 22 years old married lady who works at home to help her husband in improving their living conditions. While he is serving in the military, she buy and sell cosmetic products and sometimes accessories. No she wants to increase the quantity and collection she has of the accessories for that she has applied to this youth loan.

loans.use: to increase the quantity and collection she has of the accessories

loans.name: Saif

texts.en: Saif is one of seven brothers living together with their mother after their father passed away. He is a 19 years old guy who has submitted himself in the university to study law. Since he wanted to support himself, he has applied to this loan in order to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en: Hamzeh,  35 years old married man who owns a cars’ electrician shop and work at it, he also provide other services such as cleaning services and accessorizing services. Now he has applied to this loan to get new tools for the shop to increase the volume of services provided by his shop, therefore increase his profits.

loans.use: to get new tools for the vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Sokneng's Group

texts.en:
Sokneng is aged 28 and married. She lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four dependent children, three daughters and one son, all of whom are still in school. The main sources of family’s income are from planting cassavas on 2.5 hectares of farmland, growing chilies and raising chickens to support the family. Having been in this business for ten years, Sokneng can earn about KHR40,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

She has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped her family relieve financial burden and improve livelihood. Now Sokneng and her group members are applying for a loan of KHR1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor costs in harvesting the cassavas. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her family’s standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs in pulling out the cassavas

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim, 51, is married with one dependent daughter who is still in school. She lives in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and the main sources of family’s income are from rice farming on 1 hectare of farmland and growing corn on five hectares of farmland, which she and her husband have been in this business for almost thirty years. The current business earns them approximately 30,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. However, drought is still the main challenge for her field business. 

Kim’s group consists of three members who live in the same village and she is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Kim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase more income from the current business so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Estación Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal está conformado en su mayor parte por familiares, quienes viven por la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, este sector tiene grandes llanuras propicia para la cría de ganado, su centro parroquial es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita Martha y se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito en el banco comunal. Es soltera y tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, su papá es de profesión sastre y su mamá se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de sus padres.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y también se dedica a la cría de animales en especial de ganado, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos pero no le fue muy bien por la competencia desleal y decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa que por el momento le va muy bien. Ha elegido trabajar realizando estas actividades porque le permiten ser independientemente económicamente.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra ropa lo cual le ha permitido tener una mayor variedad y poder acaparar mas clientela,  pero debido a una infección que tuvo se atraso un poco en los pagos de su crédito pero ya realizo la cancelación total del mismo. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de licras, chompas y lencería para continuar con su negocio. La banca comunal le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles y no necesitan muchos trámites.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up, in large part, of relatives who live in Tarqui parish in Cuenca. This area has large plains conducive to cattle raising. Its parish center is a mixture of the colonial and the modern and its people still maintain the culture and traditions inculcated by their parents.

One of the members of this group is Srta. Martha who is on her third loan in the communal bank. She is single and is 31 years old. She lives in her parents’ home and shares household expenses with them. Her father is a professional tailor and her mother is a farmer. The house where they live is owned by her parents. 

Martha sells clothing by catalog and also raises animals, especially cattle. Formerly she sold cosmetics but this did not go well for her because of the competition and she decided to engage in clothing sales, which are currently doing very well. She has chosen to run these businesses because they allow her to be financially independent.

She invested her earlier loan in the purchase of clothing which enabled her to have more variety and attract more customers, however due to an infection she had, she fell behind a bit in making the payments on her loan. Now, however, the debt has been completely paid off. Her new loan will be invested in purchasing Lycra (items made of spandex), sweaters and lingerie so that she can continue with her business. 

The members of the communal bank like being able to obtain loans easily and without going through so much red tape.

loans.use: to purchase Lycra, sweaters and lingerie.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a 35-year-old married mother of four dependent children, three daughters and one son, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been in rice farming on two hectares of farmland, supplementing the income by making palm juice. They have been in this business for ten years and can earn about 87,000KHR per day to support the family.

Saron is the fourth cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans have helped her improve livelihood and support her children’s education. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund of KHR4,000,000. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy bamboos for making a ladder to climb palm trees. Saron hopes this loan will enable her to increase more income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn, 48, living in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, has four children. As a widow, she has struggled to feed her children through raising pigs, planting cassava and supplementing family’s income by selling Khmer noodles, which she has been in this business for several years to earn a living. 

Lorn has been with VisionFund for one cycles and completely repaid back with VisionFund. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she is requesting for another loan of KHR3,000,000. With this loan, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her cassava plantation and use a portion of it to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes to increase more income from the current business so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her cassava and piglets for raising

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area of the Moung Ruseey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Thoeurn is 36 years old and married with three children, one daughter and two sons, all of whom are dependent on her and some are in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been involved in farming rice on seven hectares of farmland, which they have been in this business for six years. Lacking of water supply is the main challenge for their paddy rice business.

Thoeurn has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other members are just with VisionFund this loan cycle. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now leading her group of four to apply for a loan, Thoeurn, who is the leader, will use her portion to fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes her crop yields will become more profitable and increase more income so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Fathiyeh

texts.en:
Fathiyeh, a 41 years old conservative woman, she asked one of her daughters to appear in the photo instead. 
One of her daughters (Hadeel) is now a university student majoring in Mathematics. She wanted to help her daughter achieve her goal and get her BA degree, so she applied to this loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia, Da is 25 years old and she is married with four children, one daughter and three sons, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer on 1.7 hectare of farmland while her husband is a car taxi driver, which they have been in this business for several years to make a living. The current business earns them approximately 27,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Da has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans have helped her relieve family’s burden and improve livelihood. Now she and her group member are asking for a loan of 2,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy piglets for raising to earn additional income. Da hopes this loan will enable her to increase more income so as to make a good living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 39 years old married woman, her husband works in construction business as blocks and bricks specialist. She as a support to her husband started a small retail business at home buying and selling blankets and different sizes of bed covers. She hopes by expanding the business she can open her own store to help in improving their living conditions. Therefore she has applied to this loan to increase the quantity she has of bed covers and get a new collection.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of bed covers to sell

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Twenty two year old Harrison is a married man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After failing to continue with school he decided to set up a retail shop with his savings earned from casual labor and coffe sales which he still does. He is the bread winner of the family and his dream is to educate his child up to the university and own a wholesale shop. He has challenges in inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand of his customers. Harrison intends to the loan to buy general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Escarleth Yamileth

texts.es:
La sra. Escarleth Martínez  de 42 años de edad, es casada, su esposo tiene un pequeño taller de talabarteria, tiene tres hijos, que apoyan en las actividades diarias del taller del papa y estudian.  Ella  trabaja como comerciante desde hace 16 años vendiendo ropa, calzado, abarrotes, etc en El Ayote donde viaja desde los viernes y regresa los domingos.
Solicita su credito para invertirlos en Compra de mercadería, que le sevira para dar mayor cobertura y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, a la vez captar mas clientes y asi de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia. Cada credito le ha servido para incrementar su inventario y crecer en su negocio, tanto asi que actualmente vende articulos en plastico y otras mercaderias que le encarguen sus clientes.	

Ella desea establecer su negocio en Juigalpa, poner asi como una Tienda surtida, que haya varidad de productos, con la idea siempre de mejorar sus ingresos y dar mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Escarleth Martínez is 42 years old and married.  Her husband has a small saddlery shop.  She has three children, who support the daily business activities in their father’s shop.  The children also go to school.

She has been working as a merchant and selling clothes, shoes, and groceries, etc. for 16 years.  She sells in Ayote, and she travels there on Fridays and returns on Sundays.

She is requesting her loan to buy merchandise that will help her provide greater coverage and meet her customers’ demands.  She will get more customers, and this way she will improve her income and that of her family.

Each loan has served her to increase her inventory and to grow in her business.  They have helped so much that she now sells plastic goods and other merchandise that her customers order.

She wants to establish her business in Juigalpa, to set up a store that is stocked with a variety of products.  She will do this with the thought of always improving her income and making her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs, new clothes, shoes, and plastic wash bowls, among other items.

loans.name: Sengly's Group

texts.en:
Living in thatched roof house in a rural area of the SangKe district, Battambang province, Sengly is 43 years old and he lives with his wife and four children, one son of whom is dependent on him and still in school. He makes a living through working as a motor taxi driver which he has been in this occupation for almost twenty years while his wife is a rice farmer. Low crop yield is still the main challenge for their business.

Sengly is the first cycled client with VisionFund while the other member is also the first cycled client. Now he and his group member are requesting a loan with VisionFund of KHR1,000,000 each. As the group leader, Sengly is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase more income so as to make a living better and keep his son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is a 44-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with a responsibility of looking after 20 children. 16 of these children are orphans whom she decided to look after when her brothers and sisters died. After realising that farming alone could not help her sustain the family, she set up a clothing store six years ago. With the income, she has been able to provide the basics for such an extended family. She has a dream of educating the children and setting up a modern boutique. Jenifer intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PRIMAVERA,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Julia tiene 42 años y tiene dos hijos que tiene la edad de 17 y 14  años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Julia va a usar este préstamo  para comprar cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Julia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: The “Primavera” (Spring) communal bank has 8 members, all women.  The bank’s president is Julia, 42.  She has two children who are 17 and 14 years of age.  She sells cosmetics via catalogue.  She sells beauty products from place to place visiting public and private institutions and different neighborhoods selling her products door to door.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Julia will use this loan to buy cosmetics that are on special promotion to have in stock.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to have a variety of products available to meet customer demand.  Julia’s business challenge is being able to give efficient customer service.  She will use profits to improve her family’s quality of life since this is the only activity she has that makes it possible for her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es:
La señora Emelina de 42 años de edad, es soltera, habita en el Municipio El Coral, sus hijos son mayores de edad y se valen por si solos, le ayudan tambien a su mamá con los gastos del hogar; Doña Emelina, es Comerciante desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta actividad la que se ha convertido en su principal fuente generadora de ingreso para el bienestar de su Familia, 
Solicta este financiamiento para compra de Materiales de construccion y asi poder finalizar su vivienda, que esto se ha vonvertido en su principal sueño que hace años ha deseado y con sacrificio ha ido cumpliendo poco a poco permitiendole poder vivir en mejores condiciones de vida en conjunto con su familia.
texts.en:
Emelina, 42, is single living in the municipality of El Coral.  Her children are all adults and take care of themselves.  They also help their mother cover household expenses.  Emelina is a merchant; she’s been in this occupation since she was very young and it has become her main source of income for her family’s wellbeing.

She’s requesting this loan to buy building materials and supplies to be able to finish her house.  This has been her greatest dream for years and with much sacrifice has been making it a reality little by little.  This has allowed her to live in better conditions together with her family.

loans.use: to buy building matials and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
El joven Jose  Javier de 28 años de edad, habita en El Coral, es casado, tienen una niña menor de edad; su esposa trabaja para el ministerio de salud ambos asumen los gastos del hogarse, se consideran una familia progresiva y unida con deseos de superacion en Pro de mejores condicones de vida. Jose Javier se dedica a la construccion desde hace 6 años, actividad que le ha servido como su principal fuente de ingreso para el bienestar de su familia y sus necesidades basicas.
Nesecita este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construccion ya que realizara un anexo a su casa de habitacion lo que le permitira mejores comodidades en su unidad familiar, referencias lo consideran como una persona  trabajadora, responsable y de buenas culturas.	
Su Mayor deseo es que su niña crezca en un ambiente agradable, que tenga condiciones en su hogar y se prepare para que tenga un buen futuro.
texts.en:
José Javier, 28, is a young man living in El Coral.  He’s married and has a minor daughter.  His wife works for the Ministry of Health and they both are responsible for household expenses.  They consider themselves to be a progressive, united family that very much wants to get ahead and have better living conditions.  José Javier has worked in construction for 6 years, an activity that’s his main source of income for his family’s wellbeing and for basic needs.

He needs this loan to buy building materials and supplies because he will onto his house in order to improve his family’s comfort. His references consider him to be a hardworking, responsible person of good habits.

His greatest wish is that his little girl grows up in a pleasant environment, that he has conditions at home that will prepare her to have a better future.

loans.use: to do home improvements.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six sons and daughters. 

To help her husband in supporting the family, she started doing a small business selling blankets and bed covers. She applied for this loan to start selling clothes, too.

loans.use: to start selling clothes, too.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 31-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He is a teacher by profession, and he has been in service for three years.

Albert's inspiration was to teach starting during his primary school days when they would not have classes, for lack of teachers at school.  He says that he has since found satisfaction teaching the young children.

With his low salary, he has been able to buy land and grow maize, beans, and other food crops.  He has challenges of poor transport systems that hinders his movement of his produce from his garden to the market.  His dream is to buy a car or motorcycle to ease the situation.

Albert is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to transport him and his agricultural produce to market places and school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport purposes.

loans.name: Jesus Guillermo

texts.es:
Jesús es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su empeño y al apoyo de sus padres, Jesús pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, en algunas ocasiones invita a su familia un delicioso Pollo a la Brasa, el cual es el plato favorito de ellos.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Jesús trabaja como operario de mantenimiento mecánico en una empresa procesadora de su ciudad, todas las mañanas desde tempranas horas él inicia su labor y puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas, Jesús cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jesús se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que él desea poder tarrajear y pintar su habitación; de esta manera Jesús tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones, contando con un lugar más seguro y adecuado para su desarrollo, así Jesús seguirá trabajando y esforzando para que junto a su familia pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jesús is a single, 21-year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Thanks to his own effort and his parents’ support, he was able to study  for a technical career in mechanics. In his rare spare time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors. At times he invites his family for a delicious “Pollo a la Brasa”, which is their favorite dish.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Jesús works day after day as a maintenance mechanical engineer for a processing company in his city. He begins work early every morning and can work approximately 12 hours a day. He believes he is doing well due to his hard work and because of the helpful way he treats others.

Jesús is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to make improvements to his house since he wants to upgrade and paint his room. In this way, his house will be in better condition and Jesús will have a more secure space that is a more suitable environment. Thus he will continue working and striving so that together his family will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house.

loans.name: Bernardo De La Cruz

texts.es: Don Bernardo, de 41 años de edad, es soltero, habitante de Comarca San Luis, vive con su mama quien le ayuda a realizar los trabajos en su unidad de produccion, en la que realiza actividades pecuarias y maneja su pequeño inventario ganadero; tambien actividades agricolas establecimiento de cultivos de granos basicos, tuberculos, actividades que se convierten en su principal fuente de ingreso para el bienestar de su familia. Nesecita este financiamiento para invertirlo en establecimiento de 1 manzana de yuca, permitiendole realizar una buena preparacion de suelo, aplicacion de abonos fertilizantes, por lo tanto esto le garantizara una mayor produccion del cultivo y mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.  Su mayor proposito es continuar trabajando para generar mayores ingresos y asi darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Bernardo, 41, is single living in Comarca San Luis with his mother who helps him do the work on his parcel of land.
