He carries out animal husbandry work managing his small herd of cattle and also does agricultural work growing basic grains and tubers, activities that have become his main source of income for his family’s wellbeing.

He needs this financing to invest into a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of manioc.  He will be able to prepare the soil, apply fertilizing manure thus guaranteeing a larger crop yield and higher income to improve his quality of life.  His greatest goal is to continue to work to generate higher income and be able to give his family the best that way.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Modesto Arcadio

texts.es:
Don Modesto de 39 años de edad, casado, habita en la Comarca la Tigra, trabaja en su unidad de produccion en la que realiza ectividades agricolas y pecuarias, las cuales son de suma importancia y su principal fuente de ingreso para la sostenibilidad de su familia, realiza cultivo de maiz, frijoles y teberculos con sus ingreso a la vez asegura la dieta alimenticia, tambien cuenta con su pequeño inventario ganadero el cual le sirve para el fortalecimiento en mejorar su calidad de vida.
Nesecita este financiamiento para realizar establecimiento de 1.5 mzs del cultivo de yuca, asi como la preparacion del suelo y compra de Fertilizantes necesarios para esta obra, actividad que le permitira incrementar su produccion de tuberculos, de manera que pueda elevar la rentabilidad para el bien comun de su familia, espera ser beneficiado para llevar a cabo dicho proyecto. 

Las referencias de este Señor son excelentes, ya que se caracteriza por ser una persona dinamica, responsable, amable y sobre todo concentrado en sus quehaceres diario, él realiza sos labores con el animo de mejorar cada dia y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Modesto, 39, is married and lives in Comarca La Tigra.  He works on his land doing agricultural and animal husbandry work.  They are very important and the main source of income to support his family.  He grows corn, beans and tubers and with his income is able to insure his food supply; he also has a small herd of livestock that helps him improve his quality of life.

He needs this loan to plant 1.5 manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of manioc.  He will prepare the soil and buy the necessary fertilizer for this project which will allow him to increase his production of tubers in order to increase profitability for his family’s common good.  He hopes to be benefited in order to carry out this project.

His references are excellent since he stands out for being a dynamic, responsible, kind and above all focused on his daily chores.  He does all his work aiming at improving every day and giving his family the best.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Añoranza Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento AÑORANZA, Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Julia  tiene 38 años, tiene cuatro hijos que son de las edades de 4, 6, 13 y 17 años, se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio en la localidad de Nueva Esperanza, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Julia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de harina por cantidad para la elaboración de variedad de panes  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Julia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus panes, la Sra. Julia  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial group Añoranza ["yearning"] consists of nine members, six women and three men. The president of the group is Señora Julia. She is 38 years old and has four children, ages 4, 6, 13, and 17. She works to make and sell bread. She has a bakery which is located in her own home, in the village of Nueva Esperanza. 

This loan will be their first within the institution. Señora Julia will use the loan to buy flour in bulk to make a variety of breads. In this way she will offer better service to her customers and increase her income. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Señora Julia will use the profits to keep buying cooking utensils and goods for making her breads. 

Señora Julia is a very hardworking person; she feels fortunate to be offered this opportunity for herself and for her group members, as some of them support their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk in order to make a variety of breads.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, aged 45 years, with four children.   

She owns a retail shop that has run for a period of 12 years. She wants a loan to buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil for sale.  She says inadequate capital is affecting the business. 

She would like to buy a car and educate her children in future.

loans.use: buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Roger Francisco

texts.es:
Don Roger Francisco tiene la edad de 53 años, habita en El Coral, es un señor activo con ganas de superar, se mantiene motivado en su negocio, el trabajo es como su pasa tiempo favorito, desde hace cuatro años tiene establecido su propio negocio Taller de Zapateria, siendo esa actividad su principal fuente de ingreso para el bien socioeconomico de su nucleo familiar
Solicita este financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitacion y asi poder ofrecer condiciones que le permitan vivir en mejor comodidad con su familia,  es una persona pregresiva, en busca de mejores horizontes de vida, en su comunidad lo consideran como un hombre, trabajador, responsable,  espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño, sus metas y proyecciones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roger Francisco, 53, lives in El Coral.  He’s an active man who very much wants to improve.  He’s motivated at work; his work is like a hobby for him.  He opened his own shoe repair shop four years ago.  This activity is his main source of income for his family’s socioeconomic wellbeing.

He’s asking for this financing to do some home improvements to offer his family better living conditions and more comfort.  He’s a progressive person seeking better horizons in life.  He’s considered to be a hardworking, responsible man in his community.  He hopes to be benefited with Kiva funds to make his dream, his goals and his projects for his house a reality.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: 6 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 6 DE AGOSTO, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Marioly tiene 33 años, tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 5 y 14 años, se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio en la localidad de Rio Seco, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Marioly va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de harina por cantidad para la elaboración de variedad de panes  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Marioly va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus panes, la Sra. Marioly  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The 6 DE AGOSTO communal bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Marioly. She is 33 years old and has two children, aged 5 and 14. She makes and sells bread. She has a bread bakery located in her house in Rio Seco. This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Marioly is going to use this loan to buy a large quantity of flour to make a variety of breads and thus offer a better service to her customers and increase her earnings. Her reason for asking for this loan is to keep improving in her business. Marioly is going to use the profits to keep buying tools and ingredients for her breads. Marioly is a very hardworking person who is happy with the opportunity that has been offered to her and the other members of the group, since some of them are the sole supporters of their families.

loans.use: to buy flour in large quantities

loans.name: Yovan

texts.en:
Yovan is a 46-year-old man with eight children living in Kagadi,Uganda. 

Yovan needs the loan to buy local brew to sell.  For 15 years he has been dealing in local brew.   He started the business because of the ready market of the product and low cost of production.  He has his own plantation where he gets bananas to make the local brew, but because of the high demand, he also buys from others.

Yovan never got a chance to go to school because of the rigidity of his father, who preferred that he reared animals and brewed alcohol to education.   He says that with the community awareness campaign, he wishes to educate his children so that they can be better citzens. 

He has a business dream of owning a refinery so as to produce quality brew.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 34-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for ten years. He still lives in a rented house. This is a great challenge to him since 40% of his salary must be used to meet the monthly rent expenses. He used his salary savings to buy land where he intends to set up a home. Andrew is requesting a loan to buy cement, iron sheets, sand, and bricks to start building his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron sheets, sand and bricks for building a house

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad conocida por su población de origen afroperuano, por sus danzas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, por sus hermosas playas y por la producción de nuestro producto Bandera el “Pisco”, también esta ciudad es muy conocida por su comida ya que los pobladores de esa ciudad se les conoce por la buena sazón que tienen por ello uno de los platos que más le gusta a Luz es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”; en su tiempo líbrele gusta escuchar música y es que eso la tranquiliza cuando está molesta o preocupada.

Con mucho esfuerzo Luz logro tener su negocio de venta de especerías y molidos, el cual consiste en vender los condimentos para sazonar la comida molido, así como las especias molidas,tambien vende productos como arroz, azucar, fideos, entre otros; ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas ya que la venta de estos productos ayuda a los clientes a tener los ingredientes listos para añadir a las comidas y cocinar de manera más rápida; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque elabora sus productos con mucha limpieza y sobre todo porque vende productos frescos y los clientes sienten más confianza en comprar sus productos.

El agradecimiento que Luz siente hacia los prestatarios Kiva es muy grande ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su ayuda y gracias a su gran apoyo, ella podrá comprar más utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, asi como arroz, azúcar, entre otros con ello ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así poder seguir ahorrando para cumplir su más grande sueño: “Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Luz is a very hardworking person living in the city of Chincha, a city noted for its Afro-Peruvian population, its dances and because it’s the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes; for its beautiful beaches and for the production of their stellar product: “Pisco.”  This city is also noted for its cuisine since residents of this city are known for the tasty way they prepare food.  One of Luz’s favorite dishes is the very delicious “Arroz con Pato” [Duck with Rice] and in her free time she enjoys listening to music because it relaxes her when she’s upset or worried.

With much effort, Luz managed to establish her business selling spices and ground products.  She sells ground condiments for food as well as ground spices.  She also sells products like rice, sugar and noodles, among others.  She works about 9 hours daily since the sale of these products helps customers have ingredients ready to add to food and to cook more rapidly.  She believes that she does well in her business because she makes her products very hygienically and above all because she sells fresh products and customers trust her products.

The gratitude Luz feels towards Kiva lenders is very big because this is the second time they’ve given her help and thanks to their great help she will be able to buy more utensils and ingredients like rice and sugar, among others to make her products and thus continue saving to reach her greatest dream: to provide her children with professions.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles and other ingredients.

loans.name: Edgar Nazario

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 46 años, vive en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, en esta ciudad podemos encontrar lugares turísticos muy visitados como las “Islas Ballestas y Paracas”., se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Edgar es padre de 1 pequeño de 9 meses de edad, el cual es su adoración y por el cual cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder darle lo que necesita y sobre todo porque quiere que sea mucho mejor que el y sobre todo con la ayuda de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y mejor amiga. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho pasear con su familia y también en algunas oportunidades le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, también le encanta pedirle a su esposa que le prepare uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”.

Día a día Edgar trabaja en su pequeño negocio como chofer de taxi, con el cual dia a día puede llevar el sustento para los gastos de su hogar, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los cliente y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante para bien de su familia.

Edgar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que está hecha de drywal, colocara pisos, entre otros, así de esta manera el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa, darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Edgar is 46 years old. He lives in the city of Pisco. This city is known for its warm and pleaasing climate. Here we can find popular tourist sites such as the "Ballestas and Paracas Islands”. There is agriculture there, especially cotton and corn, among others. Edgar is the father of 1 nine month old son, whom he adores and for whom he works hard every day to be able to give him what he needs. He wants him to be much better than he himself is, especially with his wife's help. She is his right hand and best friend. When he has a little free time, he likes to spend time with his family and also play soccer with his friends and neighbors. He also likes to ask his wife to make one of his favorite dishes, whish is the delicious “Duck and rice”.

Edgar works day to day in his little business as a taxi driver. He does this every day to pay for the household expenses. He works around 10 hours a day and serves up to 20 customers daily. He belives it is going well for him because he is friendly with the customer and above all because he really wants to get ahead for the good of his family. 

Edgar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since with their help he has been able to do some home improvements, such as putting in drywall and flooring and more. This way he can improve his family's quality of life and keep fighting to make his big dream come true: finish building his house and give his son a good education.

loans.use: to do some home improvement (put in floors, among other things).

loans.name: Marleny Asunciona

texts.es:
Marleny es una joven de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Marleny es madre de un pequeño de 12 años al que quiere mucho y por el cual da la vida con tal de verlo feliz. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer y también en ocasiones le gusta mucho comer su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Día a día Marleny trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras y abarrotes, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 hora diarias y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los cliente sy sobre todo porque ofrece productos en buen estado y de calidad.

Marleny está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracia a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, leche, azúcar, fideos, yogurt, galletas, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá tener más variedad de productos para sus clientes, lo cual le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a su hijo y ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Marleny, 27, is a young woman living in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its warm climate.  Agriculture is common here too, especially cotton and corn, among others.  Marleny is the mother of a 12-year-old son who she loves very much and would give her life to see him happy.  When she has free time available she enjoys reading very much and also on occasion to eat her favorite dish, the delicious “Ají de Gallina.”  Because of her limited economic resources she only studied up to 5th grade of secondary school but would have liked to have studied nursing.

Day to day Marleny works in her small vegetable and grocery business.  She works there about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 25 customers per day.  She believes that she does well in business because she’s kind to all the customers and above all because she sells quality products that are in good condition.

Marleny is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will buy merchandise like rice, milk, sugar, noodles, yoghurt and cookies, among other for her store.  In this way she will be able to have more variety available for her customers which will lead to improved income.  She will continue striving and working towards making her greatest dream a reality: to give her son a profession and for her to become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a refrigerator, among others.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria tiene 50 años de edad, vive en la alegre ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus danzas típicas, las cuales son el festejo, la zamacueca, el landó, entre otros, asimismo es la cunda de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, también encontramos playas hermosas y sobre todo sus pobladores son muy alegres y hospitalarios. Cuando Maria tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, especialmente programas de repostería, ya que le gusta mucho preparar dulces y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “ Arroz con pato con Papa a la Huancaína, ya que le sale riquísimo, nos comenta Maria. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar en la universidad.

Día a día Maria trabaja en su negocio de venta de dulces y pasteles, ella prepara sus dulces y los vende a las tiendas de su ciudad, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio ya que tiene muy buena sazón y sobre todo porque es muy amable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como tarrajeo de paredes, colocar piso de cemento, ya que es de tierra actualmente, entre otros, así de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y sobre todo podrá seguir trabajando muy duro para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y poder estudiar repostería”.
texts.en:
María, 50, lives in the cheerful city of Chincha, a city noted for its traditional dances: “Festejo,” “Zamacueca” and “Landó,” among others.  It’s also the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes but beautiful beaches are also found here.  In addition, its residents are very cheerful and hospitable.  When 
María has free time available she likes watching television especially the pastry-making shows because she enjoys making sweets very much.  She also likes to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con Pato con Papa a la Huancaína” because according to María she makes a very tasty one.  Because of her limited economic resources she only went to 5th grade in secondary school but would have liked to have gone to university.

Day to day María works in her business selling sweets and cakes.  She makes the sweets and sells them to stores in her city.  She works about 10 hours per day and believes that she does well in her business because she has a very tasty way of cooking and above all because she’s very kind and has a strong drive to get ahead.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to do some home improvements like plastering the walls and laying a cement floor since it’s currently dirt, among others.  In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life and above all continue working very hard to make her greatest dream a reality: to have a house of her own and to be able to study pastry making.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que s e caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, su clima cálido, así mismo se desarrolla mucho la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, entre otros. Cuando Julio tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos de su barrio y luego de ello le encanta en algunas oportunidades comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo”Chupe de Camarones”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos julio solo estudios hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.  

Día a día Julio trabaja en su pequeño negocio como chofer de taxi, con lo cual puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tienen muchas ganas e salir adelante.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general al vehículo y comprar una batería nueva para su vehículo ya que la actual ya no funciona; de esta manera el tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y sobre todo dará mas seguridad a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Julio is a 21 year old young man; he lives in the city of Camaná, a city that is known for it's beautiful beaches and hot climate. It is an agricultural area, with crops of rice and beans among other things. When he has a little bit of free time he likes to play soccer with his friends from his neighborhood, and after on special occasions he enjoys eating one of his favorite traditional foods "Chupe de Camarones" (A shrimp and fish soup, served with rice, vegetables and an over easy egg.) As a result of his limited economic resources, he only studied through fifth grade of elementary school, but he would have liked to study at university level.   

Day to day Julio works in his own small business as a taxi driver, which allows him to help with the household expenses. he works around ten hours a day and can attend to 40 customers per day. He believes he is doing well in his business because he is very friendly towards his customers and above all because he has the desire to get ahead. 

Julio is very thankful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to the help they provide he will be able to do general maintenance on his vehicle and buy a new battery for his car, because the current battery he has no longer works. As a result of these improvements he will have a car in good working condition, and above all will be able to provide more security to his customers. This will allow him to continue working to make his biggest dream come true, to own his own home.

loans.use: to pay for general vehicle maintenance and to buy a battery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home (put down floors, walls, etc)

loans.name: Nefeen

texts.en:
Nefeen is a 25-year-old married woman who has two family members from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to buy a new furniture and to do maintenance for the rooms. In the future, she wants to expand her home and buying another home.

Since Nefeen is under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura ha logrado seguir con sus ventas, en su pulpería, ha comprado más productos, lo que ah obtenido mejores resultado al apoyar a sus hijos, con los gasto básicos del hogar, su esposo siempre laborando en servicios públicos, su hijo menor en la universidad, el cual también la apoya al despachar en la pulpería.
Maura ha venido obteniendo estos resultados positivos con los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado en varios ciclos, siendo utilizados en la compra de productos consumibles para sus ventas. Gracias a esto ha crecido al tener más demanda.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara granos básicos en arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bidón de aceite, productos lácteos, carne de res, cerdo, pollo, productos en útiles escolares, cosméticos y ropa interior que es lo que desea promover para seguir creciendo en inventario.
texts.en:
Maura has succeeded in continuing to make sales at her convenience store. She has bought more products which have allowed to support her children better and the basic household expenses. Her husband is working as always in public service, and her youngest son is in universidad. Her son also helps her in the convenience store.

Maura has been receiving these positive outcomes with the Afodenic loans. Afodenic has provided her with several loans which are used to buy edible products to sell. Thanks to this she has grown to increase demand.

With this new loan she will buy staple grains, rice, beans sugar, oil, dairy products, red meat, pork, poultry, school supplies, cosmetics and underwear which she hopes to promote in order to continue increasing her inventory.

loans.use: to invest in staple grains, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy herbicides and pay for the workers he will contract to clean up his fields.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 33-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda.

After realising he could not depend on farming because of the seasonal nature of the business, he decided to venture into motorcycle transport and has been in the sector for three years.  The business has challenges, such has accidents and mechanical breakdown, but with the profits he has been able to pay school fees for his children and also buy more land for farming. 

He now wants to buy another motorcycle for business that he will hire; the rider is expected to remit 80% of the daily earnings. Edward is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Digmar

texts.es:
Digmar tiene 38 años, está casado con Enafilia, de 36 años, con quien tiene dos hijos; de 8 y 7 años. Ellos viven en la casa que Digmar construyó en una comunidad nativa.
Junto a su esposa, se dedican al cultivo de coco, plátano, café, maíz, yuca, frutas cítricas y otros productos. Cuando decidieron formar su familia valoraron el aprendizaje que le dieron sus padres, y además porque estos frutos son lo que mejor produce en esta zona. Su rutina empieza cada mañana, cuando sale a limpiar y cuidar sus cultivos porque sabe que la recompensa de su ardua labor vendrá en la cosecha. Él confiesa que le fascina ver sus plantaciones fuertes, sin maleza que interrumpa su crecimiento. Sus metas son de aumentar su producción, por eso ahorrará para adquirir más terrenos. Ahora piensa cultivar maíz que cosechará en 6 meses. 

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y como en anteriores ocasiones piensa pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Orito”, donde es el presidente, por ello su participación en el grupo es muy comprometida.
El dinero de este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de maíz (con 1000 soles) y fertilizantes para dichos cultivos con lo restante.
texts.en:
Digmar is 38 years old, she is married Enafilia who is 36 years old, with whom she has two children of 8 and 7 years old. They live in the house that Digmar built in an indigenous community. 

With his wife he makes a living growing coconut, plantain, coffee, corn, yuca and citrus fruits, as well as other products. When they decided to create their family they valued the lessons that their parents gave them because these crops are the best that are products of the region. His routine begins each morning when he goes out to clean and care for his crops because he knows the fruit of his hard labor will come at harvest time. He confesses that it fascinates him to see such strong crops without any plagues that could interrupt their growth. His goal is to increase his production. To do so he will save in order to obtain more land. He now is planning to plant corn that he will harvest in six months. 

This is his sixth loan with MFP and as in the previous occasions he plans to pay his installments on time. He belongs to the communal bank Union Orito where he is president. As such, he is very committed to his participation in the group. The money for this loan will be invested in the purchase of corn seeds (1000 soles) and fertilizers for the crop with the remainder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds (1000 soles) and fertilizers with the rest of the money.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Nawal prefers that her photo not be on the Internet, so the above photo is of her husband. Nawal is a 30-year-old married woman who has three family members from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to buy electronics and satellite dishes to sell. She wants to develop her project by increaseing the number of products. In the future, she would like to expand her project to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years, he has been trading in second hand shoes and with the proceeds, he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. He is also a farmer who mainly grows bananas and beans. Inadequate capital is the factor affecting the business most. He would like to educate his children and increase his stock. Francis intends to use the loan to buy used shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Melfete

texts.en:
Melfete is a 63-year-old successful Romani woman from the Roma vulnerable ethnic minority community of northeastern Albania. She is married and has four adult children. All of them live in a little town of not more than 15,000 residents. 

Since the beginning of the regime collapse, she separated herself from the rest of her community, in search of a better life. Even though she had never gone to school or received any education whatsoever, she was able to open a business in shoe repairing. Melfete had practiced the skills since she was 20 years old and has now become an expert shoemaker. Everyone in the town respects her and almost everyone has become her client.

Melfete is requesting a loan from Kiva via the VisionFund Albania institution and is seeking a positive reception from the lenders. She wants to buy materials for repairing shoes.

Her future plans include expansion of the store and hiring someone to assist her.

loans.use: To buy shoe repair materials

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luz, who is 48 years old and a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a driver, and the mother of two children. Together with her husband, they manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Luz operates an Internet café business. There is more need now than before for services like these, as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as people who just love to surf the net and check any social network.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.
 
To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Luz dreams of  being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Sadete

texts.en:
Sadete is married and has three children with the oldest one being nine years old. Her family lives in a small mountain village in the central eastern part of the country. Sadete has been the only financial provider for her family for the past couple years, “and this makes it difficult most of the time, yet, it doesn’t stop me from doing what I’ve got to do”, she said.

Sadete has been in the livestock/agriculture business for the past 18 years and is happy with it. She cultivates crops, raises animals and sells dairy products to locals and dairy farms.

She is now requesting a loan to build a decent stable where both of her cows and the 12 sheep will fit in nicely. She will also build a separate space to store the animal feed. This is her second loan, with the previous one being completely paid back.

loans.use: To build a stable

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 37 años, junto a su pareja tiene dos hijos de 14 y 3 años. Su casa es propia y está fabricada de materiales rústicos.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años, en las parcelas que su comunidad le otorgó. Produce plátanos, kión, café y naranjas, hace un año recién que empezó con las cosechas del café, por eso esta vez la producción no fue buena, pero el año siguiente las ventas serán mucho mejores; mientras tanto va cubriendo sus principales gastos de la venta de las naranjas. Este año recién inició la siembra del kión y asegura que después de cosecharlo obtendrá buenas ganancias. “Ahora el kilo está 3 soles, pero espero que suba”, menciona. Sus planes son por ahora el cuidado y mantenimiento de sus cultivos y su próxima siembra de maíz.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por ello se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además, pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Orito”, donde es una de las socias más alegres y organizadas.
Este dinero lo invertirá en el pago del personal que limpiará sus cultivos, también comprará semillas de maíz y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old. Together with her partner she has two children, aged 14 and 3. Her house is her own, and it is made from rustic materials. 

She has worked in agriculture for 12 years, on lands that her community provided to her. She grows plantains, ginger, coffee and oranges. Just a year ago, she started harvesting coffee, and for that reason the production was not good this time, but next year her sales will be much better. In the meantime, she covers her main costs through the sale of oranges. Just this year she also started planting ginger, and she is sure that after harvesting it she will obtain good profits. "Now a kilo sells for 3 soles, but I hope it will rise," she notes. Her plans for now are to care for and maintain her crops and her upcoming corn planting. 

This is her third loan with MFP, and thus she is committed to being punctual with her loan payments. She belongs to the “Unión Orito” communal bank, where she is one of the most cheerful and best-organized members. 

This money will be invested in paying the workers who will clean up her fields, as well as buying corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers, and to pay workers who will clean up her fields.

loans.name: Thomaq

texts.en:
Thomaq is in his 50s and married with 2 adult children who still go to the university. They live in a major city in the southeastern part of the country. Thomaq has served as a police officer since he was young and four years ago, he was laid off from the division he worked for all these years. 
 
Being the only one to support his family financially, they all suffered the financial difficulties for some time until he purchased a used vehicle for his transportation business in order to make ends meet.

Thomaq is now applying for a loan for the first time to take his vehicle to the auto repair shop and his word to Kiva lenders is that he will pay back this loan without a delay and in full. In addition, he wants to thank all the lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Raisalam

texts.en:
This is Raisalam, a 47-year-old mother and resident of Payatas, Philippines who lives with Abdul Jalil, her business partner. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Raisalam operates a phone accessories retail business. Buying her items from a wholesaler, she sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Products can range from cell phone accessories like head phones to cell phone holders and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Raisalam also offers school supplies and jewelries in her store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessories to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business soon to give her family a good future. As well, Raisalam faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of phone accessories.

loans.name: 060313 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future. Hằng is 26 years old and married with one child. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 060313 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu solidarity group. Hằng  supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hằng has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hằng has been involved in her business for three years. The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle for raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, a 54-year-old mother and resident of Payatas, Philippines who is married to Romeo. She and her children manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nida operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials which they sell to junk shops for a small profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries.

Nida also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan to help buy scrap materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nida hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to provide her children with a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Panchita

texts.en:
This is Panchita, 60, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a driver, and is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.                    
         
Panchita operates a phone accessories retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory items from a wholesaler and sell them per piece/pack for a profit. Products can range from cell phone accessories like headphones, cell phone holders, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She also has a loading (pre-paid credits) station. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Panchita hopes to expand her business soon and to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of phone accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
This is Lea, 43, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lea operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lea dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
This is Jessica.  She previously received a PHP 20,000 loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jessica dreams that all her children will be able to finish studies and have a good life. She hopes to renovate her house and that her pigs won’t get sick so that her business will maintain a good income. She wants stability in her business. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to have time for God after a long week of work.    

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional pigs and feed needed in her business.

loans.name: 060206 Tiền Phong - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhâm works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and sell.
Nhâm is 50 years old and married with three children.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 060206 Tiền phong - Hoằng Châu solidarity group. Nhâm supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Another child is grown up.

In 2004, Nhâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhâm has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nhâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nhâm hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum operates a rice farming business from Baray district to generate income for her family. 

She is 27 years old and has two young kids. Her husband helps manage most of the maintenance of the rice field. 

In this season, Chum and her husband are very busy with their farm work.  There are many tasks to complete on time upon the season. Despite hardship, however, Chum’s spouse takes his spare time to pursue a recycling business for additional profit.

For lack of capital to invest in this recycling business, Chum is requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR for the purchase of recycled materials. She believes that the loan will help her to improve their businesses. 

In the future, she hopes to make her family-owned businesses grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to purchase recycled materials to sell for profit.

loans.name: 030104-Đông Hải - Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bảy works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise and resell in the future.

Bảy is 42 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 030104-Đông Hải - Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Bảy supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Another child is grown up. 

In 2006, Bảy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bảy has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bảy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bảy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Bảy hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy lives in Paddaya with her loving family. To make a living, she established a business that is highly appreciated by consumers. And that is selling cold food within her sari-sari store (variety store). She makes different kinds of ice candy for sale. She is very happy that most of the time her products sell.

To make more money from her business, she is requesting additional funds in the amount of 30,000 PHP to purchase milk, sugar, ice, and groceries, and to pay her electric bill. Her business consumes a lot of electricity. Mercy hopes that her requested loan will be a great help in achieving higher income and to help her accommodate all expenses.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, ice, and groceries, and to pay electric bill

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak is 28 years old and a resident from Prey Chor district.  

She has operating a direct-selling business as the main source of her income, as well as to help her spouse earn an income for the family. She has been doing this for more than 10 years, generating 10,000 KHR per day. Her profit goes for her daily sustenance and allowances for her only child.

Kak would like to purchase more stocks of merchandise to sell in the store.  That is why she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to purchase such things as noodles, sweets, snack foods, canned items, spices, beverage, personal care products, home use products, and other miscellaneous household things. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to have more customers and increase her sale.

loans.use: to purchase such as things as noodles, sweets, snack foods, canned items, home use products, and other household things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and electric mower to remove the weeds from his crops.

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Hamadi, who is in his late 20s, is single. He has had been selling clothes for six years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to acquire a plot to build his house on, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to start building his house. His dream is to one day be able to own a house and expand his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mango," which totals 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start building his house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria. She previously accessed a 20,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of their two trucks. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Gloria would like to apply for another 29,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their two trucks. Her profits from the business will definitely help to meet their daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria hopes to acquire another truck and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their trucks.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously accessed a 12,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Alma would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from the business will definitely help to meet their daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is 25 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a van driver who travels from Aparri to Tuguegarao and vice versa. He travels this route every day just to earn a better income for his family.

With his determination to achieve a better way of living, he is requesting a loan of 35000 PHP to use for repairs and maintenance of his van and to purchase personal products such as makeup, lipstick and perfume for his wife’s business.

This source of income would increase their net income every month and improve their living. He hopes that their business will prosper through the loan requested.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance for his van and to purchase personal products such as makeup, lipstick and perfume for his wife’s business.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Rachel, who is in her late 20s, is single with two children who go to school. She has been running a restaurant business for four years now. She works from 6am to 7pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

She requested her 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more stock of food and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock of food. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Ulezi" with 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush lives in Yeghvrad village with her husband and son. Anush is a nurse in Kapan hospital, which is in the region's center. In addition, Anush is also involved in agriculture; together with her husband, she raises cattle and hens. Anush would like to start wheat cultivation on her farm, for which she needs sufficient funds. With the help of this loan she plans to purchase wheat seeds. Anush will also purchase wheat to feed her cattle. This loan will help Anush to gather the wheat harvest next year. Anush won't have to purchase wheat for the cattle; besides, she will sell part of the harvest and earn more agricultural income.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and wheat to feed cattle

loans.name: Ambrien

texts.en:
Ms Ambrien is 28-year-old lady, who has been operating a stitching business for the past three years. Her designing is much appreciated by her customers. She works hard to diversify her livelihood as she understands that she needs not solely depend on the income earned by her husband. Her husband works in a tuck shop and earns a low income to support his family. 

Ambrien has three children. She is in charge of providing them with the basic necessities of life.  Her business has improved gradually. She needed to expand her business so Ambrien contacted Kashf Foundation for the first time. She requested a loan of Rs. 20000/- to buy different colors of cloth in bulk to increase sales. She is very excited about this new loan and wants to spend a portion of profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy different colors of cloth in bulk to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 36-year-old married woman from Baqa'a Jordan who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for materials for embroidery such as fabric, beads, thread and silk. In the future she would like to expand her project and to help her husband financially. She also hopes for her sons to have a good education.

loans.use: to pay for materials for embroidery

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms Sajida is a 43-year-old separated woman. Life has been hard for her since her separation from her husband. She came to her parents house but didn't want to be a burden on them. She is a courageous lady and didn’t lose hope, and started her business by purchasing a buffalo. She now has 5 cows and a good business of milk. She maintains a good client list.

Sajiida has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her 5th loan cycle and requested a loan of Rs. 35,000/- to buy one more cow to meet the increasing demand efficiently. She desires to spend her profits on the betterment of her family and children’s education.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to meet the increasing milk demand efficiently.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is involved in agriculture: he breeds pigs and hens, cultivates corn, and grows apricot, granate and appletrees. Ashot plans to purchase two calves and start breeding cows, too. With the help of this loan he will also purchase forage for the cattle and fertilizer for land cultivation.

Ashot lives with his wife, mother and four children (one son and three daughters). Ashot earns his main income by selling his harvest and agricultural products at the local markets. Development of agriculture is vital for this farmer to sustain his family and ensure a prosperous life for them.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, forage and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is a 30-year-old married woman.  She is mother of three daughters.  She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.

She is doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past 10 years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors, and she is famous in providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. 

She is also doing sewing as her part time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. 

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied from the support of Kashf foundation. She has applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed. She wishes to use part of profits on her husband’s health.

loans.use: To buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Gabi

texts.es:
Gabi tiene 36 años, su pareja es Andrés, con quien tiene dos 2 hijos: Julisa de 14 y Anderson de 10 años. Viven en la casa que construyeron en su terreno propio.
Son como 15 años los que ella se dedica a la agricultura, siembra sus productos en parcelas propias y en otras que arrienda. “Siembro más papas y arvejas, a veces maíz, pero en una sola fecha del año”, dice. Su trabajo inicia en las mañanas, atendiendo a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela, luego se encarga de preparar los alimentos que lleva hasta sus terrenos de cultivos, allí Andrés va trabajando en el cultivo de sus productos. De esa manera trabajan ambos, pero en las temporadas de mayor faena tienen que contratar a más personal para cubrir con las demandas de sus comparadores. Sus planes más cercanos son de sembrar arvejas, pues afirma que los precios de venta dentro de 4 meses serán favorables.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y se compromete en cumplir con puntualidad sus cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Cumutay”, donde es la presidenta, ya que es una persona muy activa y responsable.
Gabi destinará los 1500 soles en la compra de tres bolsas de semillas de arvejas, ya que iniciará una nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Gabi is 36 years old. Her husband is Andrés. She has two children with him: Julisa, who is 14, and Anderson, who is 10. They live in a house they built on their own land.

For about 15 years, she has been a farmer. She plants her products on land she owns and on other land she rents. “I plant mostly potatoes and peas and sometimes corn, but only once a year," she says. She starts working in the morning, taking care of her children so they can go to school. Later she prepares the food she takes to her cropland where Andrés works in their plantings. This way they both work together but when the work load is heavy they hire laborers to cover the demands of their buyers. Her plans for the near future are to plant peas, because she says that the sales price in four months will be favorable.

This is her 11th loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She belongs to the “Los Pioneros de Cumutay” communal bank and she is their president, sinec she is an active and responsible person.

Gabi will use the 1500 soles to buy three bags of pea seeds, since she will start a new crop.

loans.use: to buy three bags of pea seeds because she will start a new crop.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Néstor tiene 38 años, su pareja es Valvina, de 33 años, con quien tiene tres hijos. Viven en la casa que Néstor construyó con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Con el apoyo de su esposa, hace 20 años compró sus terrenos de cultivos, donde ahora cultiva papa, arvejas, maíz y otros productos; y en todos sus años como agricultor aprendió estrategias para aumentar su producción en la misma extensión de terreno, con técnicas de irrigación, de fertilización y otras. “El problema es cuando las heladas malogran las plantas, por eso ya sé qué productos cultivar en esos meses”, dice. Para más adelante, piensa adquirir más terrenos y así aumentar su producción. Ahora sembrará arvejas.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y está muy contento por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su producción. En su grupo comunal “Los Pioneros de Cumutay” es un socio muy puntual en las reuniones.
Él invertirá estos 1000 soles en la compra de una bolsa de semillas de arvejas (500 soles) y cuatro bolsas de fertilizantes (120 soles cada una).
texts.en:
Néstor is 38 years old. His wife is Valvina, who is 33 and with whom he has three children. They live in the house that Néstor built with great effort and dedication.

Twenty years ago, with the support of his wife, he bought his farm land, where he now grows potatoes, peas, corn, and other products. In all his years as a farmer, he learned strategies to increase his production on the same area of land, using techniques of irrigation, fertilization, and others. "The problem is when the frosts spoil the plants, so for that reason I know what products to grow in those months," he says. In the future, he is thinking of acquiring more land and thus increasing his production. Now he will plant peas.

This is his 9th loan from MFP, and he is very pleased to get it, since he needs it urgently to improve his production. In his communal bank, "The Pioneers of Cumutay," he is a very punctual member at the meetings.

He will invest the 1000 PEN in the purchase of a bag of seeds for peas (500 PEN) and 4 bags of fertilizer (120 PEN each).

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
This is Nimfa. She previously accessed a 12,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase additional stock of textiles to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Nimfa would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of textiles to expand her product inventory. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nimfa hopes this expansion will continue and allow her to provide a good future to her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of textiles.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita. She previously accessed a 24,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase larger quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

Juanita would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita hopes her business grows in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 52 years old and lives in Lasam. She is married and has three children. 

She has been operating her grocery store for more than a year. Right after her contract as OFW (overseas Filipino worker) from another country, she established her business.  From the business, she is able to earn about PHP 15,000 a month because her store is located exactly in the public market of the village. 

In order to continue improving her business, she is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more products, such as shampoo, 
mineral water, sacks of sugar, flour, cans of cooking oil, and snack foods for her store. 

She wishes she could make her store grow in order to save funds for her family.  And she will make it through the loan, her hard work and patience.

loans.use: to buy more products, such as shampoo, mineral water, sugar, flour, cooking oil, and snack foods

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who go to school. She has been a tailor for three years now. She works from 10am to 5pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 19th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more clothes material and started building her business room. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy a tailoring machine and to finish building her business room. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house and she expects to go to school. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Faraja" which totals 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and finish building her business room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of palm tree branches in bulk and two boxes of chicks.

loans.name: Bahra's Group

texts.en:
Bahra is a 34-year-old Iraqi woman; she is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Bahra is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Bahra has six years' experience with the small home-based business activity and she is constantly on the lookout to make improvements to the services she can offer. In the past she successively received and repaid a Relief International - Microfinance Iraq loan which she used for buying an iron and ironing board and a table. She is now taking out a new loan to improve her work conditions through the renovation of her work area.   

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to renovate her work area

loans.name: Noyemzar

texts.en: Noyemzar is involved in agriculture. She cultivates wheat, tomatoes, and grows fruit trees. Noyemzar needs to cultivate the plants with fertilizer in order to prevent deseases. She also wants to purchase wood to heat the greenhouses in winter, as well as pay for watering the land and the orchard. This is important for Noyemzar to keep earning stable income for agriculture and cover her household costs.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, wood and watering costs

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is a 55-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She's been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now.

Ines is in need of additional funds for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. 

Ines dreams of improving her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Rose Eden

texts.en:
This is Rose Eden, 37, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Roy, an IT specialist, and is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rose Eden maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and this generates the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Rose Eden's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rose Eden hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is 50 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. For the past 15 years, Zam has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Zam to generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Zam hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling better quality clothes and also expand into a wholesale shop. 

Zam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Garik

texts.en: Garik lives in Azatavan village, Ararat region, with his wife and two little sons. Garik serves in the local military unit as a contract serviceman. In addition, he runs a farm, where he grows peppers and fruit trees. Garik would like to renovate the greenhouse in his farm and start growing poppies there. To implement this purpose, Garik has applied for this loan to purchase poppy seeds and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. Garik also plans to hire workers to do the cultivation. This will allow Garik to earn more income from agriculture and invest in its further development.

loans.use: to pay for hired workers, poppy seeds and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: Jeraldin

texts.en:
Jeraldin is a 22-year-old married woman and a mother of a one-year-old daughter from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.

Jeraldin is in need of additional funds for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 11,000 PHP to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs.

In the future, Jeraldine wants to expand her current business and save for future schooling of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 26 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Frank has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Frank to generate greater profits and improve his family standards of living. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to build a commercial house. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 42 años, su pareja es Víctor, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cuatro de ellos. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde de los 18 años; ahora, al lado de su pareja, producen plátanos, café, naranjas y achiote en dos parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad le otorgó. Una de las labores más sacrificadas dentro de su trabajo es la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus cultivos, por eso recurre a contratar personal operario para apresurar las faenas. Flora obtiene ganancias satisfactorias cuando vende sus cosechas, especialmente con el café y el achiote. Sus planes son claros, ansía producir más y tener más terrenos, por ello trabajará hasta conseguir el dinero necesario.
