Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y menciona que pagará las cuotas con responsabilidad. Además, pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Orito”, donde es una socia activa y participativa en las charlas educativas.
Flora destinará 1500 soles en el pago de los servicios del personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus terrenos. Con lo restante comprará herramientas agrícolas.
texts.en:
Flora is 42 years old. Her partner is Victor, with whom she has five children, but now they only live with four of them. She owns her house and it is located in a native community of the central jungle.

She has been working in agriculture since she was 18 years old. Now, Flora and her partner produce bananas, coffee, oranges and achiote on two plots of land that were given to them by the community. 

One of the most often sacrificed tasks within their work is the cleaning and maintenance of their crops, which is why they resort to hiring operating staff to expedite these tasks.

Flora obtains satisfactory profits when she sells her crops, especially the coffee and achiote. Her plans are clear: She is anxious to produce more as well as have more land, and she will work for this until she gets the money necessary.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and this speaks to the fact that she will make the loan payments responsibly. Furthermore, she belongs to the communal bank “Unión Orito” where she is an active partner and participates in the educational chats.

Flora will dedicate 1500 soles to the payment of the services of the staff that she will hire for the clean-up of her land. With the rest she will buy agricultural tools.

loans.use: to pay for the services of the staff that she will hire for the clean-up of her land and for the purchase of agricultural tools

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 31 años, su pareja es Aquiles, con quien tiene dos hijos: Lucila de 13 y Talía de 7 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia, la que construyeron sobre un terreno propio.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 19 años, ahora al lado de Aquiles, producen papas, arvejas y maíz. Le agrada el trabajo de campo, ya que en la libertad de sus sembríos  también puede cuidar a sus vacas, de las que obtiene leche. Lleva como 15 años en ambas actividades y menciona que le agrada más las labores agrícolas porque obtiene mayores ganancias. “Tengo terrenos propios, pero en algunos meses prefiero arrendar porque hay mayor siembra”, dice. Esa es su rutina y le gusta, por eso continuará con su labor por mucho tiempo más. Ahora tiene planificado iniciar una nueva siembra de arvejas y papas, pues se acercarán las lluvias y ella quiere aprovecharlas.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP, promete que pagará las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Cumutay”, donde participa activamente con sus ahorros y reuniones.
Luz destinará este dinero en la compra de tres bolsas de semillas de arvejas (2000 soles), lo restante será para adquirir semillas de papa y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Luz is 31 years old. Her husband is Aquiles, with whom she has two children, Lucila, who is 13, and Talía, who is 7. They live in their own house, which they built on their own land.

She has worked in agriculture since she was 19. Now, at the side of Aquiles, they produce potatoes, peas, and corn. She likes the farm work, since in the freedom of their fields, she can also care for their cows, from which she obtains milk. She has done both these types of work for about 15 years, and she mentions that she likes the farm work more because she obtains better earnings. "I have my own land, but in some months I prefer to rent because there is more sowing," she says. This is her routine, and she likes it, and so she will continue with her work for a long time. Now she plans to begin a new planting of peas and potatoes, since the rains are near and she wants to take advantage of them.

This is her 7th loan with MFP. She promises that she will make her payments on time. She belongs to the communal bank, "The Pioneers of Cumutay," where she participates actively with their savings program and meetings.

Luz will use this money to purchase three bags of seeds for peas (2000 PEN), and the rest will be used to acquire seed potatoes and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds for peas and potatoes, as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 43 años, vive con su madre, de 78 años, a la que cuida y atiende en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Su soltería se la debe al cuidado incondicional hacía su madre, a quien atiende desde que perdió a su padre. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de papa, maíz y arveja, trabaja en ello desde los 20 años. Antes contaba con el apoyo de su madre, pero ahora que está delicada de salud recurre a personal que contrata para las arduas labores. Cada vez que cosecha obtiene buenas ganancias porque con el paso del tiempo supo contactar con compradores regulares que llevan sus productos hacia distintas ciudades. “En el mercado mayorista se vende bien, por eso toda mi cosecha la llevo hasta allá”, dice. Esta vez se esmerará en la siembra de arvejas y el cuidado de las papas que ya tiene sembradas.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Cumutay”, que es un grupo sólido y la ayudó a salir adelante gracias a sus ahorros.
Marcelina calcula que todo el dinero que solicita ahora, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 43 years old and lives with her 78 year old mother whom she looks after in the home she inherited from her parents.  She is single due to the unconditional care she gives her mother since the death of her father.  Since the age of 20, Marcelina has been making a living in agriculture with her main crops being potato, corn, and peas.  In the past, Marcelina was able to count on her mother for help but now that her mother's health has weakened Marcelina contracts employees for arduous work.  

She makes good revenue in every harvest because, over time, she has made contacts that have become regular buyers and bring her products to distant cities.  "I do well in the main market which is why I bring my entire harvest all the way there," says Marcelina.  This season she will focus on the planting of peas and the care of the potatoes which are already planted. 

This is her eleventh loan with MFP.  She is a member of the communal bank "Los Pioneros de Cumutay", a strong group that has helped her save and move forward in life.  Marcelina calculates that she will invest all the money from this loan in purchasing fertilizer for the potato crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her potato crop.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is 37 years old. She lives in a small village of Mtskheta district. She is married and has three children. (7, 15 and 16 years old) Her children go to the local school. Elene’s husband works as a house painter and gets a monthly income. The family has a small dairy farm. In particular they own two milk cows and produce cheese which is sold locally. Elene works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to put aside some savings and improve the living conditions of the family.

Elene requested a loan to drill a water well and roof the kitchen. After the well is drilled, the family will be provided with water. Elene will purchase building materials for her kitchen roof as well. The existing roof is damaged and drips water. With this loan, she will implement her plans and improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your support

loans.use: to drill a water well and roof the kitchen

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat is involved in agriculture: he keeps cows and chickens and grows fruit trees. Azat would like to increase the number of his cows, for which reason he has applied for this loan to purchase two calves. Azat will alos purchase hay to feed the cattle. 

Azat lives with his wife and son in Abovyan village. Azat's wife works as a teacher at Abovyan school. Development of agriculture is important for Azat to gather sufficient income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and hay for fodder

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. She's been running a sari-sari store (a convenience store) for more than 17 years now. This is the source of her income. Rubina is a hardworking woman willing to give her best for the welfare of her family.

Rubina is in need of funds for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 3000 PHP to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, snack foods and other items. With this loan, she will be able to cater to more clients.

In the future, Rubina wants to expand her business and continually support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, snack foods and other items.

loans.name: Ramadhani

texts.en:
Ramadhani is 57 years old and lives in the town of Mwambalazi in the coastal region of Kenya. He is married and has six children, three of whom are currently in school. He is a retired teacher who has been devoted to his work for several years. 

For the past three years, Ramadhani has been working hard to manage his grinding machine that serves the entire neighborhood. In addition to providing services, he also buys maize, grinds it to flour and sells the flour to the general public.

To help expand his business, he has requested a loan of 20000 KES from Kiva partner Yehu. The loan will be used to expand his business by allowing him to purchase sacks of maize. It will help Ramadhani generate greater profits and improve his family's status. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be able to open up more local businesses.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años, su pareja es Alejandro, con quien tiene tres hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos: Denis de 19 y Adeliz de 18 años.
Ya son como 23 años los que Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales productos son papas, arvejas y maíz. Gracias a los suelos de su zona no tiene pierde; “la gente prefiere comprar productos de esta zona porque son más saludables y porque usamos más fertilizantes orgánicos”, menciona orgullosa. Además de ser su principal fuente de ingresos, la agricultura le trae momentos de alegría junto a su familia, ya que juntos limpian, abonan y cosechan sus productos. Además obtiene otros ingresos adicionales gracias a la bodega que tiene en su casa. Ella es una mujer que no se cansa fácilmente, por eso esta vez sembrará un saco de semillas de arvejas, en las que trabajará con su pareja.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Los Pioneros de Cumutay”, donde es la tesorera, por ello se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente.
Con los 500 soles de este préstamo comprará una bolsa de semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old. Her husband is Alejandro, with whom she has three children, but now they live with only two of them: Denis, who is 19, and Adeliz, who is 18. Rosa has already worked in farming for about 23 years. Her main products are potatoes, peas, and corn. Thanks to the soil in her region, she doesn't have losses. "The people prefer to buy products from this region because they are healthier and because we use more organic fertilizers," she mentions proudly. In addition to being her principal source of income, farming brings moments of happiness to her whole family, since they clean the fields, fertilize, and harvest their products together. Furthermore, she obtains other additional income thanks to the store that she has in her house. She is a woman who doesn't rest easily. For this reason, she will now plant a sack of pea seeds, working together with her husband.

This is her 11th loan with MFP. Her communal bank is called "The Pioneers of Cumutay," and she is the treasurer. For this reason she promises to make her payments punctually.

With the 500 PEN from this loan, she will buy a sack of seeds for pea.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 42 años, junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos, con lo que vive en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde los 17 años, cuando apoyaba a sus padres en el campo, por esa razón también enseña sus conocimientos a sus hijos. Produce papas, arvejas, maíz y otros productos, pero lo más difícil de realizar es la cosecha, porque requiere de más tiempo, esfuerzo, personal y dinero. Por eso recurre a la contrata de personal cuando llegan estas temporadas. Lo que más le gusta es la venta de los productos, los lleva a la ciudad (ubicada una hora y media de su localidad). Actualmente tiene cultivada una parcela de papas, por eso esta vez se esmerará en sus cuidados, además piensa sembrar una bolsa de semillas de arvejas.

Es la primera vez que Antonia accede a un crédito con MFP, por eso dice que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Cumutay” y menciona que será participativa y responsable dentro del grupo.
Ella invertirá estos 600 soles en la compra de una bolsa de semillas de arvejas para iniciar una nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Antonia is 42 years old. She and her husband have three children, with whom they live in their own house.

She has worked in agriculture since the age of 17, when she helped her parents in the field. For this reason, she also teaches her knowledge to her children. She produces potatoes, peas, corn, and other products, but the most difficult task is the harvest, because it requires more time, effort, people,  and money. For this reason she turns to hired help when these seasons arrive. What she likes most is selling her products. She takes them to the city located an hour and a half away. Now she is cultivating a plot of potatoes, so she will need to be conscientious in her care of them. In addition, she is planning to plant a bag of pea seeds.

This is the first time that Antonia has taken out a loan from MFP, and therefore she says that she will make her payments punctually. She belongs to the communal bank "The Pioneers of Cumutay," and she mentions that she will participate in and be a responsible member of her group.

She will invest these 600 PEN in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds to begin a new planting.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds to begin a new planting.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 38 años, su pareja es Basilio, con quien tiene dos hijos. Juntos viven en la casa que construyeron en un distrito netamente agrícola.
Hace casi 20 años que siembra papa, arveja, y maíz. “Los productos de mi localidad son buenos porque crecen sanos y fuertes”, comenta Bertha. Pero no sólo se dedica a ello, también tiene animales; vacas, cerdos y burros, estos últimos que le ayudan a trasportar el abono o también los productos que cosecha. Ahora piensa cultivar una parcela más de arvejas, pues su meta futura es mejorar su producción y venderla en otras ciudades.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y como en ocasiones anteriores, menciona que será puntual en los pagos. Su banco comunal se llama “Los Pioneros de Cumutay”, donde se siente contenta porque sus socios son puntuales y responsables.
Con los 1000 soles que ahora solicita comprará una bolsa de semillas de arvejas y tres bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Bertha is 38 years old. Her husband is Basilio, with whom she has two children. They live together in the house they built in a totally agricultural district. She has been planting potatoes, peas, and corn for almost 20 years. "The products from my area are good because they grow healthy and strong," comments Bertha. But she doesn't just do this. She also has animals: cows, pigs, and donkeys. The donkeys help her to transport the compost and also the products that she harvests. Now she is planning to grow a field of peas, since her future goal is to improve her production and sell it in other cities.

This is her third loan from MFP, and, as on the past occasions, she mentions that she will be punctual with her payments. Her communal bank is called "The Pioneers of Cumutay," where she feels happy because its members are punctual and responsible.

With the 1000 PEN that she is applying for now, she will buy a bag of pea seeds and three bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds and three bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Libertad En Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Libertad en progreso es un banco comunal conformado por 14 socias, quienes viven en su mayoría por la comunidad de Zhizho en Cuenca, lugar que ofrece varios lugares para disfrutar de hermosos paisajes, su gente aun mantiene su vestimenta tradicional, su cultura y tradiciones, su mayor fuente de ingresos es la cría de animales, la agricultura y el comercio, también salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. Su gente al igual que todas nuestras socias son mujeres que a pesar de las dificultades que se presentan  día a día nunca pierden su carisma y su buen humor, trabajan dando su mejor esfuerzo  para sacar  adelante a  sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Alicia, forma parte del banco comunal Libertad en Progreso hace 2 años, antes vivía por el sector de Zhizho pero ahora vive por el sector de los Trigales en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 44 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 13 años de edad, no tiene casa propia.
 
Doña María Alicia para poder estar al cuidado de su hogar tiene una tienda en su casa hace 12 años, en ella labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. También se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha que son verduras y hortalizas las vende en un mercado de la ciudad, esto lo realiza desde hace 6 meses pero solo los días de feria.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas de papas para sembrar y también  víveres para su tienda.

Su meta es tener un vehículo para llevar sus productos al mercado. 

Las fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
"Liberty in Progress" is a communal bank consisting of 14 members, the majority of whom live in the Zhizho community in Cuenca, a place that offers various locations for enjoying its beautiful scenery. Its people still maintain their traditional clothing, their culture, and traditions. The major source of income is raising animals, agriculture, and commerce. They also go to the city to work in different occupations. Its people, like all the women who are members of this bank, never lose their charisma and their good humor, in spite of the difficulties that are presented to them day by day. They work, giving their best effort to raise their families.

One of the members of this group is Señora Maria Alicia, who has been part of the communal bank "Liberty in Progress" for two years. Before, she lived in the Zhizho sector, but now she lives in the Los Trigales sector of the city of Cuenca. She is 44 years old. She is a widow, and from her marriage has a daughter of 13. She does not have her own house.

In order to be able to care for her home, Doña Maria Alicia has had a store in her house for 12 years. She works in it every day from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. She also works in agriculture, and she sells the greens and vegetables that she harvests in the city market. She has been doing this for 6 months, but only on holidays.

She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of potato seeds to plant and also groceries for her store. 

Her goal is to have a vehicle to take her products to the market.

The little photos are of two members who were not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to plant and groceries for her store

loans.name: Leoniso

texts.en:
Leoniso is a resident of Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has been engaged in a food vending business with his wife for more than five years now. They cook food and sell it to the people in their community.
Leoniso works hard to earn a living. As of this time, he is in need of additional funds for his venture. He is asking for a loan 5,000 PHP to buy more ingredients for the food vending business. With this, he and his wife will be able to cook more for their customers.
Leoniso hopes of making his business a success. He also wants to save for future use.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the food vending business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Helen has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Hrant

texts.en:
Hrant is involved in agriculture. He raises hens and turkeys, grows wheat, mushrooms, and fruit trees. Hrant has applied for this loan to purchase mushroom seeds and fertilizer for the land cultivation. Hrant also plans to purchase wood to heat the green houses and hire workers to help him with the land cultivation. 
Hrant lives with his parents. His elder brother has left for work abroad to sustain the family. The development of agriculture will allow him to come back and get involved in agriculture together with his brother.

loans.use: to pay for mushroom seeds, fertilizer, wood and pay hired workers

loans.name: Karume Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his early 40s, is married and has no children. He has been selling chicken (broilers) for five years now. He works from 4pm up to 10pm daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 12th loans from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more chickens because his business was on shaky ground, he paid rent and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy more chickens.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Karume" which totals 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira, 43, is married to Mkalla. They have five children and they live in downtown Mwambalazi.

Njira has had a fish selling business for four years in a strategically located spot at the market. Thanks to her sacrifice she’s getting ahead and also helping her husband with everyday expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to increase her working capital to increase her sales. With the loan, she will purchase more fish and cooking oil. Her dream is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tomebamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tomebamba está formado por 6 mujeres quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad, han formado este banco comunal porque son amigas y conocidas de sus trabajos o de sus lugares en donde viven. Viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como la Atenas del Ecuador, esta bañada por 4 ríos, los que le hacen una ciudad única, su gente transmite a sus visitantes su calor y carisma haciéndoles sentir como en casa, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten  sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Narcisa de Jesús, es una socia que se encuentra realizando créditos en la Fundación Espoir hace 6 años, ha pasada por algunos bancos comunales en donde tiene varias amigas pero ahora es socia del banco comunal Tomebamba, vive por la comunidad de Zhizho lugar que pertenece a la parroquia Victoria del Portete. Tiene 41 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil trabajo que aprendido desde muy joven, la casa en la que viven es propia, esta es la recompensa a su arduo trabajo conyugal.

Ella pasa en casa al cuidado de su familia, como vive en el campo se dedica a la cría de pollos, ganado, cerdos y cuyes a los que los vende en la ciudad, también borda  polleras (vestimenta típica), esta actividad la aprendió desde que tenía 14 años de edad.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
 
Su meta es tener más maquinas de coser para llegar a tener un taller de bordado y confección de ropa.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Tomebamba" consists of six women who live in different places of the city. They formed this communal bank because they are friends and know each other from their work or from the place where they live. They live in the surroundings of the city of Cuenca. 

This city is known as the Athens of Ecuador, surrounded by four rivers, making it a unique city. Its people transmits warmth and charisma to the visitors, and make them feel at home. Its cuisine captivates the palate of its visitors. They still retain the culture and traditions of their people.

They work in different activities, which allow them to provide for their families. One of the members is Rosa Narcisa de Jesús, who has been requesting loans in Fundación Espoir for six years. She has been part of some communal banks where she has some friends, but now she is a member of the communal bank "Tomebamba". 

She lives in the community of Zhizho, belonguing to the parish of Victoria del Portete. She is 41 years old, is married and fruit of their conjugal union she conceived two children who are 14 and ten years old. Her first son studies at the school and her second daughter in a small school in the village. Her husband works as a building worker, job that he learned when we was very young. They own the house where they live, it's the reward for their hard work as a couple.

She stays at home taking care of her family, and because she lives in the country, she raises chickens, cattle, pigs, and guinea pigs to sell in the city. She also embroiders skirts (traditional clothes). She learned this activity when she was 14 years old. 

The loan will be invested in buying a cow to keep growing the business of raising animals. Her goal is to have more sewing machines so she can have a workshop for embroidery and tailoring. 

The small picture is from a member who could not be there when the picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nancy Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy esta hace 9 años el banco comunal El Cisne, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene una geografía accidentada la cual le da paisajes que se quedan gravados en la memoria, su gente es trabajadora y se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad.

Doña Nancy es una señora casada, tiene 38 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 18, 17, 8 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija vive independiente ya que es casada, su segunda hija pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres del hogar, sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como operario en una carpintería, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora Nancy labora en los quehaceres del hogar, como tiene espacio se dedica a la agricultura siendo sus cosechas para el consumo de su hogar, es negociante de animales hace 12 años compra animales los cría o engorda por un tiempo y los vende.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y cerdos para continuar con el negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un mayor número de animales para el negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy has belonged to the communal bank El Cisne (The Swan) for nine years. She lives in the parish of Valle en Cuenca, a place that has a rugged geography which means landscapes that stay in the memory. The people are hard-working and they work trading, raising animals and growing crops, and many are working in the city.

Nancy is 38 and married. She has 4 children, ages 18,17, 8, and 7. Her oldest daughter lives independently now that she is married. Her second daughter is at home helping with household chores. Her youngest two children are studying in the city school. Her husband is an operator at a carpenter's workshop. The house they live in is their property.

Nancy does the household chores. Since she has space, she works growing crops, her harvests going to feed the household. She has been an animal dealer for 12 years. She buys animals, raises them or fattens them for a time, and sells them. 
 
She is going to invest her new loan in purchasing chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs to continue with the business. 
 
Her goal is to have a greater number of animals for the business.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
"To become successful in life" is the main goal of every individual like Aileen, who is 32 years old and still single. She is a college graduate but due to lack of job opportunities, she decided to engage in a hog-raising business to generate income. She aims to improve the business and make it a viable source of income to help her parents in financing the education of her younger brother and sister, and to save some for her future. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional 50,000 Philippines pesos to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to work out her plan and is hoping that someday, she will be successful as she continues to work hard and strive for it.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Armanush

texts.en:
Armanush lives in Jermuk town with her two sons. Armanush is an accountant at a local company. She also helps her sons to run the farm, where they breed cows and rabbits. 

Armanush has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. She plans to purchase a cow, a calf and 12 rabbits. This will significantly increase Armanush's income from agriculture, which is important for her to cover the family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a calf and 12 rabbits.

loans.name: Welyn

texts.en:
Welyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Welyn buys and sells different kinds of flowers in their community. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more flowers to resell like roses and daisies.

Welyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Welyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of flowers to resell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 40 years old, married and has two school-age children. She owns and manages a variety store while her husband cultivates their farmland. They aim to increase their income to cover their necessities and to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and become professionals someday. To increase their income, Mary Ann plans to improve her variety store by increasing her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. Due to inadequate capital, Mary Ann is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy additional soft drinks, grocery items, feed, rice, kitchen wares, frozen foods, cosmetics and school supplies to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks, grocery items, feed, rice, kitchen wares, frozen foods, cosmetics and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Aminata  Ale Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Aminata Alé est créé le 09 juillet 2011 date de son inauguration ; ce groupe de micro entrepreneurs PC 01 est constitué de 33 femmes qui habitent le même quartier, appartiennent à la même religion musulmane, sont parentes, amies ou voisines. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce, l'aviculture, la transformation des fruits et légumes.

Madame Sokhna la responsable est âgée de 62 ans,elle est mariée mère d'un enfant qui est adulte. Elle a un magasin et mène un commerce de planches pour la construction et la menuiserie et en même temps de l'aviculture.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en blanc.

Elle achète les palettes de planches à Dakar pour les revendre à Saint Louis son magasin se situant dans un quartier de la ville.

Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son commerce en achetant des palettes pour 100000 F afin de satisfaire la clientèle et les revenus servent de fonds de roulement.


Les besoins de la famille et personnel sont pris en charge par les bénéfices de l'aviculture.

Elle souhaite renforcer son pouvoir d'achat.
texts.en:
The "Aminata Alé" Banc Villageois was created on July 9, 2011, that date being its inauguration day.  This group of PC 01 micro-entrepreneurs consists of 33 women who live in the same neighborhood, belong to the same Muslim religion, and are either relatives, friends or neighbors.  Their main activities are business, poultry farming, and the processing of fruits and vegetables.

The group's leader, Sokhna, is 62 years old, married, and the mother of one adult child.  She has a shop and sells timber for construction and carpentry.  She is also involved in poultry farming.  In the photo, she is on the right-hand side, dressed in white.

She buys pallets of timber in Dakar and resells them in Saint Louis, her shop being located in one of the city's neighborhoods. 

Her loan will be used to boost her business as she will buy timber for an amount of 100,000 F in order to meet her customers' needs.  Earnings will be used as working capital.

Her personal and family needs are covered by the profits she makes from poultry farming. She hopes to increase her purchasing power.

loans.use: to buy timber for resale.

loans.name: Ponirah

texts.en:
Ponirah works as a farmer. Ponirah’s income each month is uncertain, and it is just enough for everyday living expenses. The husband of Ponirah is just an ordinary farmer and they have three children. Ahdiman is the second child of Ponirah and eager to continue his education. With the Student Loan program of Kiva, Ponirah wishes to apply for a loan to finance Ahdiman in order to continue his education. In the picture is Ponirah and Ahdiman, his son.
Ahdiman is a vocational school student living in Jeruklegi and is  far away from home. By looking at the condition of his parents, Ahdiman hopes that the Student Loan program can help ease the burden on his parents. He dreams of becoming a mechanic. Ahdiman believes he can achieve this goal.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor expenses for her rice-growing business

loans.name: Rosa Herlinda

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia hace 2 años al banco comunal El Arenal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca por la parroquia de San Joaquín, este lugar tiene hermosos paisajes y su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, aun mantienen la cultura de sus pueblos.

Ella tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, 4 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus 3 hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan   económicamente. Su esposo tiene un taller de carpintería en el cual trabaja, su casa la han construido en unión conyugal siendo este el fruto de su trabajo.
 
La Señora Rosa es una mujer que realiza varias actividades sin descuidarse su hogar, trabaja hace 15 años en la siembra de hortalizas, también compra para luego vender en un mercado de la ciudad, labora todos los días sin un horario fijo, en su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como son cerdos y pollos.
 
Los créditos anteriores le han permitido crecer en el negocio y para surtir sus productos, ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para comprar semillas y abono para sus cultivos y también va a comprar pollos para seguir en este negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en estos negocios que le han permitido darle estabilidad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the El Arenal communal bank for 2 years.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, part of the San Joaquin parish, a place with beautiful landscapes and where the people farm and raise animals while maintaining the culture of their villages. 

She is 54 years old, married and has 7 children from that marriage- 4 of whom are married and living independently, and 3 of whom are single and working and help her financially. Her husband has a carpenter’s workshop where he works. They have built their house during their marriage, the fruit of his labors. 

Rosa is a woman who participates in a variety of activities without neglecting her household. She has worked for 15 years planting vegetables, and also buys vegetables to sell at the city market. She works every day without a set schedule. At home, she takes care of the animals--pigs and chickens. 

Previous loans have allowed Rosa to grow her business and to supply products. She will use this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops, and she will also buy chickens so she can continue this business. Her goal is continue to grow these businesses, which have allowed her to provide her household with financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and chickens.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a very determined man who is fully dedicated to his business and running his retail shop. It has produced good results and he works hard to see it expand. Juma tell us that he used his previous loan to fully invest in his shop. 

Thanks to the support given he has been able to increase his sales. Stock has gone down and he wants to increase his inventory, however, he does not have enough capital to reach his goals. He is requesting another loan in the amount of KES 40,000 to add more stock of rice, bales of flour, sodas, and other small items like sweets. He still focuses on his dream of owning a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, flour, sodas, and other small items like sweets to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 57 years old and now a widow. She lives in a village with one of her children and they help each other in managing their farm land by planting rice and some vegetables. She also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She aims to strengthen her hog-raising business and make it viable and profitable. 

Wilma planned to raise more pigs for sale, but due to inadequate capital she is asking for a loan of P49,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve her business and is hoping that someday they will become financially stable and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: La Inmaculada  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
La Inmaculada es un banco comunal que está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar  de clima frió pero su gente de un corazón muy cálido, este lugar nos regalan hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su gente en especial los más antiguos conservan sus vestimentas típicas, laboran en las tareas del campo como es la agricultura y crianza de animales, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades economías las que les permiten mejorar la economía de sus hogares.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Esther, forma parte del banco comunal La Inmaculada hace 3 años y medio tiempo en el cual los créditos le han beneficiado para continuar con su trabajo en el campo. 

La Señora Esther es una mujer muy joven con apenas 25 años, es casada y ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad y sus dos últimos hijos pasan en una guardería. Su esposo labora en el oficio que aprendió de su padre que es la de albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad, la misma que fue construida con el apoyo conyugal.
 
Ella se dedica a realizar las labores de su hogar y a trabajar en el campo, cría cuyes, cerdos y gallinas, se dedica a la agricultura siendo su cosecha para el consumo de su hogar y también para la venta. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para crecer en la cría y venta de estos animales y también para alimento para todos sus animales.
 
Su meta es mejorar su casa.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
La Inmaculada is a communal bank that was formed by 5 female members and 1 male member. They all live in different parts of the Santa Ana parish in Cuenca, where the weather is cold but the people are warm-hearted. It’s a place that has beautiful landscapes where you can enjoy nature. The people there, particularly the eldest, continue to wear typical clothing and do fieldwork like farming and raising animals. Many people work in the city doing different jobs that help them improve their financial situation at home. 

One of the members of this group is Esther. She became a member of the La Inmaculada communal bank 3 and a half years ago. Since then, loans have helped her to continue to work in the fields. 

Esther is a young woman, barely 25 years old, who is married and has 4 children aged 9, 6, 4 and 2. The two older children study at the local school, and the two younger ones go to daycare. Her husband works as a bricklayer, a trade he learned from his father. They own their house, which they built together. 
 
Esther does household work and also works in the field. She raises guinea pigs, pigs and hens, and also farms, with her harvest used for the household and for sale. She will use the loan to buy chickens to raise in the brood, and to buy food for all of her animals. Her goal is to improve her house.
 
The small photo is of the member who couldn’t be there when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann, aged 33, is married and has been blessed with two children. She and her spouse are raising their children in Siem Reap province. Chann is involved in growing rice on around one hectare and a half of farmland while her husband provides transportation service to serve their family as the income. However, their income seems barely enough to cover their daily expenses due to the high cost of commodities. In connection with this situation, Chann tried hard to raise more profit by operating a small grocery store located adjacent to her house. 

Chann wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase merchandise to sustain her current retail business. She will borrow 1,200 USD to purchase canned items, noodles, beverages, snack foods, shampoos, cosmetics, home use products, and other miscellaneous household things for her store. She hopes to earn more profits, which she can use to pay for her son's education. She hopes to get this loan and thanks all of you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase canned items, noodles, beverages, snack foods, shampoos, cosmetics, home use products, and other miscellaneous household things for her store.

loans.name: Jackeline Andrea

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú!

Les presento a Andrea, una joven estudiante de Derecho en una universidad peruana. Además de estudiar, ella trabaja vendiendo tubérculos en un mercado de su localidad. Andrea es madre de un pequeño niño; ella nos cuenta que, en un inicio, eso complicó un poco sus estudios y agudizó sus problemas económicos. Sin embargo, gracias a su esfuerzo y decisión ella no se dio por vencida.

Ahora Andrea está muy contenta porque su préstamo fue aceptado y con él va a poder comprarse una computadora que le ayudará mucho en sus estudios.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es lograr culminar sus estudios superiores y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijito; ella está decidida a terminar los 3 años de universidad que le quedan para concluir su carrera.

¡Andrea le agradece su apoyo!
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!

This is Andrea, a young woman who is studying Law at a university in Peru. As well as her studies, she also works selling tubers in a local market. She has a small child, and mentions how this made it difficult to study at the beginning, as well as heightening her financial problems. However, thanks to her effort and determination, she didn’t give up.


Andrea is very happy now, as her loan was accepted and she will use it to buy a computer. This will be a great help for her during her studies. Her biggest dream in life is to finish her university education, and to give her young son a better life. She is determined to complete the three years of university that she has left to finish her degree.


Andrea thanks you for your help!

video.title: Kiva Borrower JACKELINE ANDREA from Peru

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Johnan

texts.en: Thirty-three-year-old Johnan lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For four years he has been trading in produce and its from the proceeds that he has been able to buy land for farming. Like all farmers, his business is affected by a prolonged dry season and disease outbreak, nevertheless, he has a dream of venturing into mechanized agriculture and also having a food store that can sustainably supply the market all year round. Johnan is requesting for a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Siempre 10 Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Les presento a Georgina, la Tesorera del Grupo Siempre 10 al Progreso. Georgina tiene 59 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.

Georgina confecciona artesanías, como bisutería (cadenitas, aretes, pulseritas, collares) y carteras. Ella ha estudiado para auxiliar de educación y por eso empezó trabajando como docente de niños de 6 y 7 años; pero un día enfermó y no podía trabajar más. En esa época, su amiga María (otro miembro del grupo) la animó a participar en un taller de bisutería organizado por Edaprospo; luego de participar en aquel taller ella comenzó a  elaborar y vender este tipo de productos. Además de eso, más tarde también aprendió a confeccionar carteras.

Con el préstamo Georgina va a comprar materiales para confeccionar carteras y bisutería. Ella y 2 amigas, también miembros del grupo, quieren comprar más materiales para empezar a confeccionar productos que venderán en Diciembre (la época de verano en Perú).

A Georgina le encanta tener este pequeño negocio porque la hizo independiente y porque puede ayudar a su familia con su trabajo. El sueño de Georgina es tener en su casa una pequeña tienda para mostrar y vender sus productos.

Georgina es la señora en el medio, que habla en el video. ¡Georgina le agradece el apoyo brindado!

Nota: El señor en el video es el esposo de una de las socias del grupo - Flor De Jesús que está a su costado con cartera negra.
texts.en:
This is Georgina, the treasurer of the Siempre 10 al Progreso group. She is 59 years of age, married, and has two children.

Georgina makes hand-crafted items such as jewelry (small chains, earrings, little bracelets and necklaces) and purses. She studied to be a classroom assistant, and started off working as a teacher of six and seven-year-old children. However, one day she became sick and could no longer work. At that time her friend María (another member of the group) encouraged her to take part in a jewelry workshop organized by Edaprospo. After doing so she started to make and sell these kinds of products. In addition, later on she started to make purses.


Georgina plans to use her loan to buy materials to make purses and jewelry. Along with two friends (who are also members of the group), she plans to buy more materials to make products to sell in December (which is summer time in Peru). Georgina loves having this little business, as it made her independent and allows her to help her family by working. Her dream is to have a small store in her house, where she can display and sell her products.


In the video, Georgina is the women in the middle who is speaking. She thanks you for all your help!


Note: The main in the video is the husband of one of the group’s members, Flor De Jesús, who appears beside him with a black purse.

video.title: Kiva Borrower JANET ALBERTA from Peru

loans.use: To buy materials to make hand-crafted items such as jewelry (small chains, earrings, little bracelets and necklaces) and purses.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33, married, and has two sons. Together with her husband, they aimed to improve their status of living to give their children a better life. They own a one hectare rice field but they have no time to cultivate it because they have another job. Therefore, they agreed to hire some farmers to cultivate their rice fields so that they will have something to harvest. 

To work out their plan, Marites is asking for additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy the needed agricultural inputs like fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice seedlings. They are hoping that they will improve their farming business and have a plentiful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost and expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es:
¡Buenas tardes!

Mercedes es uno de los miembros del Grupo “Mujeres Exitosas”. Mercedes tiene 73 años y 10 hijos pero sigue con inmensa energía dedicándose a su trabajo.

Mercedes tiene una bodega ya hace más de 30 años, donde ofrece abarrotes, bebidas y verduras. Aparte su negocio, Mercedes trabaja como voluntaria en un comedor comunal todas las mañanas. Comedores comunales son programas, manejados por voluntarios, financiados por el gobierno de Perú y que ofrecen comidas a muy bajo costo a personas con bajos recursos.

Con el préstamo, Mercedes quiere preparar su bodega para les fiestas patrias (las fiestas nacionales del Perú) y comprarse más mercancía, principalmente cervezas y gaseosas.

Mercedes es una mujer luchadora que con el fruto de su esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda, una de sus mayores metas.

El sueño de Mercedes es seguir implementado su negocio y así asegurar sus ganancias.

Mercedes está feliz al saber que otras personas colaboran con su progreso y agradece a todos los inversionistas Kiva. Mercedes es la segunda desde la derecha y es la señora que habla en el video.
texts.en:
Greetings!

Mercedes is one of the members of the Mujeres Exitosas (Successful Women) group. She is 73 years of age and has ten children, but with her tremendous energy continues to work.

Mercedes has had a store for more than 30 years, where she sells groceries, drinks and vegetables. Apart from her business, she also volunteers in a communal canteen every morning. These canteens are programs which are managed by volunteers, and are funded by the Peruvian government, offering meals at very low costs for people with scarce financial resources.

Mercedes plans to use her loan to prepare her store for the national holidays in Peru and to buy more merchandise, mainly beers and soft drinks. She is a determined woman and, with her hard work, has managed to build a home, one of her biggest goals. Her dream is to continue developing her business, thereby ensuring her income.

Mercedes is happy to know that other people are willing to collaborate in helping her get ahead, and thanks all Kiva lenders. She appears second from the right, and is the woman who is speaking in the video.

loans.use: To get her store ready for the national holidays in Peru and to buy more merchandise, mainly beers and soft drinks.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el Grupo Unidos Para el Progreso.

Jesús, uno de los integrantes, es un joven de 28 años que sabe muy bien lo que quiere para él y para su hijito de 3 meses.

Jesús se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, como quesos y mantequillas. Él todavía no tiene una tienda así que trabaja por pedidos. Jesús empezó este negocio hace más de 3 años, gracias a la motivación de su madre, que también se dedicaba a dicha actividad.  

Jesús ha solicitado este préstamo para aumentar la variedad de productos que tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes, y con él va a comprar quesos de Huancayo, una provincia en el centro de Perú muy afamada por sus quesos.

Jesús está estudiando Ingeniería Ambiental y en futuro espera poder combinar sus estudios con su negocio, ya que sueña abrir una empresa dedicada a los productos orgánicos.

Jesús quiere agradecer a todos los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible su progreso. Jesús es el joven en la segunda fila, que habla en el video.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!
 
This is the Unidos Para el Progreso (United for Progress) group. One of its members is Jesús, a young 28-year-old man who knows what he wants for himself and his three-month-old son.

Jesús works selling dairy products, such as cheese and butter. He doesn’t have his own store yet, so he works to order. He began this business more than three years ago, thanks to encouragement from his mother who also works in the same business.

Jesús has requested this loan to increase the variety of the products he sells to his customers. He plans to use the loan to buy cheeses from Huancayo, a province in central Peru which is well-known for its cheeses. He is also studying Environmental Engineering, and in the future hopes to be able to combine his studies with his business. His dream is to open a business offering organic products.

Jesús would like to thank all the Kiva lenders for making this progress possible. He is the young man in the second row, who is speaking in the video.

loans.use: To buy more cheese.

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Sergio de 53 años de edad, es casado, su esposa trabaja como costurera y apoya en los gastos del hogar, tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando. El trabaja como Policia Para la Municipalidad de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años. Solicita su 1er credito de mejoras de vivienda para realizar la reconstruccion de una casa que se encuentra en mal estado, con la cosntruccion y mejora de esta casa cambiará la situacion de calidad de vida de esta familia ya que contaran con mayor espacio para la familia y mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Sergio is 53 years old, married, and has two children in school. His wife works as a seamstress to help with the household expenses. He has been a police officer for the Municipality of Juigalpa for three years. 

Sergio is asking for his first home improvement loan to rebuild a house that is in bad condition. Improving the construction of his house will change his family's quality of life, because they will have more space for the family and better security.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia activa del banco comunal El Arenal a la cual pertenece hace 3 años, vive por la comunidad de Misicata pertenece a la parroquia Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia es famosa por sus aguas termales, sus hermosos paisajes, la gran variedad en su gastronomía y la cultura y tradiciones de su gente.

La Señora María es una mujer muy joven  tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 niños de 11, 9, 7 y 2 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella es propietaria de un pequeño taller de costura en la cual se dedica a confeccionar ropa deportiva, trabajo que realiza hace 2 años, aprendió este oficio trabajando y por habilidad, labora de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

Los créditos anteriores que ha realizado en el banco comunal le han permitido crecer poco a poco en su negocio y ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando telas, hilos y repuestos para sus maquinas de coser.
 
Su meta es  seguir creciendo en el negocio y comprarse una maquina bordadora.
texts.en:
Maria is an active member of the El Arenal communal bank, which she has belonged to for the last three years. She lives in a community called Misicata, part of the town of Baños near Cuenca. Baños is famous for its hot springs, beautiful landscapes, varied cuisine, and the culture and traditions of its people. 

Maria is a young woman who is 26 years old. She is a single mother with 4 children aged 11, 9, 7, and 2. Her first three children attend primary school in the city. She does not have her own house so she rents. 

She is the owner of a small sewing shop, where she has earned a living for the last two years making sportswear. She learned this trade by working and natural skill, and works Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule. 

Previous loans from the communal bank have allowed Maria's business to grow little by little. Now, she will invest this new loan in buying fabrics, thread, and parts for her sewing machines. 

Maria's goals are to continue growing her business and to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and parts for sewing machines

loans.name: Aracelly Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Aracelly Habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe en el Barrio Madardo Andino, junto a su esposo han hido sacado adelante a su hijo ya que su mayor sueño es terminar su casa, con el apoyo de su esposa quien labora para una empresa privada le ayuda con los gastos del hogar pero a ellos se le dificulta mucho ya que no pueden recoger de una sola vez el dinero para poder construir, con este nuevo financiamiento comprar parte de los materiales que necesita para continuar con la construccion. 500 Bloques, 3 quintales de Hierro, Viaje de Arena, Cemento. Aracelly muy agradecidad con Afodenic quien por medio de Fondo Kiva brindan ayuda y confianza en personas como ella de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Aracelly, a resident of Ticuantepe in the Madardo Andino neighbourhood, together with her husband have been raising their son. Her ultimate dream is to finish her house. Her husband, who works for a private company, supports her by helping with the household expenses but it’s difficult for them to collect enough money at one time to build their house. 

This new loan will help them buy a portion of the materials that they need to continue with the construction: 500 cinderblocks, 300 kilograms of iron, a truckload of sand, and cement. Aracelly is very grateful to Afodenic who, through Kiva funds, provide assistance and place their trust in people of scarce resources like herself.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: cinderblocks, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for education expenses.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María es una socia activa del banco comunal El Cisne hace un año,  vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene una geografía accidentada la cual le da paisajes que se quedan gravados en la memoria, su gente es trabajadora y se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad.
 
Doña María tiene 53 años, está casada y ha concebido 4 hijos de 25, 22, 13 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo está casado y vive independiente, su segunda hija trabaja y ayuda  económicamente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hijo en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción prestando sus servicios como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de propiedad conyugal.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura siendo sus cosechas para el consumo de su hogar, también se dedica a la cría de ganado y la leche que obtiene la vende en su comunidad. 
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra cerdos para iniciar con la crianza de estos animales.
 
Su meta es criar más animales.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the El Cisne communal bank for a year. She lives in the Valle parish in Cuenca, a place where the geography creates landscapes that stay in your memory. The people are hardworking and work selling things, raising animals and farming. Many work in the city.
 
María is 53 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged 25, 22, 13 and 11. Her oldest son is married and lives on his own. Her second oldest, a daughter, works and helps her financially. Her third child, a son, goes to high school and her youngest son is in a local primary school. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They own the house they live in together. 

She works in agriculture, using her harvests for household consumption. She also raises cattle and sells the milk she gets in the community.
 
She will invest the new loan in buying pigs to start raising these animals. Her goal is to raise more animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Gerardina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive en la parroquia del Vallle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene una geografía accidentada la cual le da paisajes que se quedan gravados en la memoria, su gente es trabajadora y se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 21, 18, 16, 7, 3 de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y estudia en el colegio, sus dos siguientes hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su cuarto hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa agradece a Dios por su salud ya que si no se encontrara muy bien en su salud no pudiera trabajar, su familia también está gozando de muy buena salud.
 
Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales pequeños como pollos, cuyes y cerdos, los cuales le permiten aportar a la solvencia de su hogar, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad.

Con su crédito anterior compro pollos, cuyes y cerdos para seguir creciendo en esta actividad, las ganancias que obtuvo le fueron de mucha ayuda para solventar varios gastos de su hogar por lo cual está muy contenta, la cancelación de dicho crédito lo realizo sin dificultad alguna y en las fechas indicadas. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de cuyes, pollos y cerdos para seguir creciendo en esta labor.
 
El banco comunal le gusta porque recibe una atención personalizada por parte del promotor.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the El Cisne communal bank. She lives in the El Vallle parish in Cuenca. This place has a geography that creates landscapes that stay in your memory. Its people are hardworking and work selling things, raising animals and in farming. Many of them work in the city. 
 
Rosa is 35 years old. She is married and has 5 children, aged 21, 18, 16, 7,  and 3  yearsold. Her oldest works and goes to high school. The next two work and help her financially, and her fourth son goes to a primary school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and they own the house they live in.

Rosa thanks God for her health, since if she wasn't healthy, she wouldn't be able to work. Her family also is in good health.  

She raises small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs. This allows her to contribute to the household expenses. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

With the previous loan, she bought chickens, guinea pigs and pigs to keep growing in this activity. She income she earned was a lot of help for various household expenses and she is very happy about that. She paid off that loan without any trouble on by the indicated time. She is going to invest the new loan in buying guinea pigs, chickens and pigs to keep growing in this business. 
 
She likes the communal bank because she receives personal attention from the consultant.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old and married to Maria, who also contributes to the family’s monthly income.  The couple is blessed with four children.  Joseph operates a curio business. He has been in this business for eighteen years and it earns him a monthly income of 17,750 Kenyan shillings.

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD and he will use the loan to buy more materials for his business, such as paint, varnish and wood. He plans to use the anticipated profit to buy land for farming.

loans.use: To buy more materials, such as wood and paint,  for making curios

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 33-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. After realising the lucrative nature of the cattle business in the area, he decided to venture into it and in five years has been able to reap tangible benefits.  Alex is also a farmer, and he earned start-up capital for the cattle trade from the sale of beans. Alex says that his business is usually at boom stage during the festive seasons in December, and he wants to buy cattle early to mitigate the risks of inflation and lack of supply.

Like all good fathers, Alex dreams of educating his children to attain a better future. Alex needs the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is now 42 years old and married to Patrick, who contributes to the family income and upkeep.  The couple is blessed with five children. Mary has a pullover knitting business.  She been in this business for ten years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to purchase a knitting machine. She is planning to use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

She hopes to enhance productivity and to maintain her business assets.

loans.use: To buy a knitting machine

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 53 years old and a farmer.  She is married to Francis, a businessman, and they are blessed with three adult children. Jane has been in poultry rearing as a primary business and dairy farming as a secondary business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 19,000 that she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Jane will use the loan to buy chick feed and more chicks.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes that she will be able to buy a piece of land and build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to buy chick feed and more chicks.

loans.name: Karoli

texts.en:
Karoli is 36 years old, and lives in a house made of mud wattle and daub in Kagadi, Uganda. In order to meet the increasing needs of his family, he decided to start up a retail shop. He is also a farmer and mainly grows maize and beans.

Karoli faces challenges of price fluctuations, high rental fees of the business premises and inadequate capital to meet high demand. Karoli intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and soda  to sell

loans.name: Boucotte Centre 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Boucotte Centre 2 est créé le 13 juin 2008. Il porte le nom du quartier où il se trouve le siège. Ces membres sont liés par un bon voisinage. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Mme Agathe est l'emprunteur en vedette du groupe. Elle est à droite de la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants ( 02 filles et 04 garçons). Elle est âgée de 43 ans.
Elle achète de la viande, des poissons et des légumes pour la restauration et aussi de la boisson pour ses clients. Elle renouvelle plusieurs fois son stock.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte renforcer son activité et aider son époux avec les bénéfices du restaurant pour la scolarité et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Boucotte Centre 2 group was set up on 13th June 2008 and carries the name of the district where its head office is. Its members are good neighbors and their main activity is trading.

Agathe is the group's most significant borrower and is standing on the right of the photo. She is married and mother to six children (two girls and four boys). She is 43  years old. She buys meat, fish and vegetables for her restauration business as well as drinks for her customers. She renews her stock several times. With this loan she is planning on building up her business and with the profits from the restaurant she will help her husband with the children's education and healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy food products and drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is currently in the fruit vending business and now she has three children whom she takes care of single-handed. Her business is currently able to give her a monthly income of Kenya shillings 15,000 which she uses to provide the basic needs of her family. 

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She plans to use the loan to buy more fruit for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will save towards the education of her children. 


In future she hopes to educate her children up to university level and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of sugar, rice, and maize meal.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín tiene 29 años, vive en compañía de su madre y su hermano.
Hace algunos años tomó la responsabilidad de su hogar, por ello abrió un pequeño grifo donde vende petróleo. Le va muy bien, tanto que pudo ahorrar lo necesario para abrir una tienda de comestibles en su casa y además de dedicarse a la ganadería, ya tiene seis vacas y cuarenta ovejas, a las que enseba para luego venderlas. Cuando sus vacas dan cría vende la leche que produce a los ganaderos y vecinos. Ahora desea mejorar su tienda y ampliarla, comprando diversos productos, pues la zona donde vive es muy lejana, por lo que necesita abastecer de mayor cantidad de comestibles.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Huari” y este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece la oportunidad de financiamiento. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables.
Efraín invertirá este dinero en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Efraín is 29 years old. He lives with his mother and his brother. Some years ago, he took responsibility for the home and opened a small pump where he sells oil.  It is going very well for him, so well that he was able to save what he needed to open a grocery store as well as work with livestock. He already has six cows and forty sheep, which he fattens up and then sells. When his cows have calves he sells the milk they produce to ranchers and neighbors. Now he wants to improve his store and enlarge it by buying different products. The area where he lives is very remote so he needs to stock up on a larger quantity of food products.

He belongs to the “Huari” communal bank and this is his fourth loan with MFP. he is grateful for the loan ooportunity. In addition, he promises to make his payments and he likes being a part of the group becasue all of the members are responsible people.

Efraín will invest this money in buying basic necessity products for his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity products for his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth runs her beauty salon and clothing business. She is married and has two children. She describes herself as a responsible and determined person. Elizabeth rents a stall inside the public market of San Mateo, where she sells women’s and men's clothes while the other unit is for her beauty salon. She really wants to succeed, so she's doing her best in order to maintain her business and help other people. 

For now, she has three helpers in her beauty salon because she herself manages her clothing and hog-raising businesses. She would like to make all her businesses profitable, so that she could send her two children into higher levels of education and give them a better way of living.

As her business expands, she is also in need of additional capital. So, she has requested a loan amount of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan in buying chemicals for hair rebonding and one bundle of second-hand blouses for her  clothing business. She hopes that her loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for hair rebond and one bundle of second-hand blouses for her  clothing business

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 54 years old and married to an overseas Filipino worker. She has five children. Clarita sells various goods such as lotion, underwear and cosmetic products. She has three years' experience in this field of business. With her strong determination, she aspires to improve her family's way of living, save some money, educate her children and most of all have a stable source of income to make her goals possible. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. This loan will really help her, because she will use it to purchase a variety of cosmetic products and other goods to help her direct selling business grow. This loan is really important for the continuous development of her business, because it will allow her to gain more loyal costumers to buy her products.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetic products for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 30 years old, and he and his wife Phillys are blessed with two children. He owns a hotel where he works with his wife. He has been in this business for six years, earning an income of KES 100,000 per month. This will be his first loan through KADET. He will use the loan to buy more stock, such as flour, sugar and utensils, for the hotel restaurant. He plans to put the profits back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his hotel restaurant.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena's biggest dream is to continue having her livestock business to be able to continue getting ahead in life. She believes that her sacrifices and determination will have a productive outcome.

Elena raises pigs, rice crops and has a 500 square meter fishpond. Her priority now  is to gain greater income due to her expenses in her rice field and fishpond. So at her very best, she manages her time wisely. Elena is happily living with her long time partner and with her four grandchildren.

Elena would like to buy three piglets and stock hog feed in order to obtain higher income. To achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She hopes to get this loan amount in order to provide her family's needs, save some amount for emergency purposes and educate her four grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and three piglets for her livestock business

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is a single mother of four children living in Hioma, Uganda. After separating from her husband, she ventured into selling fresh fruits and vegetables, a business she has been running for many years after getting start-up capital from her uncle. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children, despite the challenges of seasonal variations and the perishable nature of her goods. She hopes to expand her business to new markets and get modern preservation methods such as a refrigerator in the future. Robinah would like to use this loan to buy fresh foods such as cabbages and beans, among others, to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods such as cabbages and beans to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea is 30 years old and married with two school-aged children. She is a farmer as well as an independent entrepreneur who operates a small general store for additional profit. She has been in this business for five years already and it contributes a lot to her family's finances. She typically generates approximately USD 3 each day from her retail business, most of which goes toward her children's daily sustenance. Chea wants to gradually expand her store in order to attract more customers. As a result, she is asking for a loan of USD 500 to buy merchandise such as sweets, beverages, packed foods, noodles, spices and other household products to sell in her store. She thanks everyone in advance for their support and help.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sweets, beverages, packed foods, noodles, spices and other household products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of Battambang Province's Sangke district, Vanna is a 24-year-old married mother of three children. To overcome her family's hardship, she runs a small stall selling plastic bowls. Her husband also supports her by earning an income as a taxi-driver. She has been in this business for seven years. Vanna has never received a loan through VisionFund before. She has formed a group of two female members to seek a loan. As first-time borrowers, each member of the group is seeking a loan of KHR 1,000,000. As the group leader, Vanna will use her loan to buy more plastic bowls for resale. She hopes to manage her business well so she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy more plastic bowls for resale.

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en:
Musyoka is a 35-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and one daughter, two of whom are school pupils.

For the past year, Musyoka has been operating a wood workshop. This has been a profitable project and his only source of income, but it is not enough to cover his family's cost of living.

Musyoka is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from microfinance organization Yehu to help him purchase more workshop tools such as hammers and hacksaws. This will improve Musyoka's work quality and increase customer demand for him to make and repair furniture. As a result, his income will increase and his family will enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase workshop tools like hammers and hacksaws

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Hebert is a 33-year-old married man who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Two years ago, Hebert started dealing in cocoa since what he produces cannot meet the high demand. He is traditionally a farmer who grows cocoa, maize and beans. His challenges are price fluctuations, theft, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to meet the demand.

As a good father, his personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent residential house. They are currently living in a mud-wattled house. His business dreams are to buy land on which to grow crops and expand his business to new markets. The purpose of the loan is to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 46 years old. She is married and has two adult children. For work, she sells new clothing. She has her locale set up in her neighborhood market and has had this business for five years. She started the business with her husband's help, who already had experience in this line of work.
