loans.use: to perform required maintenance on his car, such as painting the body and fixing many other small problems.

loans.name: Roena

texts.en:
Roena is from Senaki district. She is 63 years old, married, and lives with her husband, grown son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. Roena and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. Her son works as a joiner and earns a monthly income. Roena’s grandchildren go to the local school. The main source of income for the family is their agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where they grow nuts, mandarins and laurel leaves. Roena is involved in animal husbandry as well. She has five milk cows, five calves, three buffalos and three young buffalos. Roena produces cheese and sells it, along with her other agricultural products, at the local open market. In addition, the family owns beehives and sells honey in the nearby villages. Roena is a very hard-working woman with a great deal of experience in her work. 

Roena requested a loan to purchase two milk cows. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the family's income. With the increased income, Roena plans to purchase wood treatment installation for her son. He will work hard and help his family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 23 años, vive con su único hijo, Rolando, en la casa de su madre.
Ella realiza varias actividades; durante la mañana prepara panes y galletas típicas de zona, pues abastece el pedido de algunos clientes y además ella misma los vende en la feria de la ciudad. Asimismo, todas las tardes, vende comida a los trabajadores de la escuela que se está construyendo; y ya por la noche, vende hamburguesas y papas fritas. Ya tiene muchos años dedicándose a este negocio, por lo que tiene muchos clientes. Estos trabajos la ayudan a ser una mujer independiente y sobre todo a mantener a su hijo, darle comida, vestido y estudio; pues lo que más quiere es verlo crecer y tener una carrera universitaria. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Palomitas” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece al apoyo que hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias en su grupo.
Elizabeth invertirá este dinero en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como papas por sacos, aceite por galones y salsas de diversos tipos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 23, lives with her only son, Rolando, in her mother’s house.  She does a variety of things.  In the morning she makes bread rolls and cookies that are typical of the region to fill customer orders and to sell in the local street market.  In the afternoon she sells food to workers at a construction site where a school is being built and at night she sells hamburgers and fried potatoes.  

She’s been in business for many years so has many customers.  These jobs help her be an independent woman and above all to support her son, provide him with food, clothing and schooling because what she wants most is to see him grow and have a university career.

She’s a member of the “Palomitas” (Little Doves) communal bank and this is her 5th MFP loan.  She’s grateful for the support that makes it possible for her to stay in business.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments because she likes working with the responsible, supportive members of her group.

Elizabeth will use this money to buy ingredients food like sacks of potatoes, gallons of oil and various types of sauces for her meal preparation.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Fatmata.  She is single and has no child.   In 2007, Fatmata established her Chairs & Floor Mats business. She began her business because when she graduated from high school, there was not enough money for her parents to pay her college fees, being that her younger siblings’ school fees were also stressing them.  

She decided to engage herself in selling fast food, so she dropped out of school for one year and saved enough to pay her first year's fees.  She continued with her little business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le832,000 every month from this business. Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase plastic chairs - 140 pieces @ Le35,000, with the balance of Le100,000 used for transport. 

In the future, Fatmata hopes to be an importer.  The loan will help as it is additional capital for her business.  Fatmata’s main challenge is the poor road network. Transportation from Liberia to Sierra Leone causes a lot of stress and inconvenience.  She is hoping to acquire subsequent loans from this credit service in order to develop her business and improve her standard of living.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs - 140 pieces @ Le35,000, with the balance of Le100,000 used for transport.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is 49 years old. He is married to Esther, who also contributes to the family’s total income. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the butcher shop business for a period of nine years, earning an income of KES 35,000 per month. This will be his first loan with KADET, and he plans to use the loan to purchase more meat for resale in his butcher shop. He will reinvest the profit back into his business. He hopes to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en: Yasmine is a 39-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and five school-aged children. With her husband's cooperation, she is able to meet her family's needs and offer them a decent way of living. Yasmine owns a small minimarket where she sells a variety of dairy and daily-use products in addition to soft drinks and many other items. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase food provisions for her minimarket. This loan will enable her to diversify her stock, thereby increasing her revenues and thus her income. Yasmine looks forward to expanding her grocery. In the future, she hopes to open other branches and assign her children ownership of these branches.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions for her minimarket.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is a 20-year-old, single man living with one parent and two siblings.  He is from Lebanon.  He has two years of experience working with mobile phones.  He sells various trademark mobile phones and related accessories.

With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, Hadi will be able to increase his selection of new mobile phones and accessories, and purchase prepaid cell phone cards to sell.  Hadi is always looking for new ways to please his clients and offer them good quality products.  He reports that both his income and business sales will increase as a result of the loan.  

In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase its capital.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cell phone cards for resale.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Bárbara tiene 32 años, está separada de quien fue su conviviente, fruto de aquel amor tiene tres hijos de 14, 11 y 10 años, quienes se han convertido en su principal motor y motivo para seguir adelante. Actualmente viven con sus hijos en su casa propia, construida mientras vivió con su ex cónyuge. 

Su trabajo es la venta de jugos y refrescos en un pequeño puesto del colegio de su barrio. Inicia por las tardes cuando ingresan los alumnos mayores, pero su principal clientela son los docentes de la institución. Trabaja desde hace un año en esta actividad y lo hace con ayuda de su hija mayor. Sus ganancias diarias son muy buenas y eso le da la tranquilidad que necesita para sobrellevar los gastos que requiere para la crianza de sus hijos menores. Complementa esta actividad trabajando por las mañanas como personal administrativo en una empresa cervecera de la ciudad en la que vive. Su gran anhelo es poner una juguería en una zona céntrica y concurrida de la ciudad para vender mayor variedad de jugos y al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ganancias en beneficio de su familia.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que responsables y muy solidarias entre sí. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, comprará dos sacos de naranjas y dos sacos de piña para que pueda continuar preparando jugos. También comprará otras frutas y probará nuevos sabores.
texts.en:
Bárbara, 32, is separated from her spouse; she has three children who are 14, 11 and 10 years old who have become her main motivating force and reason to continue forward.  She lives with her children in her own house that was built when she still lived with her ex-spouse.

She works selling juice and soft-drinks in a small stand at her local school.  She starts out in the afternoon when the older students start classes but her main customers are the school teachers.  She’s been working in this business for a year and her older daughter helps her with it.  Her daily profits are very good and this gives her the peace of mind she needs to cover the expenses that arise in raising her minor children.  She also works mornings as an administrative assistant for a brewery in the city where she lives.  Her great dream is to open a centrally-located juice shop in a busy part of the city to sell a larger variety of juices while at the same time increasing profits for her family’s benefit.

This is her second MFP loan and she is grateful to all the people who make the financing possible so she can make her plans a reality.  She also enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy two sacks of oranges and two sacks of pineapples to continue making juice.  She will also buy some other fruits to try new flavors.

loans.use: to buy sacks of oranges and sacks of pineapples and also some other fruit.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió solo hasta la primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a lustrar calzados trabajando por más de doce horas al día en un puesto que tiene en una de las Plazas de la ciudad de La Paz, ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material para la limpieza de los calzados (cremas de colores negro, café, amarillo, neutral, cepillos para lustrar los calzados), ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes..
El sueño de Juan, es aumentar sus ingresos para poder moverse a  una casa en anticrético para ahorrar en el pago de alquileres y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is single and has two school age children.  He lives in a rented house occupying two bedrooms with adobe walls and dirt floors.  The house is located in the city of La Paz's Chuquiaguillo zone.

He only went to elementary school and earns income working shining shoes for more than 12 hours daily in a stand he has in one of the city of La Paz’s squares.  He is the only one who covers education, food and basic utility costs for his family.

He needs the loan to buy cleaning supplies for shoe care (black, brown, yellow and neutral shoe polish, brushes to buff shoes) because he wants to improve his income to help his family and to provide better customer service.

Juan’s dream is to increase his income so that he can move into an ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] house to save on rental costs and to improve his quality of life.  This is the second loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy shoe polish and brushes for his shoe polishing business.

loans.name: Haja  I.

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Haja I.  She is married, and has 1 child aged 7 years, who is school-going. In 2009, Haja I established her Provisions business, selling milk, ovaltine, mayonnaise, sugar, etc. She began her business because she came from a poor background and her parents did not have the capacity to see her through schooling, and by then her elder sister who was a trader was married in Freetown. Haja I joined her sister in Freetown for her to assist her education, but her sister preferred to train her in the business.  

Business is all Haja I knew since she was a teenager.  Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le696,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. She requires this loan in order to purchase milk - 2 carton @ Le440,000, ovaltine - 3 carton @ Le210,000, mayonnaise - 3 carton @ Le200,000, cigarette (gold seal) - 1 carton @ Le700,000, bond street cigarette - 1 carton @ Le1,130,000, and the balance Le60,000 is for transport. 

In the future, Haja I plans to build a house so that she can live peacefully with her family. Transportation is her major problem.  She is hardworking.  She hopes to pay her loan on time in order to acquire subsequent loans.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk - 2 carton @ Le440,000, ovaltine - 3 carton @ Le210,000, mayonnaise - 3 carton @ Le200,000, cigarette (gold seal) - 1 carton @ Le700,000, bond street cigarette - 1 carton @ Le1,130,000 and the balance Le60,000 is for transport.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Abibatu.  She is married and has 4 children, aged 6 months, 6, 8 and 12 years, three of whom are school-going children. In 2002, Abibatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she was brought up by her aunt who was a businesswoman.  She came to live with her because she had not conceived by then.  Her aunt did not think it was necessary for her to go to school as she was helping with her domestic activities.  Abibatu usually accompanied her to the market to trade.  Trading is all she knew from then.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le643,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase waxed cotton - 1 bale @ Le3,000,000. In the future, Abibatu plans to build a house to enable her family to have better living conditions. Rainy season is her major problem, as customers seldom go to the market.  

Abibatu is a hardworking woman.  She is hoping to generate profit from this loan because she will be able to buy enough goods with the money.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase waxed cotton - 1 bale @ Le3,000,000.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: El señor Hilarión de 53 años de edad casado más de 30 años, viven en la comunidad de Chullpani Grande hacia el sud de Colomi, saben leer y escribir, tienen 2 hijos pequeños una familia humilde. El señor Hilarión se dedica al servicio de transporte afiliado en Sindicato de Autotransporte Mixto con ruta Colomi-Cbba y viceversa a la vez son agricultores anualmente venden 70 cargas de papa, 80 de haba, 10 de papaliza, 10 de oca que mayormente se dedica su esposa cultivando en 2 has de terreno herencia de sus padres contrata personal eventual para preparación de terreno, siembra, labores culturales y cosecha de esta forma ellos captan recursos económicos para mantener a su familia. Don Hilarión nos comenta que hizo construir recientemente su casa de material de dos plantas en lo cual invirtieron todo el ahorro que tenían pero les falto dinero para la obra fina, teniendo esta oportunidad ahora tendrán una vivienda cómoda para vivir más felices con sus dos hijos pequeños que les quedan.
texts.en: Hilarion is 53-years-old and has been married for more than 30 years. They live in the community of Chullpani Grande towards southern Colomi. They know how to read and write. They have two small children, a humble family. Hilarion works in transport service in the Sindicato de Autotransporte Mixto (Mixed Transport Union) with a route from Colomi to Cochabamba to back. They are also farmers. Every year they sell 70 loads of potatoes, 80 loads of hay, 10 of ulluco, 10 of another tuber. Mostly his wife works growing on two hectares of land inherited from her parents. She hires temporary employees for land preparation, planting, cultivation labors, and harvesting. This way, they get economic resources to maintain their family. Hilarion tells us that that he had construction done on the two-story house. They invested all the savings they had but they don't have money for the fine workmanship. With this opportunity, they will have a comfortable home to live more happier with the two children who are still with them.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy DVDs, CDs and musical videos at wholesale to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina tiene 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Rolando, quien es el padre de sus dos hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron con el fruto de sus ahorros de varios años.

Su actividad es la venta de comida (desayunos, almuerzos y platos extras) en un espacio que acondicionado en su propia casa. Ese mismo local lo alquila para recepciones y eventos sociales. Se Inició hace más de 2 años realizando pequeñas cantidades y poco a poco fue aumentando. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tienen sus platillos. Antes de tener este negocio no tenía problemas, pero decidió iniciarlo para tener una ocupación, sentirse una persona productiva y una próspera empresaria e independiente. Ahora, viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de ampliar su local para aumentar la capacidad de personas y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y se siente contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará más sillas y mesas para atender cómodamente a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carina, 38, is a hardworking, dedicated woman in addition to being cheerful and kind; she has a strong drive to get ahead.  She’s married to Rolando who is the father of their two children who are 16 and 6 years old who she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  They all live together in the house they bought with savings they earned over several years of hard work.

She sells food (breakfasts, lunches and a-la-carte dishes) in a space she equipped at home.  She also rents out this space for receptions and social events.  She started out more than two years ago making small amounts and gradually increased.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the good profits it produces and the demand her dishes have.  

She didn’t have any problems before starting the business but she decided to start it anyway in order to have an occupation, to feel productive and become a prosperous, independent businesswoman.  Now, seeing the good results, she plans to expand the space to increase capacity and provide better comfort for her customers.

This is MFP loan #4.  She feels happy to know that she’ll have financial support to advance with her business.  Therefore, she commits once more to make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans.  Besides, she likes the work her communal bank does.  She will use the requested 1200 new soles to buy more tables and chairs to provide more customer comfort.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs.

loans.name: Vania

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesanias,la socia vende muñecas,mantas y ceramicas,ella distribuye a las diferentes tiendas donde venden artesania,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar artesania como ceramicas,mantas y muñecas.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues with her business selling crafts; she sells dolls, blankets and ceramics.  She sells to various crafts stores.  She’s been in business six years.  She’s asking for the loan to buy crafts like ceramics, blankets and dolls.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy arts and crafts like ceramics, blankets and dolls.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa privada por más de diez horas al día  y a veces cubre turnos toda la noche ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, estudios y pago de servicios básicos de su familia. Crhistian está estudiando Administración de Empresas y toma materias en horarios que no se cruzen con su trabajo de Agente de Seguridad.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil ya que le será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios en la carrera Administración de Empresas en la universidad.
El sueño de Chistian es ser profesional y mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Christian is single and has no children. He lives in his parents' house, occupying a single room. The house is located in the Pampahasi area of the city of  La Paz.

Currently he earns income, as he works for more than ten hours a day as a security guard at a private company, and sometimes covers all-night shifts. With what he earns he must cover his family's expenses for food, education, and payment of basic services. Christian is studying Business Administration and he takes classes when he is not working as a security guard. 

He needs the loan to purchase a laptop computer, as it will be a great help in his university studies for a degree in business administration. 

Christian's dream is to be a professional, and improve his income so that he can become independent.

This is the first time he has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a computer that will help him in his university studies in business administration.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia tiene 39 años, es una mujer alegre y amable, además de ser trabajadora y decidida. Su pareja es Jorge, quien es comerciante. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo, y en compañía de una sobrina que cuidan y apoyan con los gastos de sus estudios y se preocupan por ella como una verdadera hija.

La actividad de Delicia es la venta de ropa. Recibe su mercadería de manera mensual desde la ciudad capital gracias a una amiga que le realiza las compras en un lugar dedicado exclusivamente a la venta de ropa al por mayor. También se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, para ello cuenta con una bodega que acondicionó en su casa, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes y aprovecha para ofrecerles la ropa que tiene disponible. Tiene cerca de 4 años dedicándose a ambos negocios, se inició con un capital propio y comprando en pequeñas cantidades, viendo los buenos resultados que le generaba sus ventas decidió continuar, ahora ocasionalmente necesita el apoyo de una ayudante a quien paga por día trabajado. Sus planes son de continuar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería, desea ver crecer su negocio y que se refleje en el bienestar de su familia.

Este es su préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP y está contenta y muy agradecida al saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para continuar con su negocio. Por tanto, se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, tal como lo hizo en créditos anteriores, para tener un buen record crediticio y seguir contando con este apoyo. 

Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa (polos, blusas y pantalones), invertirá cerca de 800 soles. El monto restante será para la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Delicia, 39, is a cheerful, kind woman in addition to being hardworking and determined.  Her spouse is Jorge who is a merchant.  They live in the house they bought with much effort.  A niece they care for and support with her schooling costs lives with them and they care for her as if she were their own daughter.

Delicia’s activity is selling clothes.  She receives merchandise monthly from the capital thanks to a girlfriend there who buys it at a place that exclusively sells clothes at wholesale.  She also sells groceries in general; she has a home-based grocery store where she kindly tends to customers and takes advantage of their being there to sell them clothes too.  She’s been in both businesses for about 4 years.  

She started out with capital of her own and buying small quantities.  Seeing the good results she was getting from her sales she decided to continue and now sometimes even needs help from an assistant that she pays by the day.  Her plans are to continue and to increase her stock merchandise; she wants to see her business grow and that it is reflected in her family’s wellbeing.

This is her 8th MFP loan and she’s happy and very grateful to know that she’s being given access to a line of credit to stay in business.  Therefore, she commits to be punctual with her installment payments like she was with previous loans to have a good credit history and continue to able to access this support.

She will use the 1200 new soles requested to buy more clothes (shirts, blouses and pants); she will invest about 800 soles.  She will use the rest to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothes and to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a 49 year old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has had a rice farming business for seven years. Esterlita is in need of capital to improve her business. She is applying for a loan of PHP8,000 to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer. With this loan she will be able to produce a good harvest from the field. In the future, Esterlita wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi âgé de 34ans vit avec sa femme et leur seul enfant à Lomé. Il est détenteur d’un bar dans lequel il vend des boissons. Pour rendre son activité pérenne, il sollicite auprès de WAGES un second prêt pour se ravitailler en boissons à la Brasserie du Bénin. Avec les profits qu’il réalisera, il voudrait ouvrir d’autres bars, acheter un terrain, construire sa propre maison et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Komi is 34 years of age, and lives with his wife and their only child in Lomé. He has a bar in which he sells drinks. To ensure the sustainability of his business, he has requested a second loan from WAGES to buy supplies from the brewery in Benin. Komi plans to use the profits he makes to open other bars, buy a plot of land, build his own house, and ensure that his family gets ahead.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 22 años, es una mujer jovial, llena de metas y aspiraciones en la vida. Vive junto a sus padres, y es por ellos, por lo que día a día se esfuerza para salir adelante.
Su actividad es la venta de gaseosas y cervezas. Tiene una refrigeradora que ha logrado conseguir con ayuda de sus padres y en ella coloca a diario todas sus bebidas. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y solo algunas veces vende a personas que trabajan cerca a su casa. Lleva en ejerciendo esta función desde hace un año y los ingresos que percibe le han servido para mejorar poco a poco su vivienda y cubrir algunas necesidades básicas de su hogar. También ha pasado épocas duras debido a la falta de trabajo, sin embargo se generó su propia fuente laboral y ahora se siente tranquila porque puede aportar al sostenimiento de su familia. A pesar de que le va muy bien, desea establecer otro tipo de negocio que le de mayores ingresos, como una bodega o una tienda de ropa.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cuotas de manera puntual, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya ha observado que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, 800 soles, comprará más bebidas para aumentar su variedad, semanalmente invierte cerca de 250 soles en las cervezas y gaseosas. También comprará algunos abarrotes y otros artículos para iniciar una pequeña tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Diana, 22, is a jovial woman who is full of goals and hopes in life.  She lives with her parents and she strives daily to get ahead for them.  Her activity is selling soft-drinks and beer.  She has a refrigerator that she was able to acquire with her parents’ help that she stocks daily with all her beverages.  Her main customers are her neighbors and sometimes she sells to people who work near her house.  

She’s been in this business for a year and income she earns has helped her to gradually do some home improvements and to cover some other basic household needs.  She’s gone through some tough times due to the lack of employment.  However, she generated her own source of work and now she feels more at ease because she can contribute towards her family’s support.  Despite doing very well, she wants to start another type of business like a grocery store or a clothing store that will produce higher income.

This is her first MFP loan and she thanks all the people who make the loan possible so that she can continue making her plans a reality.  On the other hand, she commits to make her installment payments punctually and she’s very happy to be part of her communal bank; she’s already noticed that all the members are very responsible and mutually supportive.

With the requested 800 soles she will buy more beverages to increase variety.  She spends about 250 soles weekly on beer and soft-drinks.  She will also buy some groceries and other items to start a small store at home.

loans.use: to buy more soft-drinks and also some groceries to start a grocery store.

loans.name: Frank

texts.es:
Frank tiene 21 años, es una joven bueno, amable y trabajador. Es soltero y no tiene hijos todavía, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su hermana y su cuñado.
Su trabajo es la venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas), tiene un proveedor que le lleva los pedidos hasta su casa. Lleva recién 4 meses y reconoce que la falta aprender más sobre el negocio. Trabaja solo y se siente cómodo e independiente generando sus propios ingresos. Por otra parte, en sus ratos libres apoya a su hermana en la atención de una pequeña botica, ya que ella es enfermera, por ese motivo desea establecer una farmacia más grande en convenio con su hermana para que tenga otra fuente de ingreso para él y su familia. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, se siente a gusto pudiendo repartir su tiempo entre las actividades de su casa y sus estudios. Está muy contento porque le está yendo bien por el momento. 

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y agradece a todas las personas que le permiten acceder a este financiamiento para concretar poco a poco sus planes. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser un socio cumplido y puntual, ya que quiere compenetrarse rápido con los integrantes de su banco comunal del cual tiene buenas referencias sobre su solidaridad y responsabilidad.

Con el monto solicitado, 600 soles, comprará 8 cajas de cerveza y 3 cajas de gaseosas para su venta semanal. También invertirá en la compra de artículos de salud (pastillas, jeringas y otros) para empezar con la farmacia.
texts.en:
Frank, 21, is a good, kind, hardworking young man.  He’s single and has no children yet.  He lives in his parents’ house with his sister and brother-in-law.  His work is selling beverages (soft-drinks and beer).  He has a supplier who brings his orders to his house.  He’s been in business just four months and he is aware that he still has much to learn about the business.  

He works alone and feels comfortable and independent generating his own income.  On the other hand, in his free time he helps his sister with her small drug store since she’s a nurse.  Because of this, he wants to open a larger pharmacy in partnership with his sister in order to have an additional source of income for him and his family.  He likes his work very much and feels good being able to share his time between his activities at home and his studies.  He’s very happy because he’s doing well for the moment.

This is his first MFP loan and he thanks all the people who make access to this financing possible so he can gradually make his plans a reality.  On the other hand, he commits to being a responsible, punctual member because he wants to quickly mesh with the other members of the communal bank who are well-referenced because of their support and responsibility.

He will use the requested 600 soles to buy 8 cases of beer and 3 cases of soft-drinks for his weekly sales.  He will also buy some health products (pills, syringes and others) to start with the pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy 8 cases of beer, 3 cases of soft-drinks and also to buy health items to open a pharmacy.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora. Está casada desde hace un año y medio con Leonardo, con quien tiene un hijo de 7 años.
Su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotes. Su bodega está instalada en la parte delantera de su casa, la que se ubica en una zona estratégica de su barrio. Lleva ya 3 años con su bodega y cuenta con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo y su hijo, con quienes se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que los beneficia a todos. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades del hogar, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias, ya que siempre tiene clientes. Gloria tiene muchas ganas de seguir superándose y expandir su negocio hasta convertirse en una gran empresaria de su zona.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria, 31, is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  She’s been married to Leonardo for a year and a half and they have a 7-year-old son.  Her main activity is selling groceries.  Her store is located in the front part of her house that’s located in strategic spot in her neighborhood.  She’s had the store for three years and her husband and son give her unconditional support.  She feels happy to be able to share the business that benefits all of them with them.  She enjoys her work because it gives her free time to do other household chores.  The store generates good profits because it always has customers.  Gloria very much wants to continue improving and expanding her business to become a great businesswoman in her zone.

This is her first MFP loan and she’s grateful to all those who make it possible so she can continue towards her objectives.  On her part, she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very kind and supportive.  She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy larger amounts of groceries to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for growing cassava.

loans.name: Hilma

texts.es:
Hilma tiene 43 años, está casada con Isaac, quien trabaja como empleado por el que percibe un ingreso fijo mensual; junto a él tiene tres hijos de 15, 7 y 4 años. Juntos viven en la casa que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Su actividad es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, los vende desde su casa entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, y también hace entregas a domicilio. Se inició en esta actividad hace más de 4 años y hasta el momento lo realiza sola, tanto en la venta como en la cobranza de los créditos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, gracias a su fiel clientela que ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años. Afirma que no tenía problemas económicos antes de iniciar su negocio, pero se decidió aventurarse en este rubro para tener una ocupación en su tiempo libre, ahora se siente una empresaria próspera e independiente. Espera continuar su negocio y poco a poco implementar un espacio en su casa para que pueda exhibir todo lo que tiene; del mismo modo está ahorrando poco a poco para comprarse un motocarro.

Este es su préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP y está muy contenta y agradecida con las personas que hacen posible este crédito para continuar con sus planes. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 500 nuevos soles, comprará más mercadería para aumentar su  stock de perfumería. Desea comprar al por mayor para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Hilma, 43, is married to Isaac who works as an employee and earns a fixed monthly salary; they have three children who are 15, 7 and 4 years old.  They all live together in the house they built with much effort and dedication.

Her activity is selling beauty products via catalogue.  She sells them at home to family members, friends and neighbors.  She also does home deliveries.  She started in this activity over four years ago and to date still works alone both selling and collecting payments.  She considers the business to be quite profitable because of the good profits it produces thanks to her regular clientele that she’s managed to consolidate over the years.  

She states that she did not have any economic problems before starting her business but she decided to go into this line of work in order to have an occupation in her free time.  Now, she considers herself to be a prosperous, independent businesswoman.  She hopes to continue in business and gradually set up a space at home to display everything she has.  She’s also saving up little by little to buy a car.

This is her 8th MFP loan and she’s very happy and grateful to people who make the loan possible so she can continue towards her objectives.  Because of this, she commits to be punctual with her installment payments like she was with her previous loans.  She comments that she feels good in her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them to be kind, supportive people.

She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy merchandise to increase her stock of perfumery.  She wants to buy at wholesale in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to stock her business.

loans.name: Sara Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Sara Isabel quien lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras quien junto a su esposo vende materiales de construcción desde hace 10 años.  El crédito lo invertirá en materiales de construcción y llantas.
Ella trabaja en ADIM desde hace tres años y con el crédito anterior logro realizar mejoras en el hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Sara Isabel is one of three hardworking and enterprising individuals who help her husband sell construction materials. They have been doing this for the past 10 years. This loan will be invested in construction materials and tires.

Sara has been working with ADIM for three years. Her previous loan helped her to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to sell and tires for her truck.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 29 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y tiene muchas ideas laborales que desea realizar. Convive con Luis, quien es comerciante y el padre de su hija de 2 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
Su actividad es la venta de gaseosas, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda sus bebidas a baja temperatura, al gusto de sus clientes por el clima caluroso característico de su zona. Se inició hace más de 2 años, comprando en pocas cantidades con su propio capital, siempre ha trabajado sola y viendo la buena acogida que tuvo decidió seguir. Antes tenía problemas económicos, ya que los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos del hogar y con la llegada de su hija los gastos aumentaron, de esta manera tomó la decisión de iniciar su negocio que ahora le saca de muchos apuros económicos. Tiene planes de aumentar el stock para incrementar sus ganancias y poder empezar una carpintería en sociedad con su pareja, quien sabe de ese negocio.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro. También asegura que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo responsable y unido.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras al por mayor.
texts.en:
Jessica, 29, is a woman who very much wants to get ahead and has many business ideas she wants to implement.  She lives with Luis who is a merchant and the father of their 2-year-old daughter who she wants to provide with a better quality of life.

Her activity is the sale of soft-drinks.  She has a refrigerator where she stores her beverages at low temperature which is how her customers like them in the typical hot weather in her zone.  She started out over two years ago buying small amounts with her own capital.  She’s always worked alone and noting the good welcome she got decided to continue.  

She used to have economic problems because her spouse’s income was insufficient to cover all household expenses and with the arrival of their daughter expenses increased so she decided to start a business that now helps her get out of many economic tight spots.  She plans to increase stock in order to increase profits and start a carpentry shop in partnership with her spouse who knows about that kind of business.

This is her third MFP loan and she is happy to know that she’s being given access to a line of credit to advance with her business.  Because of this she commits to be responsible with her installment payments to continue in the future.  She also assures that she likes the work of her communal bank because she considers them to be a responsible, united group.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more soft-drinks at more convenient, wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy more soft-drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Juan, quien se dedica al transporte, y es el padre de sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y refrescos, para eso cuenta con una mesa que instala todos los días, por las mañanas, en el frontis de su casa. Se inició hace más de 2 años, con un capital propio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana para la atención. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tienen sus productos. Empezó a desarrollar este negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Por tanto, y viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea continuar hasta lograr establecer una tienda en su casa donde pueda exhibir con mayor comodidad todo lo que tiene para vender.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que responsables y muy solidarias entre sí. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará más frutas frescas (cítricos, bananas y otros) para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Patricia, 27, is a hardworking, dedicated woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Her spouse is Juan who works in transportation and who is the father of their two children who are 8 and 2 years old; they all live together in the house they worked hard to buy.

She sells fruit and soft-drinks.  To do so she sets up a table every morning in her front yard.  She started more than two years ago with her own capital and to date her sister helps her tend to customers.  She considers the business to be quite profitable because of the profits it nets and the high demand her products have.  She started the business because she needed to earn income to help her spouse with household expenses and to provide a better quality of life for her children.  Therefore, seeing the good results she’s been having, she wants to continue all the way to establishing a store at home where she can more comfortably display everything she has available for sale.

This is her third MFP loan and she thanks all the people who make the financing possible so she can continue towards making her plans a reality.  She also enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy fresh fruit (citrus fruit, bananas and others) to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit.

loans.name: Aba Yaa

texts.en:
Aba Yaa is a widow.  She has nine dependents; they lives together at Jukwa near Abura.  

Aba Yaa sells cooked yams.  She serves her cooked yams with vegetable stew.  This she has done for 10 years.   As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay her children's school fees. 

Aba Yaa will use the loan to buy more tubers of yams and vegetables to prepare her food for sale.   With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba Yaa plans to build a stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of yam and other vegetables to prepare her food to sell.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna sells farm tools at Jukwa near Abura. She has been into this business for ten years now.  She is married to a farmer and has four children. She uses her income to assist the husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Hanna will use her loan to buy different kinds of agriculture/farm tools to satisfy her customers. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of farm tools to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Munoru

texts.en:
Munoru is now 61 years old and still practicing dairy farming . His wife Rachael supports him in this business.  Their three children are well and still in school. His income is able to cater for his family's needs.

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. He plans to use the loan to buy animal feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will save toward his children's education. 

His dreams are to expand the farming business by buying another piece of land and to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Razhden

texts.en:
Razhden is 39 years old. He lives in Kutaisi District, West Georgia, with his big family:  his wife Natia, two sons (14 and 7 years old), and parents (pensioners) 

Razhden requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of insufficient income.

The main source of income for the family is its agricultural business. They have three milk cows. Part of the dairy products is consumed by family members, and the other part is sold on the local market. 

The average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including the monthly pensions of Razhden’s parents. According to the Credo estimation, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Razhden requested a loan from Credo to start-up a new business – he plans to construct a greenhouse. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing a business start-up and then restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor.  They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Razhden will buy construction materials for greenhouse construction. He will grow cucumbers, tomatoes, and greens in the greenhouse during the whole year. Natia and Razhden’s parents will be actively involved in the greenhouse works. The family will sell harvested vegetables and greens on local open market. 

The new business initiative will significantly increase the income of the family and contribute to improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Yaffa

texts.en:
Yaffa is a mother of three from Kibbutz Afik in northern Israel. She produces religious art designs including tallit covers, tablecloths, runners, and chala covers. 

Her work is professional, artistic, and well received. She has created a good name for her items and has a steady flow of customers.  She is currently expanding her business.

In order to increase her stock and business, Yaffa needed this loan to purchase professional sewing equipment, additional materials, and marketing materials.

Yaffa is working to strengthen her business and provide for her family. She wants to increase her monthly income by 30%.

loans.use: To buy professional sewing equipment and other materials.

loans.name: 0Sman S.

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Osman S.  He is married, and he has five children, aged 3, 10, 13, 15, and 18 years. Four are school-going children. 

In 1993, Osman S. established his clothing and shoes business. He began his business because he lost his father when he graduated from high school and there was no one to help him financially so he could further his education.  He joined a distant relative in the village for business.  

He started on local produce till he saved some amount that he set up his clothing business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le2,019,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. 

Osman S. requires a loan to buy jeans for men, 3 dozen @ Le540,000; t-shirts, 3 dozen @ Le420,000, and shoes, 12 pieces @ Le96,000.  The balance Le160,000 is for transportation. 

In the future, Osman S. plans to complete his unfinished building. An increase in prices of goods is his major problem.  

He is hardworking and competitive.  The previous loan has helped him a lot, and he is looking forward to acquiring subsequent loans.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, and shoes.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a dedicated mother who sells water in her neighborhood. She helps support her family financially thanks to the profits she accrues stemming from her first loan. Her family is naturally benefiting through the improvement in their living conditions.

Amina recently opened a charcoal store with the profits she made through the first loan. Because her customer base is growing, she is seeking a 50,000 KES loan from Yehu in order to buy larger stocks of charcoal to sell. She anticipates her store’s growth and her family’s enjoyment of a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy larger stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 35 años, es una mujer emprendedora, muy trabajadora y con deseos de superación. Su pareja desde hace 12 años es Américo, con quien tiene tres hijos de 18, 13 y 9 años. Juntos viven en la casa que construyó al lado de su pareja en base a mucho esfuerzo y constancia.

Su trabajo es la venta de comida. Todos los días prepara los más ricos y deliciosos potajes típicos de la región donde vive para ofrecerlos a la venta en la vereda de su casa desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche. Vive en una zona muy transitada y eso le permite vender todo lo que prepara. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hija, aunque generalmente lo hace sola, puesto que la mayor parte del tiempo sus hijos se dedican a sus actividades escolares. Lleva trabajando en esto hace 3 años y su único día de descanso es el sábado. Además de ello, hace 6 meses que empezó a dedicarse a la costura, esto le está generando un ingreso adicional.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cuotas de manera puntual, y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya ha observado que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, 500 soles, comprará algunos ingredientes e insumos como arroz, aceite y condimentos que usa a diario en la preparación de sus comidas. La mitad del dinero lo utilizará también en la compra de hilos, agujas y telas para la confección y refacción de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old.  She is an enterprising and very hardworking woman with desires for improvement.  Her partner of twelve years is Américo, with whom she has three children, ages 18, 13 and 9.  Together they live in the house that she built at her partner's side with a lot of effort and perseverance. 

She works in food sales.  Every day she prepares the richest and most delicious vegetable stews typical of the region where she lives in order to offer them for sale on the sidewalk of her house from 5:00 in the afternoon until 11:00 at night.  She lives in an very busy area and that permits her to sell everything that she prepares.  She works with the help of her daughter, although generally she does it by herself, since most of the time her children are devoted to their school activities.  She has been working at this for three years and her only day of rest is Saturday.  In addition to this, six months ago she began to also dedicate herself to sewing.  This has generated additional income for her.

This is her first loan with MFP and for that she is grateful to all of the people that have made her loan possible so that she can make her plans take shape.  On the other hand, she promises to comply with the payment of her installments in a punctual manner.  She is also very happy to belong to a communal bank.  She has already observed that all of the members are very responsible and supportive.

With the total requested, 500 soles (PEN), she will buy some ingredients and supplies like rice, oil and condiments that she uses on a daily basis in the preparation of her food.  Half of the money she will use also to buy threads, needles and fabric for the tailoring and alteration of clothing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for food preparation as well as threads, needles and fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina lives together with his husband and two children in Abrafo, near Abura. She is a seamstress, work she has done for two years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their rent and utility bills.

Georgina is applying for a 500 GHS loan from CRAN to be used to buy more fabric. With the new profits she anticipates, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fabric.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna tiene 23 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y con muchas metas que cumplir. Su pareja es Luis, con quien tiene una hija y actualmente se encuentra embarazada de 8 meses de su segundo bebé, eso la motiva a seguir esforzándose. Vive en la casa de su suegra, en una parte del terreno que ella le ha cedido para construir su vivienda.

Su trabajo es la venta de raspadillas (helados de hielo) de sabores de frutas tropicales. Trabaja en el parque de su barrio donde a diario instala una mesa con sus implementos. Tiene mucha demanda debido a las altas temperaturas del clima de su región. Prepara las raspadillas con esencia o almíbar de frutas frescas. Anteriormente trabajaba ella sola, ya que este trabajo no demanda mucho esfuerzo, pero por su estado ahora tiene el apoyo de su sobrina, eso le permite tener parte del día para poder descansar. Le gusta mucho lo que hace y espera continuar desarrollando esta actividad.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro. Asegura que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo responsable y unido.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará una máquina eléctrica de raspadilla para que su producto de venta sea mucho más delicioso y de mejor calidad, ya que actualmente tiene una máquina artesanal.
texts.en:
Giovanna, 23, is a woman who very much wants to get ahead and who has many goals to reach.  Her spouse is Luis and they have a daughter; Giovanna is currently 8 months’ pregnant with their second baby which motivates her to continue striving.  She lives in her mother-in-law’s house in a part of the property she gave them to build a house on.

Her work is selling shaved ice treats in tropical fruit flavors.  She works in her neighborhood park where she sets up a table daily with all the supplies.  She has much demand due to the high temperatures that are usual in her region.  She prepares the shaved ice with fresh fruit nectar or essence.  She used to work alone because this work isn’t very demanding but because of her current condition her niece helps her which lets her have part of the day available to rest.  She likes what she does very much and hopes to continue in business.

This is MFP loan #4 for her and she feels happy to know that she will have access to a line of credit to advance with her business.  Because of this she commits to be responsible with her installment payments to continue in the future.  She assures that she likes the work of her communal bank because she considers them to be a responsible, united group.

She will use the requested 1200 new soles to buy an electric shaved ice making machine so that the product she sells will be much more delicious and of better quality since she currently only has an artisanal machine.

loans.use: to buy an electric shaved ice maker.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 31 years old, single and supports a member of her family. She has a beauty salon that has been in operation for four years and earns her a monthly income of 50,000 KES.

This will be Jackline’s first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more products for her salon. She will use the anticipated profit to add stock to her business.

Jackline’s ambitions are to build up her salon and have a family.

loans.use: to buy more products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta tiene 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora. Su pareja desde hace mucho tiempo es Pablo, con quien tiene tres hijos de 15, 8 y 6 años. Vive en la casa que lograron construir con el fruto de su esfuerzo y años de ahorro.

Tiene una bodega instalada en su casa desde hace 4 años, trabaja generalmente sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que los beneficia a todos. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades del hogar, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre hay clientes interesados en su productos y vende al por mayor a los comerciantes que también tiene como clientes. Tiene muchas ganas de seguir superándose y expandir su negocio hasta convertirse en una empresaria exitosa.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad que le permitan abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Julieta, 34, is a hardworking, very enterprising woman.  Her long-time partner is Pablo with whom she has three children who are 15, 8 and 6 years old.  She lives in a house they were able to build after long years of work and saving.

She has had a grocery store installed at home for four years.  She usually works alone but on occasion gets help from her children; she feels happy to be able to share a business that benefits all of them.  She enjoys her work because it gives her free time to do other household chores.  The store generates good profits because there are always customers interested in the products she sells and she also sells at wholesale to merchants who are her customers too.  She very much wants to continue improving and expanding her business to become a successful businesswoman.

This is her second MFP loan and she thanks all those who make the loan possible so she can continue towards her objectives.  On her part, she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She is very happy to be part of her communal bank because all the members are very kind, supportive people.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy larger amounts of groceries and basic staple items to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine tiene 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial. Su pareja desde hace 18 años es Wilter, quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es el padre de sus tres hijos de 18, 16 y 7 años. Juntos viven su casa propia, en compañía de los padres de Catherine.

Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y refrescos preparados con frutas de la selva. Cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos a la temperatura que es del agrado de sus clientes, a quienes atiende desde su casa. Tiene más de 3 años dedicándose a este oficio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su hija para la atención. Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos que le genera, además de poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y atender a sus hijos, a quienes quiere mucho. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, vende comida los fines de semana. Considera que ambas actividades le son rentables, por eso tiene planes de continuar y además incursionar en otro negocio que sería la venta de comida rápida con la ayuda de su hermana.

Este es su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera que es un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas, así como frutas para la preparación de sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old. She is a hard-working and persistent woman, in addition to being happy and friendly. Her partner for 18 years is Wilter, who works in civil construction and is the father of her three children aged 7, 16, and 18. Together they live in their own house along with Catherine's parents.

She sells sodas and soft drinks made with jungle fruit. She has a refrigerator where she keeps her products at the temperature her customers like. She waits on customers in her home. She has been doing this work for more than 3 years, and up to now she has had her daughter's help with waiting on customers. She likes her business because of the income it generates and because she is able to be in the comfort of her home and take care of her children, whom she loves very much. In addition to this activity, she sells food on the weekends. She considers both activities to be profitable for her, so she has plans to continue and also move into another business, which will be selling fast food with the help of her sister.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. She thanks all the people who make her loan possible, since this way she will feel secure in moving forward with her business. On the other hand, she likes her communal bank, since she considers it to be a united and supportive group. With the amount requested of 1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase various flavors and brands of soda, as well as fruit for the preparation of her soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase sodas and fruit to make her soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 35 años, es una mujer emprendedora, amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 10 años es José, junto a él tiene tres hijos de 15, 10 y 6 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la que obtuvieron gracias a su trabajo constante.
Hace 2 años tiene una bodega en su casa donde vende abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad. Compra su mercadería cada tres días, al por mayor, en el mercado principal de la ciudad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da independencia para hacer otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que siempre hay personas que quieren ir a solicitar algún producto al crédito y al momento establecido para pagarle, no lo hacen, por ese motivo prefiere vender ahora todo al contado. Espera hacer crecer aun más su negocio y espera poder seguir trabajando como lo hizo hasta ahora.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y agradece a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de contar con un capital de negocio. Le gusta mucho trabajar con este grupo y su asesor, ya que hasta ahora se mostraron todos responsables.
Con el préstamo solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará más abarrotes para tener en stock y algunos otros productos para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Karina, 35, is an enterprising, kind, very hardworking woman.  Her partner for the last ten years has been José; they have three children together who are 15, 10 and 6 years old.  They live together in their own house that they acquired through constant, hard work.

She’s had a grocery store at home for two years where she sells groceries and other basic staple items.  She buys her merchandise every three days at wholesale in the city’s main market.  What she likes about her work is the independence it gives her to do other things but what she doesn’t  like is that there are always people asking to buy on credit and when it comes time to pay her back they don’t do so which is why she now sells only for cash.  She hopes to make the business grow still more and hopes to continue to work like she’s done to date.

This is her first MFP loan and she thanks the people who make this opportunity to have working capital available.  She likes working with this group and with her advisor very much since to date they’ve all been responsible.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy more groceries to have in stock as well as some other items to stock her store.

loans.use: she will buy more groceries and other items to have in stock in her store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable. Su pareja desde hace 20 años es Niel, quien es comerciante y el padre de sus tres hijos de 17, 14 y 12 años.
Su actividad es la venta de productos de belleza (cosméticos, cremas,  perfumes, entre otros). Los productos los adquiere por catálogo y los vende desde su casa entre sus amistades, familiares y vecinos. Tiene más de 5 años dedicándose a este negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Trabaja todos los días, generalmente por las tardes, mientras que en su casa tiene un mostrador en el que exhibe todos sus productos. Le gusta su negocio por el tiempo libre que le sobra para dedicarse a otras actividades, además de ser un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar. 

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más cosméticos, perfumes, cremas y otros, para tener un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en: Nelly is 48 years old and is a very hardworking, dedicated, cheerful and friendly woman. Her partner of 20 years is Niel, who is a merchant and the father of her three children aged 12, 14 and 17. Her business is selling beauty products such as cosmetics, creams, perfumes and other items. She buys her products from catalogs and sells them from her home to her friends, neighbors and relatives. She has worked in this business for over 5 years and has been working as a solo entrepreneur. She works every day, generally in the afternoons. In her home she has a showcase in which she exhibits all of her products. She likes this business because it allows for free time that she can dedicate to other activities. She also is grateful to have a source of income to be able to support her partner in meeting the household expenses. This is her third loan with the institution MFP. She wishes to thank all of those who are making it possible to obtain this loan, which will help her meet her goals. On another note, she says that she is very happy with her communal bank, since she knows the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people. With the funds she is seeking, 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy more cosmetics, perfumes, creams and other items so that she will have inventory to sell.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics, perfumes, creams and other items so that she will have inventory to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo tiene 60 años, está separado hace muchos de quien fue su pareja, tiene siete hijos que son ya mayores. Vive solo desde hace 6 años en la casa que logró construir en base a mucho esfuerzo.
Su trabajo es la reparación y mantenimiento de motos y motocarros. Tiene su taller instalado en su casa y ahí se encarga de arreglar todos los vehículos. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 15 años y trabaja con la ayuda de dos mecánicos. Tiene un buen acceso al público, ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy concurrida y de fluido tránsito vehicular. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, no en vano lleva tantos años en ese rubro, eso le ha permitido ganarse el respeto de sus clientes y consolidarse. Para el futuro espera implementar su taller con muchas más herramientas para que su trabajo se ejecute con mejores resultados y en menos tiempo de lo establecido. 

Este es su préstamo número 8 con MFP, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento. Sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, y está contento de pertenecer su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará algunas piezas y repuestos que usa en la refacción de vehículos como embragues, cadenas, rodajes, llantas y otros.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 60 years old and has been separated from his wife for many years.  He has seven adult children and has been living alone for the past six years, in the home that he managed to build through his efforts.

He works in repairing and maintaining motorcycles and moto-cars and has a workshop in his home, where he fixes all the vehicles.  He has been doing this for nearly 15 years and has two helpers.  He has good access to customers and is in a location with a large flow of vehicle traffic.  He likes this line of work and he has many years in this field.  This has allowed him to win his customers’ respect and to consolidate himself.   In the future he wants to open a workshop with many more tools so that he can do his work with better results and in less time than at present.

This will be his 8th loan through MFP, therefore he appreciates all those who continue to trust in him in granting a new loan.  He knows that he must be very responsible and above all on time with his payments.  He is happy to be a part of his communal bank because everyone there is united.

He will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy some pieces and spare parts, such as clutches, chains, bearings, tires, and other things that he uses to repair vehicles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y amable, además de trabajadora y decidida. Es soltera, pero tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años. Vive en la propia que compró con mucho esfuerzo tras largos años de trabajo intenso.

A diario prepara los más ricos postres peruanos como “arroz con leche”, “suspiro a la limeña”, “dulce de calabaza”, “pie de limón”, “flan”, “pudín”, “leche asada” entre otros. Los mismos que pone a la venta en un puesto que ha obtenido en el mercado principal de la ciudad. Su especialidad es la “mazamorra morada” con la cual ha logrado llegar a convencer hasta al paladar más amargo. Lleva en este trabajo más de 2 años, trabaja sola y en ocasiones con la ayuda de hija mayor que colabora en la atención de los clientes. Le gusta mucho el oficio que desarrolla porque siente que es gratificante ver a sus clientes alegrase con un postre dulce y cambiar de ánimo. Afirma que no cambiará este trabajo por ningún otro, ya que además le brinda buenas ganancias que le ayudan a pagar todos los gastos que se presentan en el día a día. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará vasos y cucharitas descartables para vender sus postres. También comprará los ingredientes que necesita como azúcar, maíz morado, arroz, leche y otros.
texts.en:
Marleni, 40, is a very cheerful, kind woman in addition to being hardworking and determined.  She’s single but has two children who are 17 and 12 years old.  She lives in her own house that she was able to buy after long years of hard work.

She makes delicious Peruvian desserts like rice pudding, caramel meringue parfait, candied pumpkin, lemon pie, flan, pudding and baked milk pudding, among others.  She sells them in a stand she has in the city’s main market.  Her specialty is “mazamorra morada” [pudding-like dessert made with purple corn and fruit] with which she’s succeeded in convincing even those who don’t like sweets.

She’s been in business more than two years and works alone although sometimes her oldest daughter helps her with customer service.  She likes her occupation very much because it’s gratifying to see her customers enjoying a sweet dessert and watching their moods lighten.  She states that she wouldn’t change this job for any other because in addition it produces good profits that help her pay for daily expenses that arise.

This is her first MFP loan and she’s grateful to all those who make the loan possible so that she can continue towards her objectives.  She commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very kind, supportive people.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy disposable glasses and spoons to sell her desserts.  She will also buy ingredients like sugar, purple maize, rice, milk and others that she needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Abu K.

texts.en:
Abu K., 49, is a hardworking and committed businessman. He is married and has six children aged 6, 8, 12, 18, 20 and 25 years. Three of them are going to school.

When Abu K. was a teenager, he lived with his uncle who was a trader in a large city. His father sent him there because he wanted his son to continue his schooling, which Abu K. did. But because of his stubbornness, he dropped out of high school. His uncle thought it would be better to hire his nephew instead of seeing him waste his life doing nothing.

In 1997 Abu K. went on to establish a motor bike and spare parts business, which turned out to be a successful venture. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he now earns about 1,157,000 SLL a month. Tax levies on his goods are his major financial problem.

Abu K. says ARD’s credit service will help him a lot. He is applying for a 5,000,000 SLL loan to purchase two 2,500,000 SLL bikes. He knows this investment will help his business.

In the future, Abu K. plans to open another outlet for his spare parts. The loan will help a lot as it will enable him to make more money. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase two 2,500,000 SLL bikes to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 29 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabajadora y muy carismática. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos de 11, 9 y 1 años. Todos viven en la casa que logró obtener con ayuda de su cónyuge como resultado de su esfuerzo y trabajo.

Su actividad es la venta de comida rápida. A diario instala el asador en el prepara los mas deliciosos pollos fritos con los que deleita a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días en la casa de su madre porque está ubicada en una zona muy concurrida. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 4 años y lo hace con ayuda de su madre y su cuñada.
